#522SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Jankles
what profession do you guys think would go best with a tank DK?

I was thinking mining and JC or BS. you'll get the extra HP from mining, but i don't know if JC would be better or BS, or another option which I have not yet considered. Thanks.
#523SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Lazare
Just looking at stamina for simplicity:
  • JCing lets you use [Solid Dragon's Eye] instead of [Solid Sky Sapphire] in 3 slots, which is worth 51 stamina. Database mining indicates that when epic gems are released the relevant cut will probably be [Solid Majestic Zircon], if so that cuts the JC advantage to 33 stamina.
  • BSing lets you add two extra sockets. That's currently worth 48 stamina, and might climb to 60 stamina with epic gems.
  • Enchanting nets 48 stamina via ring enchants.
  • Mining is 50 stamina
  • Leatherworking, as of the next minor patch, gives 50 more stamina than the best bracer enchant

Of those the "best" is probably the JC/BS combo - since there's a wide variety of gem options it means you can be much more flexible with gear choices. By contrast both enchanting and leatherworking only offer AP as an alternative to stamina, which isn't very useful for a tank. Mining, of course, is only stamina. Then again, Mining is easy to level and might even make you money.
#524SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3MissnL1nK
This question is aimed at the Death Knights that have been pvp'n since release. I have always pvp'd heavily on my rogue, holding a rating of usually around 2200 in 2's. I have rerolled this DK for tanking purposes and I have done no pvp at all since I rerolled but I enjoy my DK enough that I want this to be my main in pvp as well.

My question is what pvp builds at the moment seem the most efficient overall for a 2v2, 3v3 environment. The team I will more than likely be running is with my priest friend (disc) in 2's, and with a hunter in 3's.
#525SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feorthas
Originally Posted by MissnL1nK
This question is aimed at the Death Knights that have been pvp'n since release. I have always pvp'd heavily on my rogue, holding a rating of usually around 2200 in 2's. I have rerolled this DK for tanking purposes and I have done no pvp at all since I rerolled but I enjoy my DK enough that I want this to be my main in pvp as well.

My question is what pvp builds at the moment seem the most efficient overall for a 2v2, 3v3 environment. The team I will more than likely be running is with my priest friend (disc) in 2's, and with a hunter in 3's.
No idea; however, there is a relevant DK thread in the PvP forum that might have an answer for you. If I recall, DKs are looking like the solid "fifth guy" in 5s, ok in 3s, and way up in the air in 2s as they can't be built into a "survive and outlast" team (they have no way of actively burning mana, or even entering melée range after DG is used). Theory goes that they'll be rather durable as 'stance' swaps aren't as bad as a warrior or Druid, allowing them to turtle up in frost AND pop defensive CDs if they get focused.

My personal experience in BGs hint at fears and stuns being a proble moreso than "simple" kiting (DG + CoI is really good for keeping someone close-ish) as IBF won't break a stun so it must be used proactively. IMO, DKs will turn into the early focus target simply because of their utter lack of stun breaks and sole fear break.

#531SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Torrential
Originally Posted by Darian_TruBlade
From the DPS Compendium, Section 4.1:

Basically if you use a rune in the 2 seconds after it comes off cooldown it acts as though you used it immediately off cooldown. There's a little more in that section of the DPS Compendium that might help you if you're still having trouble conceptualizing this.
The Compendium seems to have vanished.

Anyway, this doesn't actually create a sub-10 second cooldown if you're using your runes the instant they're off CD right? It's just a grace period of sorts? I'm just trying to make sure I'm understanding some timings right while I'm thinking about my plans for 80.

If I use a rune at 0 seconds, it's ready at 10. If I use it the instant it's ready at 10 it's ready at 20. But if I use it at 11.5-12 it's still ready at 20.

Is that correct?
#532SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Darian_TruBlade
Originally Posted by Torrential
The Compendium seems to have vanished.

Anyway, this doesn't actually create a sub-10 second cooldown if you're using your runes the instant they're off CD right? It's just a grace period of sorts? I'm just trying to make sure I'm understanding some timings right while I'm thinking about my plans for 80.

If I use a rune at 0 seconds, it's ready at 10. If I use it the instant it's ready at 10 it's ready at 20. But if I use it at 11.5-12 it's still ready at 20.

Is that correct?
It looks like everything in the Compendium was moved to TTT. Link here.

You have it basically correct, except that the time range isn't 11.5-12, but 10-12.

#535SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3drake_rocket
Frost AoE and Single-Target Threat Generation
Afternoon.


I am curious as to what the standard suggestions are for raid-level single-target and AoE threat generation for a frost build. I am at times having difficulty with a typical IT-PS-BS-BS-OB-runepower rotation and wondering if I should employ something different.

And for AoE naturally D&D-IT-Pest-HB requires a cooldown everytime it's used. Thus I'd like an alternative...and suggestions for how to continue to maintain threat after the start. Simply wait for D&D each time? I constantly hear blood boil being suggested, but I find it sub-par in terms of damage....is there some built in bonus threat to it I am missing?

Further I am curious as to how big of an impact your weapon's DPS has on your threat. It's formidable, I understand, but I was curious if anyone knows more specifically (Say comparing a 130 dps two hander to a 180 or 200).


Thank you very much.

Originally Posted by drake_rocket
Afternoon.


I am curious as to what the standard suggestions are for raid-level single-target and AoE threat generation for a frost build. I am at times having difficulty with a typical IT-PS-BS-BS-OB-runepower rotation and wondering if I should employ something different.

Thank you very much.
I recently got Demise and my threat generation went up dramatically. So to answer your question, yes a weapon's dps makes a big difference from what I can tell from my own experience. As for BB I think its value is going to go down some once the cooldown comes off of Pest.

#549SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3dreadai
Originally Posted by Lyssa
I got my DK to 80 yesterday and attempted to tank some dungeons with guildies, all kitted out in mainly Naxx 25 year. My AoE threat is sufficient I noted, but my single target threat falls short. I was wondering what the highest TPS point-per-point talents were so that I could adjust my spec slightly to cope with my buddy's high dps? I tried the search function but I'm not sure if I even used the right words as I couldn't find an answer. (I realize Frost supposedly has better single target TPS but I'm not interested in that drastic a respec just yet.)

My current spec as on Armory (I misclicked Night of the Dead, so I'll need to respec anyway!): 5/11/55

If anyone could point me to a list where the TPS of each talent is weighed in % it would be much appreciated (if such a list exists), or if you just could give me advice on which talent to max out.
Your lack of ability to hold threat *the day after you ding 80* against people in NAXX 25 gear?
Tyhere is no spec to fix that, you need a high dps weapon and hit/expertise cap + some better tps gear than you will have gathered from levelling up.

To draw comparisons, in TBC would you have expected a new 70 to stroll into a SSC raid and hold aggro from a full raid nuke at Morogrim? or to do the same at supremus? While DKs are pretty 'imba' in places, they aren't automagically godlike.

As an aside, the one major concern that the DK tank community has, is the lack of Single Target threat in *all* specs. Especially as raids gear into Naxx25/Malygos25 gear. I'd suggest scouring the Tank thread on this forum for info, but also have a look at one of the many 'bluetracers' like MMO-Champion BlueTracker

I'd suggest a build like this: Talent Calculator - World of Warcraft

Basically an Unholy dps build, (sans the pet talents), with some tank talents. You don't need Lichborne as much as you need threat, and you can put all of the points in Frost into DPS talents. (This is just so you can maximize threat.)

Pets do not contribute to TPS at all. Until you are geared up drop the pet talents. I see no problem losing Shadow of Death because it sounds like your friends out-gear the heroics and the extra stamina won't count for much.

Remember UB and DnD are good for single target threat as well as AE threat.

#559SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Melchior
Simple yes or no question: do our Blood and Unholy presences still have the .8 threat aura modifier attached to them? Wowhead still lists it as there, but some of the information there is often not updated for a while.

As a follow-up, would Subversion be multiplicative or additive with that passive effect?
#560SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Zurai
Originally Posted by Melchior
Simple yes or no question: do our Blood and Unholy presences still have the .8 threat aura modifier attached to them? Wowhead still lists it as there, but some of the information there is often not updated for a while.

As a follow-up, would Subversion be multiplicative or additive with that passive effect?
Yes, both presences still have the passive threat reduction built in. As with all other percent-based effects in the game, they stack multiplicatively, for a total of 40% threat reduction.

#578SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Navaros
Haste underrated?
I've recently come to a gear decision that I had to choose between (65haste) and (4str+6hit+28crit) for a 51/13/7 specced DK. Having read most of the theorycrafting articles on DKs I was expecting the second option to outweigh the haste without problems. However, when I switched from option 1 to option 2 I witnessed an overall dps decrease of 10, thus 65haste>4str+6hit+28crit. Or using the numbers in the dps compendium that would mean that 65haste>58.2618 or 1haste>0.8963. Comparing this to the number in the compendium (0.564) that is about 60% more. And finally to get to my question - is it possible that haste is actually quite underrated for DKs and are there simulations working on that?
#579SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Afabar
If I look at your armory you have 350 hit rating that means that HIT value is 0 for you.
So you compare 65 haste with 4str+28crit
According to the compendium, this should be
65*0,5640 compare to 4*2,5570 + 28*1,1453
36,66 EAP to 42,2964 EAP

Those are very close number, as your 10 more DPS.

And also, on the compendium there is this note :
Keep in mind this is vulnerable to change as we are still building up the theorycraft around gearing a Death Knight. Use this as a guideline, rather than all-to-be-guide.
Maybe you could explain a little bit how you have test your DPS change. If it was 5 minutes on the 80 training dummy or 1 hour on the l83 dummy. I would also add that 10 DPS is a very small variation to established fact. This is about 0.5% of your DPS
#580SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Navaros
By no means am I trying to undermine the work of EJ and I do understand that these numbers are not 100% final. I am just trying to point out something interesting I noticed that seems to contradict the current commonly-accepted valuations. Even calculating without the hit as you showed we get that the smaller EAP value of 36,66 belongs to haste, which however, grants more dps (altho not a lot more). The tests I did were 5-minute ones on the l83dummy.

Another interesting thing that I noted in these tests is a trend of about 100dps more while dpsing in unholy presence as compared to blood presence. This pushed me even harder into thinking that haste has a higher value.

If I look at your armory you have 350 hit rating that means that HIT value is 0 for you.
Also, this is not entirely correct since I am not spell hit capped so HIT should have at least a small EAP value.
#581SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Petersen
Does Rune of Razor Ice gain benefit from the talent Black Ice?
#582SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feorthas
Unless you are a Trispec DW build that focuses on spelldamage, you really want to avoid having more hit than the 2H cap--it really isn't worthwhile compared to Expertise or AP; by my math, effectiveness plummets from 2.17 DPS/0.1% Hit at 7.9% to 0.54 DPS/0.1% Hit at 8% (Frost). The same amount of AP (6.75) still nets 1.64 DPS.

In fact, the only reason Trispecs really bring hit to/near 17% is because it still helps their white damage a noticeable amount.
#583SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3huntcaudata
Does having a DK tank with acclimation prevent a raid from getting "The 100 club"? That is, does the temporary resist bonus from the talent count against the achievement?

#585SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Torrential
Originally Posted by Feorthas
Unless you are a Trispec DW build that focuses on spelldamage, you really want to avoid having more hit than the 2H cap--it really isn't worthwhile compared to Expertise or AP; by my math, effectiveness plummets from 2.17 DPS/0.1% Hit at 7.9% to 0.54 DPS/0.1% Hit at 8% (Frost). The same amount of AP (6.75) still nets 1.64 DPS.

In fact, the only reason Trispecs really bring hit to/near 17% is because it still helps their white damage a noticeable amount.
I just want to get it out there that 'Trispec' is not really the same thing as DW anymore. Most DW builds have no, or very very few Blood points now. Just another point in my war against obsolete or flawed preconceptions.
#586SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Crowmeister
Might have been asked before but not quite easy to search for, but what are the most intresting stats for us?
First we hit the hit max but after that? STR>CRIT>AP>HASTE?
#587SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Lanky
Originally Posted by Crowmeister
Might have been asked before but not quite easy to search for, but what are the most intresting stats for us?
First we hit the hit max but after that? STR>CRIT>AP>HASTE?

You have to promise me that you will go to the Theorycrafting Think Tank after you read this and read the Deathknight DPS entry after reading this post.

For DPS: HIT raing to cap and never above (8%) > STR > CRIT > Expertise to 5.6% ... ------> +AP>, haste, arpen.

However, Gearing is not that simple. In your search for the best items, it is better to learn what stats to avoid than it is to know what stats to value slightly over others.

IE: Strength and crit are both great for DPS. We know STR is better because it scales with our ghoul, with Blessing of Kings, and with talents. But what is more important is knowing that you want to avoid ratings like Arpen and hit above 8%, because their benefits are awful for you.
#588SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Crowmeister
Originally Posted by Lanky
You have to promise me that you will go to the Theorycrafting Think Tank after you read this and read the Deathknight DPS entry after reading this post.

For DPS: HIT raing to cap and never above (8%) > STR > CRIT > Expertise to 5.6% ... ------> +AP>, haste, arpen.

However, Gearing is not that simple. In your search for the best items, it is better to learn what stats to avoid than it is to know what stats to value slightly over others.

IE: Strength and crit are both great for DPS. We know STR is better because it scales with our ghoul, with Blessing of Kings, and with talents. But what is more important is knowing that you want to avoid ratings like Arpen and hit above 8%, because their benefits are awful for you.
Thanks for the explanation, that Think Tank thread is exactly what I was looking for but couldnt find it in the DK forum. Awefull searching skills
#589SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Maltball

#590SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Lazare
Originally Posted by Maltball
as unholy raiding spec, i was gonna major glyph: SS, Ghoul, IT .... is that the typical way to go or better options?
This is typical. Some people drop IT for something else, usually Bone Armor. I think the consensus is that IT is the better glyph overall unless you're going to try and OT without changing your glyphs.

Edit 2: math was bad
Fallen Crusader is far better.
#593SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fireflash38
About what mitigation level would it be wise to consider going Unholy Tank Spec from Frost?

Currently, self-buffed I am at about 40% dodge/parry, and am considering trying an Unholy spec. Also, could someone please link a good spec for Unholy tanking?
#594SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feorthas
Originally Posted by Fireflash38
About what mitigation level would it be wise to consider going Unholy Tank Spec from Frost?

Currently, self-buffed I am at about 40% dodge/parry, and am considering trying an Unholy spec. Also, could someone please link a good spec for Unholy tanking?
After the next patch this becomes really murky again. I'd highly suggest sitting tight until second/third looks can be taken at the changes to see if it's even worthwhile to swap to Unholy. Heck, to be honest, Blood seems to be the most *interesting* tanking tree after the changes simply because it does things so differently.

Regardless, the current napkin math seems to be suggesting that Frost will be better than Unholy overall but Unholy will still be superior at tanking casters due to Bone Armor's universal damage reduction on spells and their talents that buff overall resist, AMS, and AMZ (even though AMZ is the weakest of the three spell-soaking options).

#599SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pyros
There is a better option for minors, and it's Pestilence. Both for tanking and DPSing. And for PvP. It's the best minor glyph DKs get. IBF is pretty useless in my opinion for raid tanking, good for PvP though. You're never going to be that RP starved, and if you are you have 2 options to get RP back fast, empower rune weapon and bloodtap. Unbreakable glyph is good, or Frost Strike for threat, if you're going frost. Both much better choices in my opinion than IBF.

Edit: Talking about the next patch versions of FS and UA.

Due to my lack of knowledge of the DK class i just took it and well, fine.
But now there are of tests, maths and so on out, especially in this very forum and there is one rotation that comes out on top (actually I haven't found any other): IT - PS (or reverse, but for the purpose of leveling, I start with IT) - BS - BS - SSx4 with runedumps between 1st and 2nd, and 2nd and 3rd if there's time.
I spent so much time testing, but I just don't see the "standard" rotation that is mentioned in this forum to come out on top. I just do a little more DPS with the first one.

#602SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Lanky
@Ripaine:

1. That's not a simple question.

2. Theorycrafting Thinktank ----> Death Knight DPS Compendium.
3. Look, it is perfectly alright to come here with a basic question or a weird one that you can't really search an answer for, but rotations for leveling? Are you kidding me? The only reason you ever cast Scourge strike before blood strike as Unholy is because using SS early will the kill the mob faster. But seriously, having a rotation for leveling is absurd.

4. Death Knights are the best leveling and PvE aoe class in the game at the moment. you could chain plaguestrikes for all I care, you would still kill the mob. Testing for an optimal leveling rotation is absurd. Apply your diseases and fatfinger some strikes.
#603SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ripaine
I don't want to find the best leveling spec, I was just confused, because my DPS on Dummies and Bosses was lower with my first rotation than with the standard one. I try to min/max, so it's one of the things that bothers me so much.

I'm sorry, really thought it was a simple question and I just miss something.

PS: I can't test on 80 DKs, maybe I can get some of the guilds DKs to test it.
#604SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Lanky
Originally Posted by Ripaine
I don't want to find the best leveling spec, I was just confused, because my DPS on Dummies and Bosses was lower with my first rotation than with the standard one. I try to min/max, so it's one of the things that bothers me so much.

I'm sorry, really thought it was a simple question and I just miss something.

PS: I can't test on 80 DKs, maybe I can get some of the guilds DKs to test it.
Take my advice and wait on the min-maxing until your DK is max level, the class is actually very hard to maximize DPS on, so hard as to be almost impossible, since the real min-maxing comes down to a very refined command of rune timers, the GCD, your runic power (not going over the max with abilities), a priority based rotation, and then obviously gearing and gemming.

Enjoy the easy mode leveling experience, this enitre forum generally recommends Unholy-based leveling for 'On a Pale Horse', Boneshield and SS. Take wandering Plague and mow down massive packs of dudes. Leveling doens't get much faster.

#607SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pyros
Originally Posted by Mortesque
Is there a parry/dodge cap? If so, what is the value?
There's no cap, however values suffer from diminishing returns so the more you have the least you gain from ratings. See the general class mechanics forum for the rating at 80 post which explains it in details.

#611SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Caladfel
Disease refreshing - after or before
Howdy.

As Blood (51/13/7), should I refresh my diseases before they drop or should I let them tick to the end and then refresh them?

Thanks.
#612SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feorthas
Originally Posted by Caladfel
Howdy.

As Blood (51/13/7), should I refresh my diseases before they drop or should I let them tick to the end and then refresh them?

Thanks.
I don't know if Blood has any of the +Damage when a disease is up talents but those talents are what should make your decision for you; if you have one or more talents that increases your damage, by at least a moderate amount, then try to refresh said diseases prior to them dropping. If not, refresh them as soon as you have a free GCD.

#617SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Xequecal
Does anyone know if the Toughness talents (Warrior, Shaman, Paladin) will reduce the duration of Frost Fever if you have Chilblains talented? This seems rather relevant in PvP, especially since Paladins can potentially combo it with Pure of Heart to cut Frost Fever down to sub-3 second duration, if Toughness affects it.
#618SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Talibb
Chillblains is a seperate debuff applied at the same time you apply frost fever, so the duration or Frost Fever should not be affected by talents like toughness.
#619SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Bibdy
Originally Posted by Trigonous
I've been hearing a lot lately about the two new Blacksmithing "swords," but I hadn't seen them since they aren't in the patch notes. I just got onto the PTR today and took a look at 'em. It is nice that they're giving us some tanking weapon love, but is it worth it? From everything else I've heard, Death Knight tanks are supposed to get a big heavy-hitting DPS weapon to keep threat that maybe has some stamina and agility on it. If you're already defense capped, is it worth grabbing the Defender? And since parry isn't that great anyway, is the Deflector worth it at all?
Blizzard said they were considering 3 things to help newbie DKs reach the defense 'cap' (or 'floor', or whatever you want to define 540 defense skill as): Sigils, a Runeforge enchant and weapons. Wouldn't you know it, they decided to go with all 3.

That's what the weapons are directed towards, but the Defender is a very good weapon for pure avoidance, despite its low DPS and item level compared to other weapons you can pick up in N or H Naxxramas. Actually, its the best weapon for pure avoidance if you don't need to worry about your threat generation as much (e.g. Patchwerk), so I hope they make it BOE before it gets rolled off the PTR and I can get my hands on one without having to drop LW.

Personally, I don't think they're necessary (the runeforge and sigil are MORE than enough to get a newbie DK to 540 defense skill with only a rudimentary amount of effort), nor do I think its a good idea to release them. People will probably start complaining "I can't pick up Death's Bite because I can't afford to drop the 90 defense rating on this thing!", then they release even more powerful 2H tanking weapons in the form of boss drops, and then you get raids constantly DEing that "God damned 2H tanking sword" again.

And no, stay the hell away from the Titansteel Deflector.

#621SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Lanky
What is with you people and pretend-simple questions?

2Hand Unholy is currently the best single target DPS spec until a certain level of gear is reached ( a level we haven't seen yet). Some would argue that Dual-wielding is on par with Unholy, but I very much doubt it, despite the recount parses. Blood scales better than Unholy, and will surpass it once gear levels rise.
#622SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Zubras
I tried....
Originally Posted by Lanky
What is with you people and pretend-simple questions?
I tried to K.I.S.S. without asking all the math behind the DPS output since the math is there for the viewing.

#623SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feorthas
Originally Posted by Zubras
I tried to K.I.S.S. without asking all the math behind the DPS output since the math is there for the viewing.

Now what I need to do is work on getting my DPS ramped up. It currently is all over the place ranging for 1.1k to 2.2k. Trying to keep it on the higher end but having a hell of a time doing that.
That's all fair and good, however you did pretty much say "these are some of my stats, make me better at dps" (rather politely but still). This isn't really the thread for questions that vague. Had it been "these are my stats, should I go for more hit or crit?" (or something like that) this would've been the perfect thread.

And, yes, dump some hit for crit; you only need 8% these days and I *think* that 302 is over that number. The best option would be, of course, to swap some gems around since you can convert ratings at a 1:1 ratio that way.

For future reference, go grab Rawr from the general Class Mechanics forum, load your charcter in, and swap your rotation to the Unholy option. It should get you some good gear reccomendations as far as general upgrades go. The one caveat is that it thinks that Death Knights are pallies so you have to load upgrades from armory and then make our T7 wearable by a paladin to see how they compare.

Sigils - Items - World of Warcraft

Everything with a required level of 74 shown there is going to be added in patch 3.0.8.

Also, they will be adding a Sigil that procs +defense rating every time you cast icy touch.
#626SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pyros
Originally Posted by Trigonous
Sigil? They're finally coming out with a new Sigil? I hadn't heard of this yet, what is it and how can you get it? (Again not in the PTR patch notes, arg).
Badge vendor, same price as the current DPS sigil(15badges I think?), everytime you casts Icy touch, it will give you a 30secs +54def rating buff.
#627SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Crackensan
What is the DW hit cap now?
#628SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pyros
Originally Posted by Crackensan
What is the DW hit cap now?
19+8=27%
8% is the miss rate for specials, that's really all you need for DW DPS. For tanking it's another story, but you probably can't stack too much without losing more important stats anyway.
#629SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Crackensan

I would like to assume about 450ish?
#630SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pyros

I would like to assume about 450ish?
918.
#631SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
I'm seeing a lot of stat conversion weights being thrown around, and I'm curious about how they are calculated. Simple things like Strength vs. AP I can understand, but I don't know how people are deriving weights for other stats, a la crit and haste.
#632SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by Darkside
I'm seeing a lot of stat conversion weights being thrown around, and I'm curious about how they are calculated. Simple things like Strength vs. AP I can understand, but I don't know how people are deriving weights for other stats, a la crit and haste.
Once you have a spreadsheet that can estimate dps from stats, it's easy to modulate stats and make estimates of their value. There are several such spreadsheets floating around for various specs.
#633SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3dravok
Should a DK have gear for tanking and gear for DPS and which one should a DK work on when they reach 80?
#634SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by dravok
Should a DK have gear for tanking and gear for DPS and which one should a DK work on when they reach 80?
This is entirely based on your own personal preference and/or the needs of your guild. Thus far, it seems as though about half the DKs have become tanks and the other half have chosen to pursue DPS. Most people, however, do a collect an "offspec" gearset that they will use when they are not required to tank or they need to OT (Patchwerk is a good example of this).

#637SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feorthas
Originally Posted by fps100
Hello! If I recall correctly hit rating was worth 2.4 ap for unholy death knight before melee/special cap. I'm wondering how useful it is after that cap? I got some gear with quite a bit of hit on it (not gems) and I just noticed I'm spell hit capped with virulence.
Hit becomes worth very, very little after the 8% needed to cap melée and specials; if you're dual wielding, the story is probably different but I don't think you want to pass talented Spell Hit cap (so 13-14% melée).

#640SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by dravok
I have information on gear I should be collecting for tanking but is there a site for info on gear for OT or Patchwerk spec?
We have an entire thread in these very forums dedicated to discussing the various aspects of tanking. I suggest you read through it in it's entirety (however long it may be); you will find that virtually all of your questions about tanking will be discussed there: DK Tanking Discussion

Originally Posted by Feorthas
Hit becomes worth very, very little after the 8% needed to cap melée and specials; if you're dual wielding, the story is probably different but I don't think you want to pass talented Spell Hit cap (so 13-14% melée).
Actually, since white hits contribute so little of a DW DK's damage, hit matters very, very little for them after the special cap. Strength, as it would happen, is the best DW stat after reaching the hit cap.

[e]; Added information.

When I tank on my Unholy DK, I find that all the special effects tend to make it hard to see what is going on. Can anyone recommend what features of the GUI to maximize/minimize/turn off to give an as good pic as possible from a tanking point of view?
#644SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3MatsT
Originally Posted by Abynthe
Please could someone supply me with a WWS for Blood? Prefererably someone who's sustaining ~4k dps or so.
Searching for Patchwerk and looking at the top result, yields us Wow Web Stats a 4700 dps 50/0/21 DK. You could look at other top entries to find more i would guess, though keep in mind that it might not be possible for you to reach the same values since their fights are much shorter and therefore they have high bloodlust uptimes etc.
#645SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3pindle
Originally Posted by Zaelid
When I tank on my Unholy DK, I find that all the special effects tend to make it hard to see what is going on. Can anyone recommend what features of the GUI to maximize/minimize/turn off to give an as good pic as possible from a tanking point of view?
I still use Grid (ex healer) as it provides a good base of what's going on (which people took damage or have a debuff), it also shows aggro kind of in the way you want it to (be it a dot in the frame, red square, red border, whatever you want). Couldn't miss it for the world. I've also used Needtoknow to track my own buffs (Bone shield/UB/IBF) and target debuffs, but it tends to bug a bit sometimes (might be related to my own UI), so I'm probably reverting back to Classtimers.

If you want it simple, Xperl does that for you, at the cost of some performance. It will also display a red border (but just for party) and allows you to set your own debuffs double sized under the target frame - quite handy actually.

#649SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fugazor
Originally Posted by Munk
Will you have the same DPS problems having a 32/39 DK and a 17/0/54 DK in a raid where the diseases fail to stack correctly?
0/32/39 will have Crypt Fever not Ebon Plaguebringer so there will be no problems. Actually there is "friendly" bug that will increase disease damage buff to 40-60% for one DK applying CF (EB+CF).

#656SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3TheWicked22
Wowhead's Item Weight Scale is what I've been using. It's still in beta, so I'm not sure how accurate it is, but it will give you a decent list of what's available.
#657SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by TheWicked22
Wowhead's Item Weight Scale is what I've been using. It's still in beta, so I'm not sure how accurate it is, but it will give you a decent list of what's available.
While it's good on gear that's mostly stats, it doesn't handle procs and 'on use:', which is a lot of what trinkets are good.

Originally Posted by Ridde
Is there a list where i can read on which trinket is the best for my other spot?
[Fury of the Five Flights] and [Mirror of Truth] are both very good, though the latter is obviously easier to get.
[Bandit's Insignia].. Anything with ap or crit rating, though it matters what spec you're using. I plan on endgaming with the mirror.. Mirror of Truth is *definitely* the best you can do outside of 25man raids, if that matters.

#659SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3TheWicked22
Keep in mind that, a lot of the time, where a trinket comes from has no real determination on how good it is. [Drake Fang Talisman] from BWL was good right up until level 70, and [Dragonspine Trophy] from Gruul was an endgame trinket until Sunwell. Just because you only dropped a few badges on a trinket doesn't mean it's not one of your best options.

#664SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside

#665SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3trinitease
I understand the new hit cap is 8%. Cool. My question is am I hit cap'd? Im a draenei so i get 1% from heroic presence and my hit rating is 237 which is 7.23% chance to hit. Is the 7.23% include the heroic presence or am I actualy hit cap'd? Thank you for your time and help.

The World of Warcraft Armory
#666SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by trinitease
I understand the new hit cap is 8%. Cool. My question is am I hit cap'd? Im a draenei so i get 1% from heroic presence and my hit rating is 237 which is 7.23% chance to hit. Is the 7.23% include the heroic presence or am I actualy hit cap'd? Thank you for your time and help.

The World of Warcraft Armory
WoW Armory has been changed from BC in that it no longer includes buffs of any sort in the values it displays. As such, with a hit rating of 237 you will indeed be hit capped with Heroic Presence.
#667SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Bibdy
Originally Posted by Fatedtolive
I implied by the "RPD(if available)" that I was using rune strike as often as possible. But, otherwise you're telling me to tell people to dust omen off again for the time being?
Don't wait until 'RP-Dump-Time!' to use Rune Strike. Since it doesn't cost you a global cooldown you should either attach a Rune Strike macro to all of your abilities or simply smash your Rune Strike button with much zeal and no mercy.
#668SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fatedtolive
Originally Posted by Bibdy
Don't wait until 'RP-Dump-Time!' to use Rune Strike. Since it doesn't cost you a global cooldown you should either attach a Rune Strike macro to all of your abilities or simply smash your Rune Strike button with much zeal and no mercy.
RP dump was implying I had 40 RP, no runes up, no RS lit up, and decided to frost strike.

Until last night I had Rune strike bound to one of my middle mouse buttons, and would mash it whenever the icon lit up. Which seemed like a better idea than mindlessly macroing RS to every ability. But, turned out to be one more thing to babysit. However, last night I macro'd Rune Strike into all my rune-based attacks and had little threat issues, and absolutely zero issues when I had BoSanct.

I'll edit my other posts to make that more clear.

Another thing that helped was prioritizing Oblit as long as IT was up. Seems like a simple idea, but I'm typically DPSing in raids and am used to having my runes always up in the order I need them. A string of 3 miss/dodge/parry while trying to make that blood rune a death rune while a F/U was up wasn't doing it
#669SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Timbalt
Originally Posted by Darkside
The rotations for tanking are virtually indistinguishable from the those used while DPS'ing. For further information, consult the Unholy and Frost threads.
So Howling Blast is only used for AOE tanking?
#670SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by Timbalt
So Howling Blast is only used for AOE tanking?
Unless you are DW'ing or AoE'ing, you should use Obliterate over Howling Blast EVERY TIME. It will ALWAYS do more damage.

Also, if you are AoE tanking, know that you should use Death and Decay over everything else, as it has an increased threat multiplier.
#671SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Timbalt
Originally Posted by Darkside
Unless you are DW'ing or AoE'ing, you should use Obliterate over Howling Blast EVERY TIME. It will ALWAYS do more damage.

Also, if you are AoE tanking, know that you should use Death and Decay over everything else, as it has an increased threat multiplier.
My usual tanking rotation has always been DnD IT PS Pest HB BB and then HB / Refresh diseases til dead. >.< AOE or not. I'll change it now

Thanks for the help.
#672SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3liezryou
I was told that unholy presence effects gargoyles but blood does not, so you should put on unholy presence before summoning a gargoyle and then revert back to blood after it is summoned. Does this really work or is it fiction?
#673SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Vierdril
edit: Nevermind. Found it
Last edited by Vierdril : 01/05/09 at 9:59 PM.
#674SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by liezryou
I was told that unholy presence effects gargoyles but blood does not, so you should put on unholy presence before summoning a gargoyle and then revert back to blood after it is summoned. Does this really work or is it fiction?
If this works it is because Unholy presence grants you haste, which is transfered over to you pets, while Blood Presence gives you an after-the-stats multiplier of sorts (which has no affect on your pets).

Originally Posted by Vierdril
Does Abomination's Might stack with TSA?
Abomination's Might does not stack with Unleashed Rage (Enh Shaman talent) or True Shot Aura (Hunter). More information on which buffs/debuffs do and do not stack can be found here: Raid Buff Versatility Among Classes.
#675SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kaniption
Macro question.

A macro that, If your ghouls health is below lets say 50% and you cast deathcoil, it hits your ghoul and heals him. If pet is above 50% it hits your target. I'm horrid with macros and that would be amazingly helpful for kind of a fire and forget pet heal as unholy.
#676SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by Kaniption
Macro question.

A macro that, If your ghouls health is below lets say 50% and you cast deathcoil, it hits your ghoul and heals him. If pet is above 50% it hits your target. I'm horrid with macros and that would be amazingly helpful for kind of a fire and forget pet heal as unholy.
Unfortunately, the ability to use conditional statements in macros was removed a long time ago; you'll have to pay attention to your pet's health manually, I'm afraid.
#677SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3pindle
Originally Posted by Darkside
Unfortunately, the ability to use conditional statements in macros was removed a long time ago; you'll have to pay attention to your pet's health manually, I'm afraid.
A nice trick might be to use Clique to bind DC to your pet frame whenever you click it. This way you don't lose your current target, and don't have to make a new button to heal you pet, just click the frame to DC it
#678SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by pindle
A nice trick might be to use Clique to bind DC to your pet frame whenever you click it. This way you don't lose your current target, and don't have to make a new button to heal you pet, just click the frame to DC it
The addon he it referring to may be found here: Clique : WoWInterface Downloads : Unit Mods
#679SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Gurtogg
Or if installing an addon for 1 task is too much then just use;

#showtooltip Death Coil 
/cast [nomodifier] Death Coil; [modifier:shift,target=pet] Death Coil
Changing the modifier to suit your preferences.
#680SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nihenna
I have a question regarding trinket and expertise:

Took it yesterday as an upgrade over my Automated Weapon Coater and while the on-use effect might stink isn't the 69 expertise making it one of the best trinkets out there since you do want to get dodgecapped asap?
I'm using that one and Mirror of Truth at the moment, before the trinket change I was at 12 expertise I think, now I'm at 20, so isn't it a great trinket?
#681SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by Nihenna
I have a question regarding trinket and expertise:

Since expertise is so hard to get your hands on (there is of course the helmet from Sarth+2 drakes but I'm unholy so I need to get my 4-set bonus.), how come the trinket from Malygos-25 is rated so low?
Took it yesterday as an upgrade over my Automated Weapon Coater and while the on-use effect might stink isn't the 69 expertise making it one of the best trinkets out there since you do want to get dodgecapped asap?
I'm using that one and Mirror of Truth at the moment, before the trinket change I was at 12 expertise I think, now I'm at 20, so isn't it a great trinket?
It depends on your spec. A deep blood spec gets capped almost accidentally, and DW specs don't have as much use for expertise (most of their attacks are spells). If none of the expertise on the trinket is wasted for you and you are 2h Frost or Unholy (or Blood, though it would be odd to be uncapped), it's an excellent trinket. Mirror and Greatness are still far the best if you have a gargoyle.
#682SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3NaPoLeoN II
Debuffs Stacking
I have a question regarding stacking of Death Knight debuffs.

Currently we're raiding with 3 DKs in the guild at the moment, one being Blood and two Unholy (I'm 32/39 however). I was wondering how the stacking of Ebon Plague and Crypt Fever from two different DKs stacked.

If I don't take Crypt Fever at all I presume it will not add damage to abilties such as Blood Strike that increases per disease on target, but wouldn't taking 3 points in it be a waste? Presuming that Ebon Plague from another Unholy specced DK will overwrite my Crypt Fever debuff and thus wasting some of the points in Crypt Fever. While I havn't really gotten around to test this, and struggle to figure out how to do this accurately I was hoping someone could answer the question here.
Do you gain from taking all 3 points in Crypt Fever if there's already an Ebon Plague on the target with a 100% uptime?
#683SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by NaPoLeoN II
I have a question regarding stacking of Death Knight debuffs.

Currently we're raiding with 3 DKs in the guild at the moment, one being Blood and two Unholy (I'm 32/39 however). I was wondering how the stacking of Ebon Plague and Crypt Fever from two different DKs stacked.

If I don't take Crypt Fever at all I presume it will not add damage to abilties such as Blood Strike that increases per disease on target, but wouldn't taking 3 points in it be a waste? Presuming that Ebon Plague from another Unholy specced DK will overwrite my Crypt Fever debuff and thus wasting some of the points in Crypt Fever. While I havn't really gotten around to test this, and struggle to figure out how to do this accurately I was hoping someone could answer the question here.
Do you gain from taking all 3 points in Crypt Fever if there's already an Ebon Plague on the target with a 100% uptime?
While you cannot have two separate instances of Ebon Plague on a target at the same time (the first one applied will be the only one counted) you can maintain both Ebon Plague and Crypt Fever. The two Death Knights who do this will each receive an extra disease when counted towards strikes, but only the Ebon Plague debuff will actually be applied (as it does both things).
#684SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Safo
Simple Question really for all the Raiders here.

What bosses in the current raid content can AotD be used on without them taunting the boss off the tanks? I know they can be used on Patchwerk but, I haven't been brave enough to try it on any other bosses or heard of others that I can use it on.

Thanks!
#685SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by Darkside
While you cannot have two separate instances of Ebon Plague on a target at the same time (the first one applied will be the only one counted) you can maintain both Ebon Plague and Crypt Fever. The two Death Knights who do this will each receive an extra disease when counted towards strikes, but only the Ebon Plague debuff will actually be applied (as it does both things).
Though that is the intended behavior, at the moment both diseases are counted (60% bonus to diseases). This will presumeably be fixed in the next patch.

On the other hand, I think he was asking about the number of diseases for the purpose of HS calculation. If the other dk has EP up, your crypt fever *does* count as a third disease (and will be up). When they fix the double-bonus bug, check again - I expect either Crypt Fever to get a 'there is a stronger spell active' message, or to be up but inactive (in which case 1/3 crypt fever would be plenty).

#689SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Fatedtolive
Originally Posted by halfpint
Quick question, with the new sigils coming with 3.0.8 (and possibly others down the road) would it be worthwhile to use macro switches like moonkins used to do with their idols?

As blood spec, it might be worth while to equip the [sigil of haunted dreams] for the obliterates and switch to [sigil of awareness] for heartstrikes.

No, swapping any items(sigils included) invokes a global cooldown and will result in a DPS loss.
Last edited by Fatedtolive : 01/06/09 at 2:51 PM. Reason: confused two things
#690SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3halfpint
Just tested on a training dummy, sigil switches do reset the GCD (as I already knew), but does not reset swing timer (which might have been speculated).

A macro switch similiar to moonkin idol swaps still seems feasible to me (you'd effectively only see the 1 gcd + latency). Is there something I'm missing?
#691SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Noraj
Originally Posted by halfpint
Just tested on a training dummy, sigil switches do reset the GCD (as I already knew), but does not reset swing timer (which might have been speculated).

A macro switch similiar to moonkin idol swaps still seems feasible to me (you'd effectively only see the 1 gcd + latency). Is there something I'm missing?
Consider that you'd likely be swapping the sigils several times over a 3 minute boss fight. Let's just say five times as an arbitrary example. That's five seconds lost. If you had put out 5000 DPS consistently for those 180 seconds without swapping sigls, your total damage would have been 900,000. Now take off the five seconds worth of GCD's for a loss of 25,000 damage, assuming your DPS didn't change.

In order to make up the same amount of damage for losing five seconds, swapping sigils would, in this case, have to offer a 142-143 DPS increase.

EDIT: Obviously this example has some flaws of its own, such as the fact that you're still doing damage while GCDs are happening because of white swings, and disease ticks, but this is still what you have to look at: Would swapping sigils make the attacks that you use do more damage than the five that you lose out on?
Last edited by Noraj : 01/07/09 at 3:46 AM.
#692SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3jooce
I'm putting together a spec like this my frost/blood spec for tanking.

Everyone says that 5/5/5 is fundamental for a tank. Since frost has the -3% chance for melee to miss would that counter the 3 points I'm losing in anticipation in order to properly fill out blood/frost? Is it safe to assume that -3% chance for melee to miss = 3% dodge ?
#693SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3kurokaze
The question isn't whether Frigid Dreadplate counteracts the loss of dodge. The 5% dodge isn't a requirement by any means. It's just really powerful and really easy to get so there's virtually no reason not to get it.

What you need to look at is whether the talents you're getting instead of that dodge are worth it. These talents are likely Mark of Blood (no; we have sufficient cooldowns that this is unnecessary and the blood rune cost is clunky), Unbreakable Armor (likewise), and a point in Veteran of the Third War (maybe, since effective health can trump avoidance). I've done considerable tanking with 27/44/0 and 23/44/4 and I didn't get shot down with a lightning bolt from the sky for my audacity or anything. And Anticipation is the least valuable of the three 'required' talents by a pretty decent margin. But obviously 27/44/0 is stupid when you have someone else providing 10% ap, and while I stand by 23/44/4 as a good spec it's hardly the be-all and end-all either, and 22/44/5 very well might be pretty much superior.
#694SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Searix
Does Army of the Dead scale?
#695SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tepesh
Does anyone have numbers on Corpse Explotion? How does ist scale at the moment on live realms and what does exactly change with 3.0.8?
#696SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Noraj
Originally Posted by Tepesh
Does anyone have numbers on Corpse Explotion? How does ist scale at the moment on live realms and what does exactly change with 3.0.8?
The AP coefficient for CE listed in the old pve compendium is 0.0475 so every 1000AP deals just under 50 extra damage per target affected. That's just for corpses lying on the ground though, as far as I know, and not for exploding your pet or self as a shadow of death ghoul.
#697SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		halfpint
Originally Posted by Noraj
Consider that you'd likely be swapping the sigils several times over a 3 minute boss fight. Let's just say five times as an arbitrary example. That's five seconds lost. If you had put out 5000 DPS consistently for those 180 seconds without swapping sigls, your total damage would have been 900,000. Now take off the five seconds worth of GCD's for a loss of 25,000 damage, assuming your DPS didn't change.

In order to make up the same amount of damage for losing five seconds, swapping sigils would, in this case, have to offer a 142-143 DPS increase.

EDIT: Obviously this example has some flaws of its own, such as the fact that you're still doing damage while GCDs are happening because of white swings, and disease ticks, but this is still what you have to look at: Would swapping sigils make the attacks that you use do more damage than the five that you lose out on?
Hmm, maybe there is some confusion in what I'm suggesting. I am talking about post swapping the sigil after you've done an attack in order to have the sigil equipped for your next ability. I was able to swap a sigil immediately after performing a rune-required move while I was still in the GCD from that move, it did reset the GCD, but with a macro, the difference should be nearly negligible. Although, I haven't tested with a macro, I was only clicking to equip the sigil while watching both swing timers and GCD timer.

As an example, after your last obliterate, you'd swap in the heartstrike sigil. Since you'd already be in the GCD (From the attack), you'd only lose anytime due to latency of the macro processing the equipment switch (which is usually minimal, depending on latency). You would not be incurring any additional full duration GCDs, only a fraction of one. You'd only use the macro on the last attack in a string.

basically a psuedo-macros would look like,
/cast obliterate
/equip heartstrke sigil

/cast heartstrike
/equip obliterate sigil

so a rotation might look like (rotations are just for illustration purposes, note that the rp dumps aren't listed)...
PS - IT - OB(macro'd) - HS - HS
HS - HS - HS - HS - HS - HS(macro'd)

If you're talking about swapping a sigil when you're not in the GCD, then yes that is a clear dps loss.

*EDIT* So applying this to your example, instead of loosing 5 seconds for 5 attacks, you might lose 1-2 seconds over 5 (I'll liberally extend it to 6) cycles (which is 1 min). The lost time would be negligible, you'll lose more time running around in most fights. Further applying this to your example, you'd lose out on anywhere from 5-10k out of 900k damage, which is less than 1%. So would the extra crit chance from the sigil swapping make up this difference? (Testing to come once the patch is released, or I get enough time to hit the ptr)

*EDIT* Testing completed. Confirmed that switching sigils resets the swing timer. So the swapped sigils has to be pretty overpowered to be worth the time, or more plainly put, don't bother.
Last edited by halfpint : 01/09/09 at 4:32 PM.

#699SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
I am creating an odd tanking build (intended for speed-running heroics, not for tanking raids) that is similar to the 32/39 DW build - it looks like this (5/36/30)

I have some questions about how we expect KM to work next patch.

1) I have heard that KM can proc from RS - would spamming RS with a glyph increase my KM proc frequency? Was the person that said that KM can proc from RS correct? (Don't answer that unless you have done some experimentation yourself, or can link to someone who has - I'm a fairly rigorous scientist).

2) This is mostly for theorycrafters coming from a Warrior background: if something has a PPM, as they said KM probably will, would it have the same frequency for each 1hander as it does for a 2hander? Basically, is the PPM mechanic smart enough to give a different proc-rate while dual-wielding?
#700SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3JALbert
Originally Posted by Janraea

2) This is mostly for theorycrafters coming from a Warrior background: if something has a PPM, as they said KM probably will, would it have the same frequency for each 1hander as it does for a 2hander? Basically, is the PPM mechanic smart enough to give a different proc-rate while dual-wielding?
There's no sort of PPM mechanic for Killing Machine. 10/20/30/40/50% of your crits will activate it. More swings, more KM procs. Dual wielding means more swings, more swings means more KM procs.
#701SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by JALbert
There's no sort of PPM mechanic for Killing Machine. 10/20/30/40/50% of your crits will activate it. More swings, more KM procs. Dual wielding means more swings, more swings means more KM procs.
I know *exactly* how it works right now. What I'm concerned with is predicting how it will work in 3.0.8 - we have no details, but Ghostcrawler mentioned that it might be moving to a PPM mechanic, to make it worth having for two-hander builds (it's completely terrible for them right now). I'm trying to determine how ppm mechanics interact with dual-wielding.
#702SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Broseph
Originally Posted by Janraea
2) This is mostly for theorycrafters coming from a Warrior background: if something has a PPM, as they said KM probably will, would it have the same frequency for each 1hander as it does for a 2hander? Basically, is the PPM mechanic smart enough to give a different proc-rate while dual-wielding?
Unless they changed it, from my days as an Enhancement Shaman, PPM is smart enough to benefit from main- and off-hand speeds.

To wit: Maelstrom Weapon is on a PPM system. One of primary benefits of dual-wielding slow weapons is for the greater chance to proc MW with Stormstrike and Lava Lash due to the greater chance to proc per hit for both main- and off-hand.
#703SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ilzhahkha

While you cannot have two separate instances of Ebon Plague on a target at the same time (the first one applied will be the only one counted) you can maintain both Ebon Plague and Crypt Fever. The two Death Knights who do this will each receive an extra disease when counted towards strikes, but only the Ebon Plague debuff will actually be applied (as it does both things).
Can you have two separate Crypt fever up?
#704SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside

#706SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Colic
Best DPS spec for the poorly geared?
I am trying to play catch up with friends who have been clearing Naxx 10/25 mans. I want to be able to hold my own with them as best as possible. I have read over all of the Death Knight forums, think tank etc. attempting to find the 'best' possible DPS spec for someone in a bunch of BoE epics & a few blues. All sources seem to point to unholy, is this the build I should choose to maximize my DPS will trying to obtain gear? Thanks.
#707SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by Colic
I am trying to play catch up with friends who have been clearing Naxx 10/25 mans. I want to be able to hold my own with them as best as possible. I have read over all of the Death Knight forums, think tank etc. attempting to find the 'best' possible DPS spec for someone in a bunch of BoE epics & a few blues. All sources seem to point to unholy, is this the build I should choose to maximize my DPS will trying to obtain gear? Thanks.
Either unholy or 32/39 will work well at that point. 32/39 has the advantage of performing *absurdly* well on aoe trash - you'd end up near the top of the meter if they let a meter run the entire evening. DW also has the advantage that rogue epics aren't terrible, and generally beat plate blues (that's not really the case for the two-handed builds). On the other hand, 2h Unholy keeps up with that just fine on single-target boss fights, and is much easier to handle - you'd have more attention to spare for staying out of the fire.
#708SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3kurokaze
Janraea: On what grounds are leather epics better than plate blues specifically for DW and not 2H? My numbers show it very much the other way around. DW's absurd critrates on its higher damage attacks mean that even more crit (from the agility increasing KM procs (slightly)) provides a rather lackluster increase compared to additional attack power. On the other hand the benefit gained from strength over 'equivalent' AP when using Kings and ghoul is quite large. Comparatively, a frost or blood 2H build gets much more benefit out of rogue stats than a ghoul build. Bladed Armor can't come close to compensating.

Now, comparing an unholy 2H build to a DW build it comes down to Bladed Armor versus the fact that DW builds have much more spells and thus get less direct benefit from agility. This isn't a comparison I can do via quick napkin math because of the secondary benefit DW gets from agility of increased KM procs. Logically it seems like DW gets the better deal but my numbers suggest otherwise. Either way, though, the two specs you recommend are definitely the least rogue-epic-favoring specs.
#709SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Hopefire
Right now, assuming that there are two DPS Death Knights in the raid, what's the recommended spec for DK#2 if DK #1 is running Crypt Fever or Ebon Plague? Especially past 3.0.8, where Ebon Plague will overwrite Crypt Fever.
#710SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Naerys
Simple Question:

I've been perusing different dual wield DPS specs, as well as tanking and DPS rotations. As mentioned by another on the first page of this thread, I'm curious and/or confused about the whole convention of PS > IT. It was vaguely answered by someone, but they didn't exactly explain why that was a good idea. Perhaps I'm missing context.. I went straight from leveling with IT > PS so that I could pull at range when DG was on CD, and since we don't have the patch yet, aggro tapping hasn't been implemented yet, so to flag my mobs, I had to do something quickly to damage. Since 77 (up to 80 now) I've been tanking tanking tanking, and have always used IT first, very possibly out of ignorance. It allows me to grain aggro more quickly, and I have it set as my first action bar skill because of needing to build threat on multiple targets quickly in Naxx.

Should I be using PS > IT for DPS and for tanking? And why particularly? Thank you in advance.
#711SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3TheWicked22
Originally Posted by Naerys
Simple Question:

I've been perusing different dual wield DPS specs, as well as tanking and DPS rotations. As mentioned by another on the first page of this thread, I'm curious and/or confused about the whole convention of PS > IT. It was vaguely answered by someone, but they didn't exactly explain why that was a good idea. Perhaps I'm missing context.. I went straight from leveling with IT > PS so that I could pull at range when DG was on CD, and since we don't have the patch yet, aggro tapping hasn't been implemented yet, so to flag my mobs, I had to do something quickly to damage. Since 77 (up to 80 now) I've been tanking tanking tanking, and have always used IT first, very possibly out of ignorance. It allows me to grain aggro more quickly, and I have it set as my first action bar skill because of needing to build threat on multiple targets quickly in Naxx.

Should I be using PS > IT for DPS and for tanking? And why particularly? Thank you in advance.
As far as I know, the only reason to use PS before IT is due to the Glacier Rot talent (top tier of the frost tree). It's really quite minimal, but if you're trying to squeeze every little bit of DPS/threat out of your rotation, that's the way to go. If you don't have that talent, using IT first is perfectly fine.
#712SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3kurokaze
Counteracting the minimal boost Glacier Rot provides to your first rotation (for dual wield):

Examine these two rotations:
IT-PS-BS-HB-BS-DC
IT-PS-HB-IT-IT-DC

PS-IT-BS-HB-BS-DC
PS-IT-HB-IT-IT-DC

The second rotation has an IT just before an HB. This is a huge no-no. You want to maximize KM procs to benefit HB by inserting spacers before the HB. PS serves this purpose nicely.
#713SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by kurokaze
Janraea: On what grounds are leather epics better than plate blues specifically for DW and not 2H? My numbers show it very much the other way around. DW's absurd critrates on its higher damage attacks mean that even more crit (from the agility increasing KM procs (slightly)) provides a rather lackluster increase compared to additional attack power. On the other hand the benefit gained from strength over 'equivalent' AP when using Kings and ghoul is quite large. Comparatively, a frost or blood 2H build gets much more benefit out of rogue stats than a ghoul build. Bladed Armor can't come close to compensating.

Now, comparing an unholy 2H build to a DW build it comes down to Bladed Armor versus the fact that DW builds have much more spells and thus get less direct benefit from agility. This isn't a comparison I can do via quick napkin math because of the secondary benefit DW gets from agility of increased KM procs. Logically it seems like DW gets the better deal but my numbers suggest otherwise. Either way, though, the two specs you recommend are definitely the least rogue-epic-favoring specs.
It seems that way, but your spell crit rate is almost unrelated to the spell crit value on your character sheet - physical crit increases the number of crits your spells get by *far* more than spell crit would (it is not a 'secondary benefit' at the entry raid level). A character with *zero* spell crit chance but the same physical crit chance I have right now would make it past 85% crits on IT and HB as 32/39.

The reason rogue gear works better for dw builds is that it's overloaded with hit and expertise - those stats are much less useful to a two-hander build, most of which are expertise capped accidentally and none of which get anything out of hit past 8%. Unlike dw gearing lists, 2h gear generally says 'cap expertise, cap hit, get as much strength as you can'. A dw guide on the other hand lists hit as almost as good as strength right up until the spell hit cap. If you can find enough plate gear with no hit on it, and avoid going much past the expertise cap, you're right - strength wins out. But if he's taking whatever gear he can find for a few weeks, dw gives him more room to work with on all those stats.
#714SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3kurokaze
Plate isn't overloaded on hit? Check my armory. I'm a main spec tank; I take the same dregs that he'd be getting. We have exactly one raiding rogue so rogue stuff is up for grabs as well as various plate pieces with haste and hit that don't attract other specs. I haven't noticed much expertise on any particular type of gear - or any gear at all, really - but I have been waiting on the patch fallout and on my spreadsheet's completion to put together any kind of optimal gear list; I've just been taking it as it drops if Pawn likes it.

And hit is worth roughly half strength after the yellow cap (5% due to NoCS).

I'm aware this is a shotty method, and that it isn't maximized for best TPS possible, which is why I'm asking in here.

I usually go IT > PS > BS > BS (for Blade Barrier ASAP) > HB > FS > FS and from there it goes into whatever I can use due to rune cooldowns. I'm sure this is a very ganky way to do it. I tried switching to PS > IT a couple days ago, and not being able to pull with IT was difficult for me to adapt to so I went back worrying that due to lack of experience with that rotation, that I wouldn't be outputting maximum threat.

I figured, perhaps incorrectly, that i would load threat on due to critting all of the mobs in front of me with the IT damage enhancer enabled. #721SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Joecode
Originally Posted by TheWicked22
As far as I know, the only reason to use PS before IT is due to the Glacier Rot talent (top tier of the frost tree). It's really quite minimal, but if you're trying to squeeze every little bit of DPS/threat out of your rotation, that's the way to go. If you don't have that talent, using IT first is perfectly fine.
For Unholy builds, Rage of Rivendare buffs all spells and abilities by 10% when the target is infected by Blood Plague (a disease applied by Plague Strike); a minor additional reason to use PS prior to IT.
As a tank, however, if I can't Death Grip the mob to me, I hit them with IT first due to range as they close in on me. This places me 1.5 seconds further into my rotation that would have otherwise been wasted waiting on range.
Last edited by Joecode : 01/09/09 at 4:08 PM.
#722SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Lua
Does intellect affect our spell critical percentage, because I'm wondering if [Elixir of Mighty Thoughts] would be a dps increasing guardian elixir?

Also would a unholy DK (Scourge Strike, Necrosis) benefit from [Elixir of Empowerment] assuming there is no CoE on the target?
#723SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3kurokaze
It's been reported that Intellect has no effect on our spell critrate (in addition to Agility having no effect). Even if this were not true, it's something like 133 or 150 intellect per crit nowadays. It's hardly going to counteract the difference between 180 AP and 50 STR - which is actually less of a difference than it appears, to be honest, but I haven't seen APEP values for STR above 3.4x in the most extreme cases, and it requires 3.6 to make the elixir match the flask.

Elixir of Empowerment most likely works exactly like Spell Penetration in that it can affect bosses like Sapphiron with abnormal resistances, but not your average boss's base resistance for being level 83. Whether it works or not for death knights is untested as far as I'm aware, but again, it seems rather pointless.

#728SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fireflash38
Originally Posted by Kaniption
Macro question.

A macro that, If your ghouls health is below lets say 50% and you cast deathcoil, it hits your ghoul and heals him. If pet is above 50% it hits your target. I'm horrid with macros and that would be amazingly helpful for kind of a fire and forget pet heal as unholy.
Best bet is to make a macro such as this:


#showtooltip
/stopmacro [flying] --this is for my purposes, so i don't dismount and die
/cast [nopet] Raise Dead
/cast [pet, target=pet] Death Coil



Hit the macro once to summon a ghoul. Hit it anytime your ghoul is up to hit it with a death coil. I personally have this bound to "C", but that is up to preference.

#730SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3xellos

#731SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Darkside
Originally Posted by xellos
This is just an idiot check for myself. There's no reason why you can't have 2 0/32/39 DW DKs in a raid correct? I know Crypt Fever doesn't stack, but that shouldn't affect the personal dps of the DW DKs.
It will absolutely affect the personal dps. Since only one instance of CF is allowed, one DK will have 1 more disease than the other. This affects BS and BCB damage.
#732SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3xellos

It will absolutely affect the personal dps. Since only one instance of CF is allowed, one DK will have 1 more disease than the other. This affects BS and BCB damage.

#734SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Epyon11
Can anyone tell me. In the DW spec for DK's is two 1.4 - 1.6 speed weapons better then a slow MH and Fast OH? IF so why? Many I have talked to say go two fast weapons but none can say Why to do that.
#735SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Chimatsuri
Originally Posted by Epyon11
Can anyone tell me. In the DW spec for DK's is two 1.4 - 1.6 speed weapons better then a slow MH and Fast OH? IF so why? Many I have talked to say go two fast weapons but none can say Why to do that.
Fast/fast provides more auto attacks. More auto attack critical strikes = more KM procs, and when KM procs it means your next HB is a critical strike. HB is the DW most dmging ability, so KM procs are most important, which leads to fast/fast the better choice.

Originally Posted by Mooncrow
They seem to work differently in raids; I've tested them on every boss, and they've never taunted on any of them.

(And yes, I'm including normally tauntable bosses like Gluth, 4HM, and Sarth.)
Maybe it's different in 10 and 25 mans? Because I have had army of the dead make the tank lose aggro and screw up the boss fight. It's why I don't use AOTD now.
#736SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Mooncrow
Originally Posted by Chimatsuri
Maybe it's different in 10 and 25 mans? Because I have had army of the dead make the tank lose aggro and screw up the boss fight. It's why I don't use AOTD now.
Under what circumstances? I use them on every boss (well, except Saph), both 10 and 25 and I've never seen it happen.
#737SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Epyon11
Is the grasscutter anygood for a DK's DW build? It doesnt look very good because of no hit rating but I want a second opinion. I currently have Hatestrike and Reaper of Dark Souls and i wanna know if i should hold out or go for the Grasscutter
#738SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Darkside
Originally Posted by Epyon11
Is the grasscutter anygood for a DK's DW build? It doesnt look very good because of no hit rating but I want a second opinion. I currently have Hatestrike and Reaper of Dark Souls and i wanna know if i should hold out or go for the Grasscutter
As the DW spec demands that you use fast/fast weapons to take advantage of the broken BCB mechanics and Killing Machine, you should use Grasscutter/Hatestrike.

Originally Posted by Ikuu

#747SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3jxfaith
PS IT HB BS BS
PS IT HB IT IT with 2 deathcoils between

That is the proper 32/39 DPs rotation, correct?

And answering this, I've seen talk of using macros to 'simplify' the rotation by cancelling rime procs. What exactly is meant by this usually? Are they using a macro to cancel freezing fog when you desire to use the runes? I'm personally mildly confused, and if it is worth using in a raid, what is the macro exactly?
#748SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by jxfaith
PS IT HB BS BS
PS IT HB IT IT with 2 deathcoils between

That is the proper 32/39 DPs rotation, correct?

And answering this, I've seen talk of using macros to 'simplify' the rotation by cancelling rime procs. What exactly is meant by this usually? Are they using a macro to cancel freezing fog when you desire to use the runes? I'm personally mildly confused, and if it is worth using in a raid, what is the macro exactly?
Generally, no - the rotation you give has IT immediately before HB, which tends to keep the Killing Machine procs from being used to best effect. Try IT,PS,HB,DC,BS,BS,DC - IT,DC,HB,DC,IT,IT if you need to use a rotation.. Unless you have both the spell hit cap and expertise cap, you'll really be using a priority rotation even on patchwerk though - keep your diseases up, cast HB when it's available, IT if not HB, and DC if neither IT nor HB is available and both diseases are up. If KM is up and HB is almost up, use DC instead of IT.

As far as the rime macro - ignore it. It won't help you except on a few bosses, and only if you *nail* your rotation timing - unless you're putting out 5k dps or higher, just don't worry about it.
#749SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ritualist

I have a question reguarding the Darkmoon Card: Greatness. Does the proc effect stack with all talents involving +%Str (Ravenous Dead, VoTW, SoD, etc) and/or Rune of the Fallen Crusader?
#750SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fireflash38
Originally Posted by Janraea
Generally, no - the rotation you give has IT immediately before HB, which tends to keep the Killing Machine procs from being used to best effect. Try IT,PS,HB,DC,BS,BS,DC - IT,DC,HB,DC,IT,IT if you need to use a rotation.. Unless you have both the spell hit cap and expertise cap, you'll really be using a priority rotation even on patchwerk though - keep your diseases up, cast HB when it's available, IT if not HB, and DC if neither IT nor HB is available and both diseases are up. If KM is up and HB is almost up, use DC instead of IT.

As far as the rime macro - ignore it. It won't help you except on a few bosses, and only if you *nail* your rotation timing - unless you're putting out 5k dps or higher, just don't worry about it.
I have read about this yet I do not fully understand the reasoning behind not using a Rime Proc.

Can you please explain?
#751SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janraea
Originally Posted by Fireflash38
I have read about this yet I do not fully understand the reasoning behind not using a Rime Proc.
Can you please explain?
A rime proc-using HB only gives 5 RP (if you have Chill, none if you don't). While it is technically better dps to use the rime proc and cast an IT afterward before continuing with the previous rotation/priorities, it's not a big gain, and proc-watching uses a lot of attention. If the skills are going to be cast in the same order anyway, cancelling the proc gets you an extra 15 RP.

Originally Posted by Ritualist
I have a question reguarding the Darkmoon Card: Greatness. I only need one more card to complete my deck and before I made the commitment to equip instead of selling I wanted to make sure about the item itself in reference to DKs. Does the proc effect stack with all talents involving +%Str (Ravenous Dead, VoTW, SoD, etc) and/or Rune of the Fallen Crusader?
I believe so. Certainly it is the best available trinket for a DK either way. It is, on the other hand, worth around 20,000 gold on any server with a few dedicated guilds.
