#1427SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3jaofos
I'm currently raising a DK and tanking my way through the 70's to get a good feel for it. I plan to stay Unholy for tanking, as it is what I enjoy playing the most. I do have a couple of questions that I can't seem to get a good, intelligent answer for when it comes to a few talents.

Virulence vs. Ravenous Dead

I guess it pretty much comes down to STR vs. Hit. STR seems to be the winner to me as nearly everything for DK benefits from raw STR. I'm assuming the Hit can be gained from gear vs. talents.

Desecration vs. Wandering Plague

I really like wandering plague, pretty much giving diseases the ability to crit and do aoe at the same time seems like a win win, yet I see many many unholy spec's skipping over this talent. I have it now on my DK and it's coming it at about 5% of my damage when tanking. Would the damage increase from Desecration be worth more? Should I try to fit both in?

RP Issues

I'm wondering if it's because I did not spec into Dirge, but it seems I have RP issues when tanking now. Will Dirge help this quite a bit? Should I worry about it too much?

Rotation

I'm really anal about keeping diseases up, and trying not to use PS & IT after the initial disease application. Using Glyph of Disease and Pestilence, I usually use 1 Blood rune every rotation to refresh diseases, even on single target so I can use my FU runes on SS. When AoE is needed, I start with DnD, PS -> IT -> Pest. Then I follow up with SS spam filled with Pest -> BB to keep blood runes on CD (using RP dumps as well). I'll probably switch to IT -> PS for initial attacks after I drop Baron of Rivendare.

Thoughts, suggestions?
#1428SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kasac
I was just wondering has there been a general conclusion for the best spec/tree. I know there will be some different opinions, but I would like to hear what people are getting good results with, and what their reasoning is for unusual specs. I am open to both duel wield and two handed specs.

This should allow Frost and Unholy to benefit from Death Strike healing while letting Blood benefit from extra Death Strike damage. The tooltip will not reflect this change until we can patch the client.

#1432SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Gromdal
Quick one for frosties, I've just come across from Unholy and am preferring the change of pace, BUT: given that Glacial Rot and Tundra Stalker grant 20% and 15% damage each to Frost Strike when a frost fever is active, should I be dumping my Frost Strikes at the end of my second rotation after the diseases have faded or saving it again for the end of the repeat first rotation (the IT PS BS BS OB -> dump) to maximise the damage, or am I likely to cap out?
#1433SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3◊ foolish_fool
Originally Posted by Gromdal
Quick one for frosties, I've just come across from Unholy and am preferring the change of pace, BUT: given that Glacial Rot and Tundra Stalker grant 20% and 15% damage each to Frost Strike when a frost fever is active, should I be dumping my Frost Strikes at the end of my second rotation after the diseases have faded or saving it again for the end of the repeat first rotation (the IT PS BS BS OB -> dump) to maximise the damage, or am I likely to cap out?
The most ideal solution would likely be to weave your Frost Strikes through your rotation to maximize the optimal use of Killing Machine procs anyway. If all else fails, some people are seeing more success with the 13/51/7 for extended disease duration which may help in your situation.
#1434SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tima
Originally Posted by Artoxia
i just read :
...(sic)...
on mmo-champion and was wondering if death strike is going to be an attractive skill for frost spec. Any suggestions ?
More attractive than it was 2 days ago, sure. But it'll still only be used for soloing content, pvp, or helping out the healers if your health is getting too low for comfort - what it was used for before the nerf. It's not going to replace Oblit in any standard rotation.
#1435SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Originally Posted by Gromdal
Quick one for frosties, I've just come across from Unholy and am preferring the change of pace, BUT: given that Glacial Rot and Tundra Stalker grant 20% and 15% damage each to Frost Strike when a frost fever is active, should I be dumping my Frost Strikes at the end of my second rotation after the diseases have faded or saving it again for the end of the repeat first rotation (the IT PS BS BS OB -> dump) to maximise the damage, or am I likely to cap out?
A rotation that distributes Frost Strikes evenly over the entire rotation is optimal, since it maximizes Killing Machine procs used on FS.
#1436SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tirend
DK Parry Rating and Diminishing Returns
Recently a DK friend of mine asked me about wether the Parry Rating that he gets from the Forceful Deflection ability is affected by Diminishing Returns or not.

I searched through here looking for a quick answer to the question, but I couldn't find one in any of the threads, So i'm just going to ask it.

From what I've read on here, the Parry Rating granted by the Forceful Deflection ability is in itself unaffected by Diminishing Returns, but it counts when calculating the Diminishing Return from other sources such as gear. Is this view correct, or did i read it wrong?
#1437SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pyros
Originally Posted by Tirend
Recently a DK friend of mine asked me about wether the Parry Rating that he gets from the Forceful Deflection ability is affected by Diminishing Returns or not.

I searched through here looking for a quick answer to the question, but I couldn't find one in any of the threads, So i'm just going to ask it.

From what I've read on here, the Parry Rating granted by the Forceful Deflection ability is in itself unaffected by Diminishing Returns, but it counts when calculating the Diminishing Return from other sources such as gear. Is this view correct, or did i read it wrong?
Only abilities/items/whatever that give whole skills are unaffected by ratings diminishing returns pretty much, so Forceful Deflection, which gives parry rating, is affected. The 4% runeforge isn't, the old blade barrier wasn't.
#1438SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tirend
Originally Posted by Pyros
Only abilities/items/whatever that give whole skills are unaffected by ratings diminishing returns pretty much, so Forceful Deflection, which gives parry rating, is affected. The 4% runeforge isn't, the old blade barrier wasn't.
Awesome, thanks for clearing that up.

#1441SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Littlex
It would be great if someone could check my math for the T8 set bonus, i am unsure if its correct because it seems i fail at math.

The bonus increases our disease bonus damage by 20%. That means instead of 10% extra damage we gain 12% per disease for HS.

Formulas:

HS without T8 4p:

w = ((Weapon Dmg / 2) + 368)
d = ((w / 100) * 10) * 2

damage per hearth strike = w + d

Example, BoH with about 800 dmg average:

w = 768 = ((800 / 2) + 368)
d = 153 = ((768 / 100) * 10) * 2

Result in 921 damage per strike.

HS with T8 4p are the same formulas but instead of 10%, you use 12% in the second formula (d).

w = 768 = ((800 / 2) + 368)
d = 184 = ((768 / 100) * 12) * 2

952 = w + d

When comparing HS with T8 4p vs HS without T8 4p that means a dmg increase by 3.3% per HS. Is this correct?
((952 - 921) / 921) * 100 = 3.36...%


Did i miss something?

#1443SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Laraque
Is there a way to either:
a) Change the order Death Runes are used
Or
b) Manually reset Death Runes to their original runes with a macro or something?

I am doing the Blood Rotation:

DS-IT-PS-HS-HS-dump
HS-HS-DS-HS-HS-dump

During one point in my Blood rotation I have the runes:
Blood - Blood - Death(on refresh) - Death - Death(on refresh) - Death

During a normal rotation this is fine because the Death runes refresh at different times so I can use them effectively.

However, on trash mobs I often find they die at that specific spot in my rotation (I hate Murphy) so I end up with that rune pattern and none of them on cool down.

When I start up the rotation again, it wants to use the 2 left most Death Runes first like:

Blood - Blood - used - used - Death - Death

This means that the 2 frost runes will refresh together and the 2 unholy runes will refresh together and that messes up my rotation.

Unfortunately a slight change in rotation to:
IT-DS-PS-HS-HS-dump
Wait for runes-HS-HS-DS-HS-HS-dump

Does not fix the problem within 1 rotation because of the way runes refresh on intervals of 10s rather than on 10s from last use.

A change of the order Death Runes are used or to manually reset death runes would solve this rotation issue, any suggestions on how to do that?

#1447SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by fearghaill
Does chilblains work on snare-immune mobs (bosses) to activate Glyph of Blood Strike? I.e. debuff applied and working with the glyph, without actually slowing the boss?
If you have the talent, it will just say "immune" on bosses and certain mobs that cannot be snared. Since the debuff doesn't go up, blood strike wouldn't get increased damage.

#1450SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Delpia
Originally Posted by Zoort
Couldnt really find an answer in the according thread, and the price for the glyph is to high to do the testing myself, so ill ask here.

Glyph of Howling Blast for Frost go or no go?
This is currently being discussed in the Frost DPS forum and the ruling is still out but personally I love it as a glyph both for tanking and for DPS as it makes for a simple rotation that is easy to carry out no mater what’s going on in the fight.
For tanking it makes for great snap agro as well. There are a few varied rotations being used but the simplest is:

Single target: HB>OB>BS>BS>OB>OB>OB weaving Frost Strikes throughout and hitting HB on procs or subbing in a HB instead of an OB to keep FF up.
AoE: HB>D&D>BB HB>OB>BB>BB and use FSs as you can.

Right now I'm running a 17/51/3 dps spec in BP with this Glyph.

#1453SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3♦ Bryne

Just wanted to clarify, is there no longer any demand from Death Knight's for the frostfire DoT-slow anymore since the changes to Glyph of Blood Strike?

Originally Posted by Valeriane
I have a question about the DRW mechanic. It reads as "lasts 5 seconds plus 1 second per 10 runic power" and the glyph extends the duration another 5 seconds (which I have yet to find on my server btw).

So here's my question. Is there a 5 second delay before we start expending runic power to keep DRW going? And with the glyph would that give us a 10 second delay before we burn through RP to extend our DRW? I only started using a Blood spec with 3.1 for occasions when I'm not tanking so I my experience is limited as of yet and since I'm at work I can't test this myself.
All the RP for DRW is expended when you cast the spell. The duration isn't extended by consuming more RP the way Gargoyle is.

#1457SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3xbleedblackx
I just have one question.

Why cast Plague Strike before Icy Touch?

Icy Touch is ranged so by the time you get to your target you will be able to use Plague Strike right away. I never understood why...
#1458SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Soilantgreen64
Originally Posted by xbleedblackx
I just have one question.

Why cast Plague Strike before Icy Touch?

Icy Touch is ranged so by the time you get to your target you will be able to use Plague Strike right away. I never understood why...
Plague Strike causes Desecration, therefore your IT hits for more, otherwise if you IT first you miss out on the bonus dmg from Desecration. Same thing with the Glacier Rot Talent, IT hits for 20% extra if the target is already diseased.
#1459SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Valeriane
Originally Posted by Bryne
All the RP for DRW is expended when you cast the spell. The duration isn't extended by consuming more RP the way Gargoyle is.
I see what you're saying I was assuming it worked like Garg and more RP generated while it was in effect meant a longer duration where, in fact, it burns all RP immediately and that determines the duration. So with RPM out of the 1st tier frost talents and the glyph my DRW would last 19 seconds. That doesn't really sound worthwhile on a 90sec cooldown. Thanks for the clarification.

#1465SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Stoical
Originally Posted by Spotnick
I'm trying to find the flaw on my dps
Originally Posted by Spotnick
I do have the rotation macroed
I found it for you. Don't try to macro ability rotations and expect to do well.

As far as your original question, just weight the stats appropriately against others and don't go over cap, there's no magic minimum value. Look at the Blood DPS-specific thread in this forum for those values, just browse through recent pages until you find posts from Methods for some quick charts with numbers.
#1466SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Spotnick
I know i should be able to do it without a macro, but seriously, I just can't remember how many hearth strike I just did while I'm moving in a fight, so the macro helps, and when I can focus a bit on my rotation I let go the extra rune dump. Not all fights are like Patchwerk where you can 100% focus on your macro (and do a little dip).

So basically I do have:

/castsequence reset=5/target Icy Touch, Plague Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Death Strike, Death Coil, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Death Coil

and when I hit the death coil I press DC again if it's available. Sometimes this macro tricks me when blood runes are down though and i either have to wait or use empowered runed weapon.

The only other thing major I see between other DKs that beat me a lot on DPS is that they have the noble deck, and I have the FoFF and Mirror of Truth.. I was DW pre 3.1 so FoFF was better then, but I just don't like the idea of spending 10k on replacable gear.

So basically I do have:

/castsequence reset=5/target Icy Touch, Plague Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Death Strike, Death Coil, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Death Coil

and when I hit the death coil I press DC again if it's available. Sometimes this macro tricks me when blood runes are down though and i either have to wait or use empowered runed weapon.

The only other thing major I see between other DKs that beat me a lot on DPS is that they have the noble deck, and I have the FoFF and Mirror of Truth.. I was DW pre 3.1 so FoFF was better then, but I just don't like the idea of spending 10k on replacable gear.
And when your IT or PS misses or gets dodged, your whole rotation is jacked and you're wasting a bunch of runes on subpar abilities because you're using them all on a 1-diseased target. Then when you use AMS and get to soak extra RP, you'll be wasting all the RP as you continue going through your 1-button-spam ability without properly RP-dumping the extra. Or when DRW is coming up, you're continuing to DC throughout your rotation instead of waiting for it to build all the way up to 100 or 130 so you can pop a full DRW. So on and so forth. Seriously, this kind of cast sequence is retarded, stop using it, especially if you're going to come here seeking advice on how to improve your dps.

#1470SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3SkagasmAddict
Originally Posted by LudiKalell
I'd like to get a definitive answer to the simple question:
Is HB damage > OB damage in a raid environment with 2H frost spec on single target?
Obliterate is significantly stronger than Howling Blast on single targets with a 2H weapon. HB (when glyphed) is used for the Frost Fever debuff.

If Unglyphed HB should not be part of a regular 2H frost rotation; the only reasons to hit an unglyphed HB are Rime procs, AoE, and if you're out of melee range of your target.

#1472SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Hotiedraenei
Simple question when looking at the DW Unholy Thread. I have a question on how to turn the priority listed for the spec 0-13-58 into a normal rotation? Priority System: Diseases(BP>FF)>SS>BS>UB>DC.

Notes on the build below:
-----0/13/58-----

This build is the classic Scourge Strike build of the DW bunch. This one uses Blood Presence to fire hard hitting attacks to go with the usual spells. This build needs Haste so that it's rotations don't get too long. Just avoid Armor Penetration which scales poorly due to so many attacks that ignore armor. As a nice side effect, Plague Strike hits harder in this build than any other DW build. This build has a very high scaling Death Coil as well.

http://talent.mmo-champion.com/?deat...5&version=9806

This build scales better with Haste and Expertise. Critical Rating isn't bad either.

Priority System: Diseases(BP>FF)>SS>BS>UB>DC.
Any help would be appreciated. I love Duel wielding and I am trying to find the on that suits my play style best, the one listed above ,or the 0-18-53 of Origins.
Last edited by Hotiedraenei : 04/28/09 at 1:13 PM. Reason: Added the priority system
#1473SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Bluedoo
Originally Posted by Hotiedraenei
Simple question when looking at the DW Unholy Thread. I have a question on how to turn the priority listed for the spec 0-13-58 into a normal rotation? Priority System: Diseases(BP>FF)>SS>BS>UB>DC.

Notes on the build below:


Any help would be appreciated. I love Duel wielding and I am trying to find the on that suits my play style best, the one listed above ,or the 0-18-53 of Origins.
You more or less answered that yourself.

PS - IT - SS - BS - BS - Dump
SS - SS - SS - Dump

If you have the Scourge Strike Glyph, it should be auto-refreshing BP/FF on its own, so you go over to SS - SS - BS - BS - Dump - SS - SS - SS - Dump if you're lucky (a.k.a. the priority system kicks in).

Hope that helps.
#1474SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Vignarg
@Bengal21
D&D, Howling Blast, Blood Boil, Pestilence, and Heart Strike would all ruin CC. To the best of my knowledge, unless it explictly states otherwise in the tooltip (i.e. Wandering plague), they would hit CCed targets.

@HotieDraeni
The rotation you listed seems to have an extra blood rune left over. PS>IT>SS>BS>BS>UB>DC would use it. Also, the rotation would depend on single target vs aoe.

Single Target
PS>IT>SS>BS>BS>UB>DC
SS>SS>SS>RDP
SS renewing Diseases would dictate next rotation

AoE
D&D>PS>IT>Pest>UB
SS>SS>BB>...BB?
The secon rotation is hard to say because you know have a Death Rune (from Pest) and a Blood Rune from D&D. This won't be back on track until another rotation. You could just drop out another BB, or you could grab Frenzy and use the DR there.

I think the bigger concern is 1/3 Morbidity on a build bragging about how well DC scales. Also, I'd be concerned about using D&D without Subversion. At any rate, I would ignore the "avoid ArP" on anything that uses so many physical attacks. Would it rely on ArP as much as, say, Blood? No, but ArP would still be welcome on all that BS/PS/SS you're delivering (and for BCB unless I'm mistaken).
#1475SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tel
SS ignores armor. So for any deep unholy build, ArP is a mostly wasted stat.

#1478SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Darkmoone
Does the stat weight of haste include the fact that you would almost always receive 16-20% haste in a 25 man raid?. Is there not a point where haste becomes detrimental for melee dps under a certain speed. I ask this because i find myself doing more dps as unholy without a shaman or frost DK in the raid then when i do.
#1479SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Miracleknight
No. We have no abilities that become clipped such as Steady Shot or Slam for that to have even any effect on us. More haste is always good and is always a straight % increase to your melee damage (And Necrosis and I believe BCB unless that's normalized)
#1480SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rhuu
DRW and diseases
Does DRW need to cast its own diseases to get the damage bonuses to Heart Strike?
#1481SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3resky
Is there a "hard cap" on the amount of armor you can reduce, or just the soft cap/diminishing returns we know about (against high armor targets)?

If during Grim Toll / Mjolnir Runestone I have over 100% armor penetration, is it capped to 100% of the armor that's affected by ArP, or is it simply multiplied by the percentage ignoring more armor than the soft cap?

Armor Debuffs - Sunder, FF/Weakness - how do they interact with the cap? Is it possible to get a mob below zero armor with all the debuffs and high ArP from rating?
#1482SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by resky
Is there a "hard cap" on the amount of armor you can reduce, or just the soft cap/diminishing returns we know about (against high armor targets)?

If during Grim Toll / Mjolnir Runestone I have over 100% armor penetration, is it capped to 100% of the armor that's affected by ArP, or is it simply multiplied by the percentage ignoring more armor than the soft cap?

Armor Debuffs - Sunder, FF/Weakness - how do they interact with the cap? Is it possible to get a mob below zero armor with all the debuffs and high ArP from rating?
That is a good question that was sorta dealt with in the combat ratings thread in the /f31 section of the forums.

You will still get a dps increase for the times when you have over 100% armor pen, I recall the test went up to 110% and still got a dps increase (using the test dummy).

#1484SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3WhiteMoose
Been looking around DW now.. and it seems like the 0-13-58 build is quite good accually. But how does it stand compared to 2h builds like 51-0-18 (+2) and 0-10-61?
#1485SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
DW cannot currently compete with any 2h spec played by a competent player, due to the grand majority of Death Knight damage coming from weapon based strikes post 3.1.

1) Awareness.
2) Not sure, I think it depends on the fight.
3) Pop it once for BL at the start of the fight, then again when the cd is up.
4) Melee easily, you get very little damage from spells.
5) What else are you going to do during that time?
6) Depends on how fast you can get FoFF up, I think. Again, largely fight dependent. On something like Mimiron where there's a lot of downtime, FoFF loses a lot of its power. On fights like Kologarn, though, it would be great as you could keep it up for the entire fight.

#1491SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3resky
Originally Posted by Clandestine
Armor Penetration formula explained
Why do people keep linking this thread every time someone asks a question about armor pen? GC didn't cover the cap's interaction with armor penetration DEBUFFS and didn't say whether it's possible to ignore more armor than this cap. Therefore that thread is only half useful for armor pen simulation. I've read it multiple times trying to read deep into what was said (e.g. "we multiply the percentage in the tooltip times the minimum of the two values: the cap, and the amount of armor on the target after all other modifiers"), but it just doesn't give enough information to form a flawless formula for armor pen as it applies in a raid environment.
#1492SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Griefknight
Originally Posted by Thesaint
Death Strike now heals a percentage of total health per disease. As an unholy tank, why should I not use this in my rotation instead of scourge strike? (I can now refresh diseases with glyphed pestilence)
Is it significantly less threat generated?
Significant is an understatement, SS is the bread and butter of Unholy DPS/TPS and to not use it in a deep unholy build would be suicide. I'd say to just go Blood spec if you want to use DS.
#1493SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3resky
Originally Posted by Griefknight
Significant is an understatement, SS is the bread and butter of Unholy DPS/TPS and to not use it in a deep unholy build would be suicide. I'd say to just go Blood spec if you want to use DS.
There's no reason NOT to use DS even as unholy if you're good on threat but need all the healing you can get (if you're tanking steelbreaker and it's being killed last, for example).
#1494SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
This is true, Death Strike can be a situational ability for all DK tank specs. However, in the general case you will want to use Scourge Strike as Unholy, simply because you will produce WAY more threat that way. Your healers should be able to keep you up just fine without you spamming 15% heals all the time. If they can't, find a new guild.

#1497SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Gilthridge
For blood dks is unholy presence better than blood presence? Now I assume the answer is blood but, I have been having this discussion with the dks in my guild and they claim that they lose dps by going into BP. I'll explain the one I had the discussion with claims that sitting for about 1 second doing no damage in UP is a gain since all his runes are on cd vs BP where his runes cannot be used as soon as they come off cd but his attacks deal 15% more dmg. Any math would be very much appreciated or links to math I may have over looked in my search. Thanks for your time.
#1498SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3AmeroGER
Originally Posted by Gilthridge
For blood dks is unholy presence better than blood presence? Now I assume the answer is blood but, I have been having this discussion with the dks in my guild and they claim that they lose dps by going into BP. I'll explain the one I had the discussion with claims that sitting for about 1 second doing no damage in UP is a gain since all his runes are on cd vs BP where his runes cannot be used as soon as they come off cd but his attacks deal 15% more dmg. Any math would be very much appreciated or links to math I may have over looked in my search. Thanks for your time.
Blood presence is superior even if you have improved unholy presence. No matter what specc you use.
#1499SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Leaflock
Originally Posted by Gilthridge
For blood dks is unholy presence better than blood presence? Now I assume the answer is blood but, I have been having this discussion with the dks in my guild and they claim that they lose dps by going into BP. I'll explain the one I had the discussion with claims that sitting for about 1 second doing no damage in UP is a gain since all his runes are on cd vs BP where his runes cannot be used as soon as they come off cd but his attacks deal 15% more dmg. Any math would be very much appreciated or links to math I may have over looked in my search. Thanks for your time.
There are a ton of posts on this (500+ when I searched for unholy presence), so I'll go ahead and explain the short version.

Blood Presence is pretty much always better than Unholy Presence. Your white attacks are basically a wash comparing the two-- 15% stronger vs. 15% faster amounts to the same overall damage. For special attacks, Unholy Presence can only be better if you are able to do more attacks in the extra time to make up the difference in damage (15% stronger attacks in Blood vs. the same number of weaker attacks for Unholy). For most specs, this isn't possible. So, your friend is wrong-- that dead time he's getting through faster rune attacks is effectively a waste of damage. In fact, the runes favor Blood Presence. Read up on the 2 second buffer, and you'll see why you don't need to always use runes the moment they're available.

I only use Unholy Presence for fights where movement and control is more important than absolute max dps-- there are a couple of these.
#1500SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Taidaisher
Originally Posted by AmeroGER
Blood presence is superior even if you have improved unholy presence. No matter what specc you use.
I would argue that BP is better BECUASE of IUP. Your runes cooldown faster in UP sure, but in BP you get the dps/heal increase as well as the 15% haste increase.

#1506SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by Sirenfal
For Frost:

190 AP WG Trinket or Mirror of Truth, which is better for DPS?
Rawr or another sim tool can answer this question easily, but Mirror is better. Note Mirror is about 84 crit and 150ish AP, so 84 crit is better than 40 AP.

The WG trinket is very useful on Yogg-Saron though.
#1507SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3f1reburn
When offtanking, is it better to stand in front of the mob with the maintank (to get your rune strike powered by some potential cleaves for extra threat), or behind the mob?

When AOE tanking for a long consecutive period, like Thorim's arena, are rotations like DnD-IT-PS-Pest then TAB-HS/DS/Pest/BloodBoil intended to be looped, so that you D&D again to start a new rotation after the final Bloodboil?
#1508SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Personally, I prefer to stand in the front, right on top of the main tank. That way, when I taunt off of him, the boss won't swing around wildly and screw up our positioning. Getting extra RS's doesn't matter, as you will immediately assume the MT's threat once you taunt.

I find it very difficult to ever use a rotation when tanking, or even while dpsing. You should, as a rule, always use whatever tool will keep the mobs off the other players and keep you alive. Generally, this means using DnD on every cooldown, unless there are only two mobs, in which case HS is a better choice. you always want to have diseases ticking on everyone, so if they're about to go off, re-pest, and so forth.

#1511SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		blitzseed
You can use NeedToKnow : WoWInterface Downloads : Buff/Debuff/Spell Mods for DRW, don't know if it will work for the ghoul.

update if you use Deadly Boss Mods you can set a timer when you use the ghoul by using a macros something like this
#showtooltip Raise Dead
/dbm timer 01:00 Ghoul 
/cast Raise Dead

#1514SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3RumNCoke
Trinket question
Quick question about trinkets... My current trinkets are [Meteorite Whetstone] and [Darkmoon Card: Greatness]

Would it be worth replacing the whetstone with [Mirror of Truth] ? I have enough emblems to get it... or I could hold onto them for something later.

I've read a darkmoon/mirror combo will not proc together... Does that mean they never at the same time but can at different times or one will never work if you have both equipped?
#1515SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Consider
Mirror of Truth is superior to Meteorite Whetstone for any spec.

Mirror of Truth and Darkmoon Card: Greatness can proc at the same time, can overlap with neither buff overriding the other, and they do both have separate ICDs. In no way does one limit the effectiveness of the other.
#1516SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Vignarg
The closest answer I found to this question is on page 28, but it's outdated and didn't answer it exactly anyways.

Concerning diseases from mulitiple DKs:

I've been told that if another DK and myself hit a target with the same disease, only one counts for DoT damage (presumably, whoever diseased first). I want to know if that's how it works, and I also want to know how it affects bonus damage for abilities like HS, BS, SS, Oblit, etc.

So, if I AM getting my diseases overwritten for purposes of their DoT damage, do I still get contribution to my attacks from how long my diseases would have ticked?

Sorry if this is basic. I had always just assumed I got credit for purposes of increased damage, but now I'm having trouble finding notes that state this explicitly. I had assumed you didn't bring same spec DKs because things like Abomitable Might, Improved Icy Talon, and the effects of Ebon Plague/Desecration don't stack, but a friend is insisting it has something to do with diseases and I'm a bit confused.
#1517SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ashur25
Originally Posted by Vignarg
The closest answer I found to this question is on page 28, but it's outdated and didn't answer it exactly anyways.

Concerning diseases from mulitiple DKs:

I've been told that if another DK and myself hit a target with the same disease, only one counts for DoT damage (presumably, whoever diseased first). I want to know if that's how it works, and I also want to know how it affects bonus damage for abilities like HS, BS, SS, Oblit, etc.

So, if I AM getting my diseases overwritten for purposes of their DoT damage, do I still get contribution to my attacks from how long my diseases would have ticked?

Sorry if this is basic. I had always just assumed I got credit for purposes of increased damage, but now I'm having trouble finding notes that state this explicitly. I had assumed you didn't bring same spec DKs because things like Abomitable Might, Improved Icy Talon, and the effects of Ebon Plague/Desecration don't stack, but a friend is insisting it has something to do with diseases and I'm a bit confused.
Your friend is wrong, he's probably thinking of EP which didn't stack for multiple Unholy DKs, but that was fixed in 3.1.
#1518SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Leaflock
Just to clarify, diseases from multiple DKs can definitely overlap and each DK gets credit for their own DoT damage. Your strikes will only benefit damage-wise from the presence of your own diseases, and not anyone else's.
#1519SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3neethos
physical or not
So my simple question is about what counts as physical damage and what does not.
I know for instance that HS/DS count as physical attacks, while UH attacks count as shadow. What about frost though? I have grim toll along with a few other armor pen pieces and was planning on working on stacking my armor pen, since i have been playing UH for so long i REALLY want to try something new. Now i have read alot about how blood benefits the most from armor pen, but what about frost attacks like OB/HB etc? would i just be wasting my time using grim toll/armor pen in frost?
#1520SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3shopshopshop
Originally Posted by neethos
So my simple question is about what counts as physical damage and what does not.
I know for instance that HS/DS count as physical attacks, while UH attacks count as shadow. What about frost though? I have grim toll along with a few other armor pen pieces and was planning on working on stacking my armor pen, since i have been playing UH for so long i REALLY want to try something new. Now i have read alot about how blood benefits the most from armor pen, but what about frost attacks like OB/HB etc? would i just be wasting my time using grim toll/armor pen in frost?
Any skill that says it does a "% of weapon damage" and does not mention any type of magic, such as frost, shadow, etc. does physical damage. For DKs, this includes PS, OB, BS, HS and DS. All other attacks, IT, SS, HB, FS, DC, even if they take a % of weapon damage, they do so as shadow or frost damage.
#1521SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pierced
Alright well I'm not really sure if this goes here or in the Death Knight Tanking Discussion guide but I believe my question is rather simple and straightforward so I'll post it here. I'll try to get straight to the point, I am in a guild that is currently progressing through both Ulduar 25man and 10man. I am currently one of the maintanks of my guild alongside a DK tank.

Now, the reason I am posting here is because I've noticed that for bosses that require taunting have been becoming immune to my taunts [Razorscale, Kologarn]. I thought the first time it was just a fluke, but it's been happening a lot lately so i've decided to investigate what the problem is. Turns out, the other MT DK has been using dark command and death grip every time they are off the cooldown, thus causing the diminishing taunt returns on bosses to take effect. I have confronted him about it and he has dismissed my complaints as "QQ" and "let me play the way I want to" and he claims the taunts cause threat. I asked my guild leader to address the issue and when he did the DK tank said that every one of his abilities were bound to taunt, and when we tried explaining that he doesn't need to taunt when the boss is attacking him to maintain threat he again dismissed it. We even pointed out that on the tooltip it says "Commands the target to attack you, but has no effect if the target is already attacking you" and again dismissed it as just QQ by me. This is becoming a serious issue because the bosses are becoming immune to my taunts, which has caused wipes/deaths, and I am getting blamed [by him] that I "don't know how to taunt". I believe that I am right in the assumption that taunting only brings your threat up to the amount of the person highest in threat+a but doesn't do anything when the target is attacking you but I have never played a DK nor do i know the tanking mechanics of dks so i'd like some input on this situation. I have glanced over some of the DK tank discussion topics and have not seen anything about taunting being in a rotation. Thank you for your help, he claims to come to this site often as well so I don't know where he got this idea from.

Note for above: For my example, Razorscale, you may be thinking that he just used his taunts a lot on adds, but I can assure you he uses them on bosses when they are attacking him. Another example would be Archavon, where he used a combined total of about 15-27+ taunts on the boss [roughly]. I am not exaggerating in the slightest, recount has shown this to be true. [I believe it shows it under damaging attacks by the target, or something of that nature, all of his taunts are shown to be "immune" as well.]

Also, one more quick question. He is also saying that "Cloak of the Iron Council" is and upgrade over "Cloak of the Shadowed Sun". I know SBV is useless for DKs but he claims that the expertise is the reason why. Is the 26 expertise on this cloak that big of a stat upgrade over the extra armor, defense, and dodge rating?

Again, thanks for your help and sorry for that wall of text heh.
#1522SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3DarkAngelus

#1523SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3candlebox
Is it a big deal for an Unholy DK tank to be under the hit cap? She is missing out on better gear for fear of dropping under 8% hit. I told her she can afford to lose some hit. It's not like she'll miss every other attack or something. Can anyone confirm she can lose some hit?
#1524SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Leaflock
Originally Posted by Pierced
Turns out, the other MT DK has been using dark command and death grip every time they are off the cooldown, thus causing the diminishing taunt returns on bosses to take effect. I have confronted him about it and he has dismissed my complaints as "QQ" and "let me play the way I want to" and he claims the taunts cause threat.
You are definitely right. Neither Dark Command nor Death Grip cause threat per se, and Dark Command definitely has no effect if it's already attacking you, as the tooltip reads. Death Grip will force the target to attack you for three seconds (and acts as a taunt as well), but it's still usually pointless to use it if you're already the target.

Using Dark Command on cooldown will definitely make the boss taunt immune within a few uses. Your friend needs to study up on how taunt works.
#1525SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Miracleknight
Well if your guild leader dismissed that, I would suggest you find another guild that isn't filled with idiots unless you have some close friends binding you there you're just wasting your talents. It's one thing for a player to be ignorant of how to play his class, but for someone in charge to dismiss valid complaints is a sign of bad leadership.
#1526SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• ash2ash
I've been dicking around with my DK for a bit now and I have a quick question on frost dps optimization:

I know the typical rotation to start with for dps is to IT -> PS -> OB -> BS ->BS -> RD -> OB -> OB -> OB -> RD, but over a period of time I'm finding I can squeeze in a fourth OB before my diseases go off, however my rotation then becomes irregular. I'm finding myslef ignoring the typical rotation and instead focus on doing double disease obliterates as often as possible.

Is it more optimal to follow a strict rotation and runic dump until you can't FS anymore or is it a better idea to focus on using runes on cooldown and use rune dumps as fillers?

The only problem I have come across is that once in a blue moon I will not have enough runic power to dump, have only blood runes, and have diseases falling off. Probably a good time to recast horn of winter or something.
#1527SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by candlebox
Is it a big deal for an Unholy DK tank to be under the hit cap? She is missing out on better gear for fear of dropping under 8% hit. I told her she can afford to lose some hit. It's not like she'll miss every other attack or something. Can anyone confirm she can lose some hit?
As long as this player is good at using Taunt, she can drop some hit. You don't want to drop too much though, I would say don't drop below 5% hit.
#1528SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Delpia
Originally Posted by ash2ash
I've been dicking around with my DK for a bit now and I have a quick question on frost dps optimization:

I know the typical rotation to start with for dps is to IT -> PS -> OB -> BS ->BS -> RD -> OB -> OB -> OB -> RD, but over a period of time I'm finding I can squeeze in a fourth OB before my diseases go off, however my rotation then becomes irregular. I'm finding myslef ignoring the typical rotation and instead focus on doing double disease obliterates as often as possible.

Is it more optimal to follow a strict rotation and runic dump until you can't FS anymore or is it a better idea to focus on using runes on cooldown and use rune dumps as fillers?

The only problem I have come across is that once in a blue moon I will not have enough runic power to dump, have only blood runes, and have diseases falling off. Probably a good time to recast horn of winter or something.

Try weaving your Frost Strikes into your rotation. It makes better use of your KM procs and smooths out your rotation a little. Something like:
IT >PS >OB >(FS) >BS >BS > RP dump >OB >(FS) >OB >(FS) >OB >(FS)

DPS wise your best bet is to stick to your rotation and keep your diseases up rather then letting them drop off in favor of the extra OB.
#1529SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		zeheres
Originally Posted by candlebox
Is it a big deal for an Unholy DK tank to be under the hit cap? She is missing out on better gear for fear of dropping under 8% hit. I told her she can afford to lose some hit. It's not like she'll miss every other attack or something. Can anyone confirm she can lose some hit?
I used to be not hit capped as well for a couple of weeks (around 7,5 %) and I missed around 15 - 20 times during a whole Naxxramas raid, which is odd. Imagine these 15 - 20 hits being HS/ DS crits at around 10k (i. e. 150.000+ damage loss). Now project this on her TPS and you/ she should know if she can afford being not hit capped. I at least don't recommend it.

Originally Posted by frmorrison
As long as this player is good at using Taunt, she can drop some hit. You don't want to drop too much though, I would say don't drop below 5% hit.
Dropping hit to around 5 % is negligent since it's the highest priority to keep up with hit and expertise caps. You might want to drop some hit but definitely not almost 50 %.
Last edited by zeheres : 05/07/09 at 2:34 AM.

#1533SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Timbalt
Does Rune Tap give threat towards a boss? If so, is it more threat than a Heart Strike would be?
#1534SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
If Rune Tap does give threat, it is nowhere near the type of threat that Heart Strike would give.
#1535SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Darzog
Yes it gives threat, but is not a very efficient threat generating tool.

Death Knight Threat Values

I believe this is still accurate for 3.1. Rune Tap is only going to generate half of what it heals in threat and that is assuming there are no adds around to further diminish this number. Also it's on, at best, a 30 second cooldown, and is subject to overhealing (i.e. if you use Rune Tap when you are at full health, no threat is generated). I can't imagine any scenario in which that would be better at generating threat than Heart Strike.
#1536SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feru
My guild is looking to push the timer on Hodir hard-mode and I'm interested in maximizing my DPS for the fight. Which spec would scale best with the Starlight haste buff and the Storm Power crit buff? Is there a specific thread I should be posting this in?
#1537SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by Feru
My guild is looking to push the timer on Hodir hard-mode and I'm interested in maximizing my DPS for the fight. Which spec would scale best with the Starlight haste buff and the Storm Power crit buff? Is there a specific thread I should be posting this in?

Because of the Singed debuff the Toasty Fires place on Hodir, Frost and Unholy scale much, much better than Blood for that fight. It's my personal experience that Frost beats out Unholy, just because of higher crit rates on it's biggest hitting attack, larger crit multipliers and the nature of Frost Strike being more spammy than Scourge Strike (especially if you time AMS right).
#1538SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feru
Originally Posted by Darkside
Because of the Singed debuff the Toasty Fires place on Hodir, Frost and Unholy scale much, much better than Blood for that fight. It's my personal experience that Frost beats out Unholy, just because of higher crit rates on it's biggest hitting attack, larger crit multipliers and the nature of Frost Strike being more spammy than Scourge Strike (especially if you time AMS right).
Thanks! I was also considering the possibility that the scourge strike dual wield build might out-scale 2H builds because of its scaling with haste. Would that outweigh the scaling from crit that frost would receive or am I simply mistaken believing that DW builds would benefit more from haste?

#1540SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Gorynal
Tanking before raid content

Is there is gear limit where unholy becomes better at AOE tanking or do you need a higher avoidence to make this worthwhile. I gather this was the case before the last patch but then i lost track of the conversation and now i'm lost.

The fireside chat about tanking is all about ulduar and I've not even started raids yet.

Basically my question is should I be going frost till a good way through Naxx or should I go with unholy straight away and how much of a difference does this make?

(I dont really want to start killing my guildies to test it out unless i have to)
#1541SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tima
All of the trees have pros and cons for tanking - your threat and ability to take/avoid damage will increase as your gear improves in any tree. For Naxx and pre-raid (heroics), regardless of tree, I highly recommend picking up Morbidity 3/3 and the Death and Decay glyph - this will make your life as a tank much, much easier. Frost has high avoidance, better damage reduction, and good AOE; Blood has high health, self-healing, and great single-target threat; Unholy with UB and cascading magic-reducing cooldowns make aoe threat and magic tanking pretty simple. Though the hard-core tanking pundits down in Suno's Fireside chat will argue fiercely that one tree is better than another, I'm a firm believer that it all comes down to preference, playstyle, and skill, and that all trees are more-or-less equal, depending on the circumstances.
#1542SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3f1reburn
Could someone give a thorough explanation of the T8 4-set bonus? Here's my interpretation:

If I recall correctly, the Anti-Magic shell stops when 50% of my health's worth of spells are absorbed or when 5 seconds expire. So the setbonus should correctly reduce the damage taken for 5 seconds on a mob that doesn't do magic damage.

Is this reduction is before or after armor reduction?
#1543SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by f1reburn
Could someone give a thorough explanation of the T8 4-set bonus? Here's my interpretation:

If I recall correctly, the Anti-Magic shell stops when 50% of my health's worth of spells are absorbed or when 5 seconds expire. So the setbonus should correctly reduce the damage taken for 5 seconds on a mob that doesn't do magic damage.

Is this reduction is before or after armor reduction?
It doesn't matter. Since they're multiplicative reductions, you get the same result if it's before or after.

#1546SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Athika
Blood AoE grinding:

The rune-rotation you could use for Blood AoE is:
Death and Decay -> Icy Touch -> Plague Strike -> Pestilence (now you're out of runes)
Death Strike -> Blood Boil -> Death Strike -> Blood Boil (out of runes again)
Blood Boil times 6 (using Pestilence and possibly the Glyph of Disease to refresh diseases)

Blood Boil would be your best AoE-attack, but note it takes 20 seconds already to get to the "Blood Boil times 6" part, as you have to convert runes (using Death Strike) to Death Runes. An added advantage of using Death Strike is that you regain health -> lower downtime.

If you would spec 50/0/21, you would be able to pick up Unholy Blight, which would help at AoE-grinding.

Frost AoE grinding:

The rotation I use for AoE-tanking and grinding:
Death and Decay -> Howling Blast -> Blood Boil
Death Strike/Obliterate -> Blood Boil -> Howling Blast -> Blood Boil

The Glyph of Howling Blast is very important here. It infects all targets with Frost Fever, allowing Blood Boil to get its 1.5x modifier (it only needs 1 disease up for max damage).

The advantages of this spec are:
- No need to spread diseases using Pestilence, Howling Blast (Glyphed) infects targets with FF
- Easy rotation
- A lot of AoE-damage at the start. Notice you can use Deathchill (guaranteed crit, on all targets) with Howling Blast for some insane damage. Killing Machine procs also serve you very well.


I don't know enough about Unholy to elaborate.


Good luck and have fun.

#1549SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Yessia
Originally Posted by CKaz
Quick query to tailgate -
Anyone either point me to/suggest best 3.1 builds to run up level 60-80?

I had Blood, I'm thinking Unholy, also with thoughts to the best Glyphs, thanks for any thoughts and/or links.
[I've been looking but I think most everyone and their Mom already levelled their DKs, I'm coming from Pally and Warr]
Unholy and blood are both fine and probably really close to equal for leveling. For the most part you want to try to whenever possible to pull as many mobs as you can and just kill things with aoe, and unholy is definitely better at aoe. I also liked unholy because a big part of leveling is travel time and you improve both your mount(on a pale horse) and movement(unholy presence) speed as unholy. I preferred unholy presence so I could get damage out faster, you'll usually kill a lot of mobs before you can use all 6 runes in blood presence, in unholy though you can usually get everything off and a rune ability or two, aoe pulls are also much easier when you can get your diseases up and spread quicker.

#1552SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Flippers
What is currently the best rune for Frost DPS?(Not BiS geared, no XT-sigil)
Some people say FC is the best until at least you get XT-Sigil, and some say razorice is the best all the way.
Can i get some clarification about this? thanks
#1553SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by Flippers
What is currently the best rune for Frost DPS?(Not BiS geared, no XT-sigil)
Some people say FC is the best until at least you get XT-Sigil, and some say razorice is the best all the way.
Can i get some clarification about this? thanks
I'm fairly certain that FC beats Razorice in almost all scenarios. I'm not entirely sure why, but my guess would be that it has to do with the great deal of target swapping that any DPS class has to do in Ulduar. All fights except for Ignis and Vezax have some adds/target swap component to them and Razorice, being a stacking DEbuff, can't compete nearly as well in those situations as FC.

Finally, if you don't have the Sigil, there's no point in speccing frost at the moment. You will get MUCH more mileage out of Unholy.
#1554SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Flippers
Ive really had issues with Frost vs. Unholy.
Im really not a fan of Unholy and i dont enjoy the spec as much as i enjoy Frost.

I tried my single target dps with Unholy(12/0/59) with my current gears, using this rotation
PS>IT>SS>BS>BS>RP dump
SS>SS>SS>RP dump

I didn't enojy what i was doing so i switched to Frost(17/51/3) using my current gear as well with this rotation
PS>IT>OB>BS>BS>FS dump
PS>IT>OB>OB>FS dump
HB on rime procs.

After a couple of tests, i found out that I got 300 DPS inc when i switched to Frost from Unholy. Am I doing something wrong? Both dps were tested on a boss dummy.
#1555SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by Flippers
Am I doing something wrong? Both dps were tested on a boss dummy.
Yes, you were testing the viability of a RAID spec against a TARGET DUMMY. It's an inherently flawed comparison, as the dummies are almost always in execute range, assume ideal conditions, have exactly 0 AoE component, no debuffs/buffs etc. etc. I could go on, but you get the point.

Furthermore, what you "enjoy" and what is actually effective are very often two completely different things. If you're looking for a spec that's fun then by all means, spec Frost without the sigil. But you will do significantly (in the range of 10-20%) less DPS than if you had picked a spec that is better suited to your current gear availability.
#1556SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by Flippers
Ive really had issues with Frost vs. Unholy.
Im really not a fan of Unholy and i dont enjoy the spec as much as i enjoy Frost.

After a couple of tests, i found out that I got 300 DPS inc when i switched to Frost from Unholy. Am I doing something wrong? Both dps were tested on a boss dummy.
What is important to remember is you are playing a game, hopefully to have some fun. Even if you have the potential to do 500 dps more with Unholy in a raid buffed setting, it seems better to spec Frost since you said you enjoy it more and you seem to understand the rotation for Frost better. Also people usually perform better when they enjoy what they are doing.

Now if you were in a top tier guild and you may get gkicked for 500 dps less than you should be doing, that is a different story, but I don't think you have to worry about that.
#1557SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Taidaisher
I have been reading through these forums for a while, and the information provided has been very helpful. I have read and understand that +str is the most important stat to chase as a DK. I don't raid much outside of OS/VoA, so I don't have access to high end gear. I have been searching for gear with +str stats, but have noticed that most of the gear that has +str is geared towards tanks (defense rating, dodge rating, parry, etc.).
What would be the next best stat to chase? AP? AGI? Or is it better to take the +str gear with the extra tanking enchants/stats or go after gear that doesn't have +str but has the dps enchants/stats?
#1558SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Probably not. There are a few instances where tank gear can come close to competing with DPS gear, but they are few and far between.

If you don't run Ulduar, check out the following list of pre-3.1 gear that has strength on it and try to pick of some of it: Plate Armor - Items - World of Warcraft.

As far as secondary stats go, it depends heavily on your spec. Frost gets a lot of mileage out of crit and Blood goes ape-shit for Armor Penetration (I'm not entirely sure what Unholy likes, but I imagine you can find it on these forums somewhere). You should always be hit-capped and either at or just under the expertise soft cap, so aim to pick up gear that helps you meet either of those criterion.
#1559SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3zeheres
Originally Posted by Darkside
Finally, if you don't have the Sigil, there's no point in speccing frost at the moment. You will get MUCH more mileage out of Unholy.
This is absolutely not true. Frost provides amazing numbers even without XT's sigil and is definitely competitive.

#1566SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Stoical
Originally Posted by Griefknight
Sigil of the Vengeful Heart is the best DPS sigil in the game right now, if you have it don't even worry about getting Awareness.
This is wrong if you are Unholy, which both he and you are. See the Unholy thread for more specific discussion. The most recent specific numbers in there are from a post by Methods in mid-April, when he said "Difference = ~23 DPS in favor of Awareness WITH T7 (T8 = no contest and Awareness wins by far)." There are some later posts agreeing with that.

The blue sigil is pretty weak, so I'd imagine VH is better until you get Awareness, but I haven't run numbers or anything to confirm that. Not that it matters, though, you can buy Awareness with Emblems of Valor now, you don't need to farm Naxx for it.
#1567SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Vexill
Spell deflection obviously doesn't do a lot on Vesax, but I think that's the only fight where it actually does nothing(unless he finishes casting but then you're in trouble anyway). It works on almost everything, including dots and AEs, but works on a tick per tick basis. It averages to a passive 9%reduction, for 3points I don't think it's a dilemna.

#1569SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pyros
Originally Posted by Vexill
Hi guys, I found this comment by Pyros in Suno's thread. It was accepted by the thread as fact but I can't find any links to where this is shown in testing or math (even google has failed me)? Does anyone have the link or know which thread it took place in?

Failing a link to something I can read what I'm looking for is some validation on the spell deflection working on AE's comment. I know it worked on dragons breath, but would it work on something like a mage's blast wave or blizzard spell? How about Saph's blizzards?

Its possible that I'm just fundamentally misunderstanding something about spell types which is making the operation of this talent hard for me to understand?
I haven't posted any actual testing screens or whatever, I did run a few tests post 3.1 to find out if it was still worth taking. The first few tests were simply getting a mage to cast Arcane Missiles on me(chanelling spell, can absorb any of the ticks) and Cone of Cold(non targetted AE, can absorb). After that I set up a MSBT alert on procs to see how often and on what it'd proc in Ulduar. It doesn't proc on Hodir Frozen blow melee attack, on Plasma Beam, on Fusion Punch. It does proc on kologarn eye beam, on YS green beams, on mimiron Heat Wave(tick based), on mimiron barrage(but you still die ^^), on mimiron bomb bots etc. I haven't tested your particular questions, but it works on Sif's blizzard on thorim hardmode so I'd bet it works on all blizzard types, and blastwave is probably not any different. The 9% is simply 20%(your parry in tanking gear) chance to proc 45%reduction averaged.

It's in my opinion a pretty solid talent, even though it's RNG so it might work on useless stuff and fail on good stuff. In a PvP setting, that'd be absorbing a tick of a fireball but not the fireball itself ^^.
#1570SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Jetlaw
I have been a frost tank since WotLK release - But recent changes to the tree and recent changes to the tanking composition and requirements of each individual tank within my guild has pushed me to choose to respec Unholy for greater passive AoE add control with Death and Decay, Unholy Blight, Wandering Plague etc. while still maintaining the capacity to single-target to my standard 6.5k+ sustained single-target TPS in a single spec.

#1571SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by Jetlaw
Firstly: For a standard Unholy main-tanking build (below) - What would be more beneficial between 3/5 Dark Conviction and 2/2 Two-Handed Weapon Specialization plus 1/5 Dark Conviction purely based on a maximum TPS standpoint.

No Ebon Plaguebringer because I'm not the only unholy DK in the raid and the debuff overlap is rarely if ever needed.

[Glyph of Rune Strike]
If you have a tanking build with Dark Conviction and no Ebon Plaguebringer, that seems wrong. Both give 1% crit, but Ebon also gives a debuff (even if it is wasted, it still gives more than the other).

Rune Strike is a solid tps increase and UB sounds decent as well (to save some RP and GCDs).
#1572SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Jetlaw
Originally Posted by frmorrison
If you have a tanking build with Dark Conviction and no Ebon Plaguebringer, that seems wrong. Both give 1% crit, but Ebon also gives a debuff (even if it is wasted, it still gives more than the other)
I remember mention once when I was testing out Unholy awhile back that I asked the other death knight why his damage was so disproportionately lower that night than previous. He replied that my Ebon Plague interfered with his, meaning he lost a portion of damage (Perhaps due to not having a third registered disease) - Which is why I didn't go down to it. I merrily assumed that Crypt Fever and Ebon Plague could be applied at the same time, but two Ebon Plagues could not. Considering I had talents that gave similar benefits (At least in the way of Dark Conviction) while not overlapping two Ebon Plagues which may still cause issues I partially assumed it would be more benefit for the raid group overall if I didn't spec into Ebon Plaguebringer so the debuffs wouldn't overlap.

Of course it might have been him slacking, but he's the ex-First Scarab Lord of my server so I trusted in what he said - Admittedly that was pre-3.1 so things may have changed since then. If that is infact the case I may well just throw all 3 into Ebon Plaguebringer then and it would immediately answer my question - Failing that, I supppose in hindsight looking at my question Two-Handed Weapon Spec's 4% two-handed damage would beat 2% crit purely based on the fact that (Unless I'm mistaken) disease crits can't tick so they gain nothing from either talent, Unholy Blight can't crit so that gains nothing from either talent and that leaves almost predominantly strikes which gain benefit from both but with a double-hit from two-handed wep spec. Of course it doesn't factor in increased damage from critical strikes nor does it factor in Death and Decay or Icy Touch crits, both skills which are not effected by two-handed wep spec.

At least I learned not to judge a book by it's cover on first glance, I can honestly say I completely overlooked the crit bonus in Ebon Plaguebringer though.

As for the glyph advice, I was erring on both glyphs too. I've almost never raided without my Rune Strike glpyh but there are so many more options for Unholy than Frost which is where my confusion came in.
Last edited by Jetlaw : 05/14/09 at 11:07 AM. Reason: Noticed I forgot to quote what I was replying to ^^
#1573SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3coca
I'm normally Unholy and I had to go frost last night for Yogg attempts since our shaman and other DK didn't log on. Anyway I can look up the spec easily but the rotations have me baffled. I always thought OB did more dmg than FS but apparently looking at the crit numbers I had last night (17-19k for FS) it seems like that isn't the case. Does that mean I should prioritize FS instead of OB whenever it is available? Maybe I was doing something wrong but it seems like during last night's run my runic power was always capped. I was used to Unholy doing 2 disese (IT, PS) then OB OB BS BS FS FS FS FS and start the cycle again. Is this wrong? I'm just used to it w/ the unholy build but if people know any better please advise.

Should I glyph for HB? Should I run with only 1 disease (think single target boss dps only) or should I put 2 disease on the target and go from there? Any advice is much appreciated.
#1574SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
As Frost, Oblit without the new sigil will generally do more damage than Frost Strike (it depends a little on your group comp, especially for 10mans). Once you get the sigil, though, FS will be doing a LOT more damage than Oblit. However, this doesn't mean that you should always FS whenever you have the RP to do so. You should only use FS if you meet any of the following criteria:

(1) All your runes are on cooldown.
(2) You have a Killing Machine proc.
(3) You are or will be RP capped if you use a runic attack.

Otherwise it's more DPS to use your runes and then FS while they recharge. The only possible exception to this is if they boss is VERY close to dying (<3%), in which case you want to spam your highest damage attack as much as possible.

It's still up in the air as to whether or not 1 disease or 2 disease is a superior spec. At this point, I think it's largely fight dependent and you will probably see very similar results with both of them, assuming you can master each of their unique playstyles.
#1575SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3coca
Originally Posted by Darkside
As Frost, Oblit without the new sigil will generally do more damage than Frost Strike (it depends a little on your group comp, especially for 10mans). Once you get the sigil, though, FS will be doing a LOT more damage than Oblit. However, this doesn't mean that you should always FS whenever you have the RP to do so. You should only use FS if you meet any of the following criteria:

(1) All your runes are on cooldown.
(2) You have a Killing Machine proc.
(3) You are or will be RP capped if you use a runic attack.

Otherwise it's more DPS to use your runes and then FS while they recharge. The only possible exception to this is if they boss is VERY close to dying (<3%), in which case you want to spam your highest damage attack as much as possible.

It's still up in the air as to whether or not 1 disease or 2 disease is a superior spec. At this point, I think it's largely fight dependent and you will probably see very similar results with both of them, assuming you can master each of their unique playstyles.

#1576SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by coca
Thanks for the quick response. I have the sigil from XT maybe that is why i'm seeing larger numbers from FS. Other questions I have is should I glyph for HB or go for IT? Or maybe that is dependent on whether I play 1 disease or 2. I'll glyph for IT and go for 2 diseases. Should I HB whenever Rime procs? That does cost me a GCD so I was wondering if it is worth it. As it is now I always have some button to press whether it is OB or FS or BS but there doesn't seem to be any downtime and I just feel like I have more runic power than I can spend. I'm running in Blood btw maybe i can try it with Unholy presence instead maybe that'll change things.

For now I'll just go similair path with Unholy and replace DC with FS and SS with OB?
You have the right idea, 1 disease with HB, 2 with IT.

I play frost in Unholy Presence with the IT glyph, since I've found that I'm almost always GCD capped in some form in Blood Presence. There's just too much to do with a 130 RP cap and a 32 RP high damage attack. In UP, I generally HB on every Rime proc, as the extra damage can't hurt (so long as my runes are on cooldown and I'm not RP capped).

As a general rule, you can replace DC with FS and SS with OB, but it'll end up being a different in practice. Your disease will be 3s shorter, so you'll have to renew them more often and OB won't refresh their duration. FS is a much more spammy move than DC as well, so you'll find that you're dumping RP a lot more often that you were with Unholy.
#1577SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by coca
Thanks for the quick response. I have the sigil from XT maybe that is why i'm seeing larger numbers from FS. Other questions I have is should I glyph for HB or go for IT? Or maybe that is dependent on whether I play 1 disease or 2. I'll glyph for IT and go for 2 diseases. Should I HB whenever Rime procs? That does cost me a GCD so I was wondering if it is worth it. As it is now I always have some button to press whether it is OB or FS or BS but there doesn't seem to be any downtime and I just feel like I have more runic power than I can spend. I'm running in Blood btw maybe i can try it with Unholy presence instead maybe that'll change things.

For now I'll just go similair path with Unholy and replace DC with FS and SS with OB?
Glyph for IT. If you are running a two disease rotation then FF application from HB would be a waste. The extra runic power generated from the IT glyph will provide you with a few extra FS over the course of a boss battle. Save the rime proc for when your runes are down when possible. Priority wise it should be low priority to use the rime proc, unless you are AOE'ing. Definitely use blood presence, the 15% loss in damage will hurt you on the meters. If the rotations feel tight, it's because you're not used to them yet.
#1578SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by Nimic
Definitely use blood presence, the 15% loss in damage will hurt you on the meters. If the rotations feel tight, it's because you're not used to them yet.
This is flat out not true. It varies widely on a fight to fight basis, as you can tell by looking through the Wowmeter boards.

Personally, I've found Unholy Presence to generally be better DPS than Blood, just because my RP generation is so high with Glyphed IT and the abundance of magic damage present in Ulduar. I tend to gain about 200-300 RP from AMS alone on any given fight and I have nowhere near the GCDs to use it all in Blood Presence.

For those who are interested, here's my latest parse of Frost in Unholy Presence: World of Logs - Real Time Raid Analysis.

#1581SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by coca
That is new to me to use IT on Death Runes? Is this a dps increase over using OB? I guess is using IT twice and FS better than OB? I guess I have to test it out to determine if we have enough GCD to use that extra FS in the rotation or not and whether the dps from IT and those extra FS outdps the OB. If others have already tested this and I'm just being ignorant please do tell.
On a given raid night for me, two ITs will hit for about 5804 and generate 50 RP. Oblit will hit for an average of 6890 and generate about 25 RP. So you can see that by using IT instead of OB, you lose about 1k damage and gain 25 RP. This runic power gain EASILY offsets the loss of damage, resulting in a net DPS gain.
#1582SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3richard
How does [Glyph of Icebound Fortitude] work? Is it useful as a tank, or will it only increase the amount reduced if you have 0 defense rating?
#1583SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by richard
How does [Glyph of Icebound Fortitude] work? Is it useful as a tank, or will it only increase the amount reduced if you have 0 defense rating?
According to this the glyph simply adds 10% to the reduction given by IBF, regardless of your defense skill.

Razorice was stealth nerfed/bugged in 3.1 to only stack to 5%, it has never been 10% on live servers despite patch notes. It's really not worth using for any spec on any fight (except maybe Hodir and even that is pretty thin).
#1591SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3thumper242
Last night I tried out WoWwebstats for the first time on our second night in naxx and was shocked to find that White damage made up nearly a third of my overall damage.

51/0/20 is my spec.
Major Glyphs are [Glyph of Dancing Rune Weapon], [Glyph of Dark Death], and [Glyph of Death Strike]
Minor are [Glyph of Pestilence], [Glyph of Raise Dead], and [Glyph of Horn of Winter].

For my rotation I have a macro that I mash.
/castsequence reset=1 Plague Strike, Icy Touch, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Death Strike, Death Coil, Death Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Heart Strike, Death Coil, Death Coil
Then a Macro I use for burst damage and/or getting horn of winter up once I get some death runes and full runic power.
/castsequence reset=1 Horn of Winter, Blood Tap, Dancing Rune Weapon, Vampiric Blood, Raise Dead
The report, seen here, shows white damage at 27% of my total output, followed by heart strike and death strike at 23% and 13% respectively.

In a 20 second rotation I auto attack five times, compared to heart strike's six and death strike's 2. These numbers just seem a bit out of wack.

I suppose my question, after all that, is why is my white damage so high? My DPS seems to match my gear so I'm not too concerned. But I also don't want to be sitting idly by while there is some DPS to be had.

** Edited to fix redundant typo
#1592SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3◊ Bryne
Originally Posted by thumper242
Last night I tried out WoWwebstats for the first time on our second night in naxx and was shocked to find that White damage made up nearly a third of my overall damage.

For my rotation I have a macro that I mash.
Your white damage is so high because you are using a shitty macro. Learn how to run the rotations correctly and manually and you should see your DPS go up as your % of white damage goes down.
#1593SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Castsequence-macros never yield the same DPS as actually learning the rotation and being proficient at it yourself. Although a Blood spec at a Patchwerk-like fight might be the sole exception to this, since you really can't do a lot wrong there - if you are expertise capped.

Which you are not. Which isn't terribly bad unless you are using a castsequence macro. As you can see you missed more than 8% of your Heart Strikes, which is your main nuke in Blood. If you do the rotation yourself you just HS again, if you use a macro the HS ist lost. So using a macro yields inefficient use of abilities, therefore the percentage of white damage increases (since you can't mess up a lot there). If you think 4k DPS is a lot for your gear status, imagine what heights you would be able to reach if you actually pushed more than one button.

Also, 27% is closer to one quarter than one third, I think usually white DPS jumps between 20 and 25% for Blood.
But seriously, I'd recommend you don't even start using cast sequence macros. They might not be terribly shitty in Naxx, but as content progresses it will probably progress without you, since the DPS gap only increases as encounters become more versatile and difficult. Also, Blood rotation isn't very hard to learn.
#1594SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3shopshopshop
Imp. Icy Talons
How valuable is Improved Icy Talons to a raid? My guild doesn't currently run with an Enh. Shaman and I usually spec Frost DPS, but recently I've been considering swapping to Unholy or just trying out different specs. Is it worth staying Frost to keep buffing the raid?
#1595SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ashur25
Originally Posted by shopshopshop
How valuable is Improved Icy Talons to a raid? My guild doesn't currently run with an Enh. Shaman and I usually spec Frost DPS, but recently I've been considering swapping to Unholy or just trying out different specs. Is it worth staying Frost to keep buffing the raid?
simple answer: Yes, giving your whole raid 20% haste is a much bigger (raid) dps increase than you could ever get by switching to blood or unholy
#1596SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3coca
Originally Posted by Ashur25
simple answer: Yes, giving your whole raid 20% haste is a much bigger (raid) dps increase than you could ever get by switching to blood or unholy
Well this really does depends on your raid composition. Are you running 25 or 10? If you're running 10 and you're caster heavy then being unholy would be more beneficial because of the 13% magic debuff. If you're melee heavy then frost would be more beneficial. In 25 man I'm pretty sure you're half melee and half caster so you'd most likely benefit the raid more with a haste benefit for the melee.
#1597SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3richard
It depends on the specs of other classes, if you don't have the 10% AP buff it would be more beneficial to raid DPS to spec blood and let a shaman use windfury (16%) anyway.
#1598SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Feru

#1599SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by Feru
I'm curious to know how the [Furious Gladiator's Crusher] stacks up against the PvE weapons.
They actually stack up very nicely, assuming you can actually get your hands on one. The high base damage makes them very comparable to Aesir's/Voldrethar and they probably edge out a lot of the 232 weapons (especially those without strength).

#1604SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
You didn't by chance do Archavon in VoA and were standing in that cloud he does sometimes which decreases your chance to hit by 50%?

As for the parry: try standing behind the mob and not in front. The lack of dodges shows that it's clearly a positioning problem and not your expertise being bugged or something.
#1605SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Waddy

There's your problem right there, you're still stuck in Naxx. Every single fight in Ulduar has a fairly major AoE component, and on these fights, WP truly shines. On these fights, it'll end up being 5-7% of your total damage, which is FAR from negligible.
#1608SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3coca

Most likely not. Point is even if you can take points away from it why would you? Where would you put those points in instead? If you're looking at the blood tree, you won't have enough points to put into blood to be able to get all the good talents from the deeper blood tree.

I am pretty happy with frost and unholy parts, I know some people dont like morbidity but i get a lot of use out of D&D so the 15 second cooldown is nice. The imp icy touch is not set in stone we just dont have a lot of shamans so I usually get some use out of it. Mostly it is the blood talents that I am debating.

Scent of Blood: I have seen so many tanks and guide specs suggest this but for the life of me I cannot figure out why. As a blood tank 90% of the time I have RP coming out my ears, I have absolutly no need for more RP when there are plenty of other places to put my talents.

Anyways as a dk my parry chance is pretty low anyways and a low chance at advoiding a low amount of damage just doesn't seem that justifiable. Bloodworms: I have never used this because I don't think I have ever heard anyone reccomend it. Just wondering why, what kind of healing do you get out of it?

Imp blood pres: Again I didn't see the use out of spending 2 points for a minute amount of healing but in thinking about it it is basicly a permanent mark of blood so why not?

Sudden Doom: Free death coils are great I am sure I just have never had the free points for it.

I hope this is ok to post here, if not I apologize but I have searched the forums for a few days and I have not been able to find any real information regarding these talents.

#1618SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Afabar
AoTD do not taunt Boss level mob, but it still taunt adds. So it might a bad idea on some fight like Ignis.
You will find more information in the following threads in this forum section :
Raid Tested uses of Army of the Dead
Pet Discussion - (Garg, AotD, Ghoul)
