#1624SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Soilantgreen64
Originally Posted by the_haunted
Hello,

I´m struggling with what expertise one should have as blood dk in raiding environment? I did read countless threads on this issue, but i did´nt got a final answer.

a) Should i throw away my 27-expertise jc-gems for 27-strenght jc-gems??
b) I have 24 expertise now, but wasted 3 slots with exp. gems and hands/wrists with +15 exp. enchants. Does that make sense?
c) if i should regem, whats the minimum exp. i should go with?

Best regards, and thanks in advance!
a) Yes, you want to gem for STR over expertise.

Ideally you hit the soft cap of 26 Expertise (note - not "Expertise Rating" ~213.2), but it's more something you want to be keeping an eye on rather than forcing through gemming, taking a worse item just for expertise, etc.
#1625SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3rooppa
Expertise, I know it effect's Physical hits such as HS or OB, and I know that it does not effect moves such as HB or IT. But does it effect BB?

Reason why I ask is that i have been toying with the idea of dropping ALL expertise from gear, and going pure avoidence/stamina stats, and using a rotation of IT,HB,PS,BB,BB Runic dump.

Just wondering if anyone has looked at this? And although it would generate less single target DPS, would the benefit of not having to worry about expertise and therefore having much higher stamina/avoidence be useful?

Baring inmind that RS and FS are not effected by expertise anyway, threat should not take as large a nose dive as I suspect.

Just looking at bog standard recount information while tanking, my white damage is extreamly low anyway, and therefore the % of threat generated via my white dps being rather small. Just curious if anyone has looked into this, and if the TPS loss is worth the extra tanking stats that could be gained?
#1626SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Pox
Rune Strike, Scent of Blood, and Killing Machine
It has been stated that Killing Machine only procs off of white damage auto-attacks, from what I could find, which seems all well and good. The verbiage on Scent of Blood (gain of runic power on next 3 melee attacks) would lead me to believe it has the same effect, and unable to find any explicit contradiction of this, I'm assuming that this is indeed how it works.

The question(s) I have are the following:
Can a Rune Strike trigger Killing Machine? I know for many purposes, such as BCB and Necrosis, it isn't considered a standard melee, and if so, it would seem that the more avoidance you have the less useful Killing Machine might be. The reasoning being more avoidance -> more rune strikes -> fewer auto-attacks.

As for Scent of Blood, does the runic power gain only come during auto-attacks, or can it be triggered by specials? And is Rune Strike considered an auto-attack and essentially refund runic power when Scent of Blood is up?

#1627SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ridde
Hi!

I have a pretty simple question: What is the basic rotation for Blood (51/2/18) ?

Have always been Unholy, and havn't been playing for a few months, now im back for Ulduar and heard that Blood has been buffed, but I cant figure out a good rotation.
#1628SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by rooppa
Expertise, I know it effect's Physical hits such as HS or OB, and I know that it does not effect moves such as HB or IT. But does it effect BB?

Reason why I ask is that i have been toying with the idea of dropping ALL expertise from gear, and going pure avoidence/stamina stats, and using a rotation of IT,HB,PS,BB,BB Runic dump.

Just wondering if anyone has looked at this? And although it would generate less single target DPS, would the benefit of not having to worry about expertise and therefore having much higher stamina/avoidence be useful?

Baring inmind that RS and FS are not effected by expertise anyway, threat should not take as large a nose dive as I suspect.
I would not recommend going this route. You will have single target aggro problems. This rotation sound gimmicky, and usually that's a good indication something is wrong with it. To answer your original question, BB is not effected by expertise.

Stacking avoidance at the expense of expertise is probably not smart because avoidance has diminishing returns. So up until about 25 expertise, you will likely generate more aggro from expertise w/ a standard rotation than you would from the extra rune strikes from stacking avoidance.

As you gear up, you'll gain avoidance naturally, and not at the expense of other stats. I'd say the average fully Nax geared DK is going to have at least 40% - 50% avoidance.

Keep your stats balanced, and you'll succeed. Avoidance has very little value on high magic damage fights. Stamina almost always has value, but only up until a certain point. Then it's up to the healers.
#1629SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by Ridde
Hi!

I have a pretty simple question: What is the basic rotation for Blood (51/2/18) ?
IT > PS > HS > HS > DS > RPD
DS > HS > HS > HS > HS > RPD

Your first RPD should be your Runic Weapon when you hit 130 RP. Your second dump is Death Coil.
#1630SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3rooppa
Originally Posted by Nimic
I would not recommend going this route. You will have single target aggro problems. This rotation sound gimmicky, and usually that's a good indication something is wrong with it. To answer your original question, BB is not effected by expertise.

Stacking avoidance at the expense of expertise is probably not smart because avoidance has diminishing returns. So up until about 25 expertise, you will likely generate more aggro from expertise w/ a standard rotation than you would from the extra rune strikes from stacking avoidance.

As you gear up, you'll gain avoidance naturally, and not at the expense of other stats. I'd say the average fully Nax geared DK is going to have at least 40% - 50% avoidance.

Keep your stats balanced, and you'll succeed. Avoidance has very little value on high magic damage fights. Stamina almost always has value, but only up until a certain point. Then it's up to the healers.

And if the TPS say drops to a point where it is still possible to keep agro from the most agro hungry DPS, then the gimick then becomes interesting for gaining extra stamina/avoidence without the worry of not being able to hold agro.

#1632SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3the_haunted

If i go strictly on STR (switching items in with ARP, gemming, enchanting, etc.) my exp. drops from 24 to 16. Which seems very low for a blood dk where a lot of dmg comes from physical strikes.

Has someone done math about at what point expertise is more valuable than strength?

E.g. Never drop below XX exp or you will never catch up the missed strikes with the harder hits?
#1633SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by Ridde
One followup question, bloodworms should I take it or not? Will it fuck up the healing?
I personally use Bloodworms. The only fight which bloodworms have been known to cause a problem on is Yogg Saron. The alternative is Rune Tap, which uses a blood rune to activate, and does no DPS. Bloodworms does 75 - 100dps on a fight without AOE damage. Rune Tap is a nice "oh shit" button, but if your raid healers are on the ball, mostly useless.
#1634SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Nimic
Has someone done math about at what point expertise is more valuable than strength? E.g. Never drop below XX exp or you will never catch up the missed strikes with the harder hits?
The Blood DPS thread frequently recommends only gemming for STR. As DPS, you'll be hitting from the back, so parry is off the table, decreasing the value of expertise. Check out the stat weights to prioritize your stat choices. I don't recall ever seeing a point where expertise is a better choice than strength.

I can tell you that with 18 expertise, my physical attacks are dodged on average about 1.5% of the time and never parried (which is exactly what you would expect mathematically). That equates to about 2-3 missed attacks for me on the average fight in Ulduar 25. Maybe 20k damage assuming they all critically hit. Without doing the math, I would say that making the 98.5% of hits that landed hit harder is my priority.
Last edited by Nimic : 05/20/09 at 6:11 PM.
#1635SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by rooppa
Oh i compelatly understand what you mean, and I knew that Single target TPS would suffer because of it, am more curious as to "by how much?" And if the TPS say drops to a point where it is still possible to keep agro from the most agro hungry DPS, then the gimick then becomes interesting for gaining extra stamina/avoidence without the worry of not being able to hold agro.
It all really depends on the DPS of your raid members if you can hold aggro. According to WoWWiki the frost presence threat multiplier is 2.0735. So assuming no rune strikes, your total threat will be your damage done * 2.0735. Your rotation is certainly not going to build any "snap aggro" on a single target. Anyhow, do you run Omen or WWS? If so, I'd suggest giving it a try for yourself and comparing the results to your current build.

My opinion is that you are going to be using lower DPS multi-target spells for single target tanking, and that your aggro is going to suffer a lot more than you realize. Once the rune strikes start piling up, it just might work though. It just doesn't make any sense to me why you'd want to do this... Everything in the game that has been tanked up until this point by a DK has not needed this odd strategy, why reinvent the wheel?

#1637SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3rooppa
Originally Posted by Nimic
why reinvent the wheel?
Am just more thinking at the way we as DK's value expertise at the moment. Currently we veiw it at a way to increase TPS, but am thinking overall that if there was a way to 1) compleatly disreguard expertise and still sustain a decent amount of TPS then opens the door for more stats that yeild a higher amount of TPS, such as Strengh or even crit. 2) As none of the moves that you could use could be parried, it stops the dreaded parry haste gibbing situation that sometimes occurs.

Back in TBC there was the old rogue crusade of being "unhittable" , and with the correct set of gear/gems/buffs it could be achieved. So yes, doing this would be a gimmick, but if it is able to perform its funcion , namely "keeping agro" then I believe it might be worthwhile exploring.

I have been experimenting with this in a very simple naxx 10 man run the other evening, and saw no problems at all on tanking say patchwork or thaddius. Was comfortably putting out 5.5k TPS the whole fight, and DPS was not "on my heals" any more than using a standard rotation. A simple test I know, but had to start somewhere. Now this is before I have altered gear and dropped expertise, but am pretty confident that dropping to even the bare 6-7 expertise on my gear and swaping stats for more avoidence and strengh that the TPS would not suffer but would infact go up.

Will be working on this in greater details this evening and more than happy to actualy post some numbers of what I find rather than mindless "what if this happened drivel"

but Im a Frost DK tank and i recently specced bladed armour and scent of blood in the blood tree instead of 2 handed weapon specializaion.

#1639SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Impuure
i was just wondering at what point should i give up AP for Crit and vice versa.

i mean i have been getting upgrades that say like -70 ap but +1.07% to crit. im just trying to figure out at what point should i not take a piece with -AP for +crit.
#1640SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by Impuure
i was just wondering at what point should i give up AP for Crit and vice versa.

i mean i have been getting upgrades that say like -70 ap but +1.07% to crit. im just trying to figure out at what point should i not take a piece with -AP for +crit.
It is all about stat weights. Check out the Optimal Gearing Thread for the stat weights for your particular spec. I.E. for blood, the stat weight of ATK is 1, and the stat weight of crit is 1.56. So 70 ATK would equal 70, and 10 crit would equal 15.6. Whichever upgrade gives you the most total points is usually the winner. That is vastly over simplified, but you get the point.
#1641SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Impuure
thanks a bunch

I haven't really tested this, but I know it was confirmed during beta that rune strike counts as a white attack for KM. I would guess it would also count for SoB in the same way.

I can tell you that with 18 expertise, my physical attacks are dodged on average about 1.5% of the time and never parried (which is exactly what you would expect mathematically). That equates to about 2-3 missed attacks for me on the average fight in Ulduar 25. Maybe 20k damage assuming they all critically hit. Thanks for the responses!

I did Ulduar25 yesterday regemmed straight to STR with 17 exp (24 exp before re-gem), and i must say that i´m not happy at all. The whole handling seemed to be screwed up by missed (3,4-3,9% miss in my case) strikes.

I did hit harder offcourse, but had a hard time to keep the rotation running. So it just doesn´t make sense to me to let exp drop under a certain value.

Last edited by the_haunted : 05/22/09 at 6:08 AM.
#1645SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Soilantgreen64
Originally Posted by the_haunted
Thanks for the responses!

I did Ulduar25 yesterday regemmed straight to STR with 17 exp (24 exp before re-gem), and i must say that i´m not happy at all. The whole handling seemed to be screwed up by missed (3,4-3,9% miss in my case) strikes.

I did hit harder offcourse, but had a hard time to keep the rotation running. So it just doesn´t make sense to me to let exp drop under a certain value.

I gemmed a socket with +27 exp instead of +27 str now and we´ll see how that works out...
When you're dps'ing, as you indicated, you will really FEEL a miss/dodge/parry, but the increase in your dmg isn't nearly as tangible. You're much less likely to notice hitting 100 dmg harder than you are a miss. This is really important to understand.

My suggestion would be to stick with the STR and run a WWS report, you can really break down all your misses well, and see what you are really losing. If it is still frustrating then you can try going back to expertise, running another WWS, and comparing your results. Don't go just off how it feels like you're doing, b/c the nature of misses will make it deceiving.

The stat weights can only tell you so much, sometimes you have to prove it to yourself.
#1646SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Flippers
For the new Frost Rotation which is:

IT>PS>OB>BS>BS>FS
OB>IT>PS>IT>IT>FS

Does this ONLY work with the XT sigil and UP?
I am currently using SoA and I was wondering if the extra RP from 2IT that leads to another FS is STILL better than another OB even w/o the XT sigil.
#1647SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3♦ Darkside
The rotation will only have enough time to be completed in Unholy Presence. It can be done without the new Sigil, but there's really no point as your DPS will be crippled. If you do not have the Sigil, you should probably be speccing into Unholy for maximum DPS.

#1652SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by Flippers
I have been putting out good numbers with 17/51/3 Frost with my mediocre gear but I'm still continuing to search for any adjustment to make it more effective for me.

Like I said, I tried the 'new' Frost rotation last night and I already expected for it to be not as effective for me.
I've been using the old rotation:
IT>PS>OB>BS>BS>FS
IT>PS>OB>OB>FS

I'm doing good dps for it with my current gear

Is there any way to better my DPS with frost? rotation or glyph-wise?
Your glyphs look good to me. A couple of suggestions though:

1. You are over hit cap by about 50. 262 or 8% should be hit cap goal, especially if you're Frost. Unholy gets more of a benefit from going over hit cap than any other tree.

2. Are you weaving in FS on KM procs? If not, that could be a big loss in DPS. Get a proc watcher, like "Tell Me When" or setup SCT with a custom event for KM. When it procs, if you have enough for a frost strike, use it immediately, then go back to your rotation. My rotation in frost looks something more like this (Blood Presence):

IT > PS > BS > BS > OB
OB > FS > OB > FS > OB > FS

Priority wise, I only cast FS when I'm A) Going to cap on RP, or B) Have a KM proc up.

3. You have some odd gem and enchanting choices. Gem for STR, and enchant for ATK as a general rule. Unless you're low on another important stat, like hit.
#1653SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Flippers
Originally Posted by Nimic
Your glyphs look good to me. A couple of suggestions though:

1. You are over hit cap by about 50. 262 or 8% should be hit cap goal, especially if you're Frost. Unholy gets more of a benefit from going over hit cap than any other tree.

2. Are you weaving in FS on KM procs? If not, that could be a big loss in DPS. Get a proc watcher, like "Tell Me When" or setup SCT with a custom event for KM. When it procs, if you have enough for a frost strike, use it immediately, then go back to your rotation. My rotation in frost looks something more like this (Blood Presence):

IT > PS > BS > BS > OB
OB > FS > OB > FS > OB > FS

Priority wise, I only cast FS when I'm A) Going to cap on RP, or B) Have a KM proc up.

3. You have some odd gem and enchanting choices. Gem for STR, and enchant for ATK as a general rule. Unless you're low on another important stat, like hit.

2.Yes I do. Golden rule for Frost is always use FS on KM procs

Anyway, I'm still looking for a better rotation that fits my gear well.
I'm trying to test FFO-BT rotation that goes like this:

IT>OB>OB>BS>FS

Any feedback on this if it works out well?
#1654SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by Flippers
Anyway, I'm still looking for a better rotation that fits my gear well.
I'm trying to test FFO-BT rotation that goes like this:

IT>OB>OB>BS>FS

Any feedback on this if it works out well?
I've found single disease, with my gear and play style to do less single target DPS on average than double disease. In AOE heavy fights, I've seen some very high numbers from the FF only style of rotation + glyph of HB. My personal preference is the double disease rotation I gave you in the previous post. Partially because it hurts my hands to run in unholy presence.

With that said, there's a lot of debate over single vs. dual disease rotations. Some of the best single target frost DPS can come from the "Machine Gun" rotation, which if I'm correct you already tried and it did not work out for you. It's gear dependent, and requires at a minimum the Sigil of Vengeance.

The rotation you should be using if you are doing single disease is as follows:

HB -> OB -> BS -> BS -> DUMP
OB -> OB -> OB -> DUMP

Obviously, it relies on the HB glyph.

I guess I'm mostly wondering if there's a sort of direct comparison to the points produced by the stats weight for a gear piece vs how much the 4-piece bonus is worth.
#1656SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rakiel
A quite possibly stupid question to put forward to your guys, but in regards to tanking - what do you guys end up emphasizing in your gemming; straight sta, stat (threat/avoidance) deficiencies, or something else? I used to push STA straight; but when I ran some quick math on it... By flipping out my non-prismatic stamina gems, I lose the grand total of 2.7k health (when fully buffed with kings and such) leaving me with an unbuffed 32.5k. For experimental purposes on threat gain; I regemmed the plain +24 sta gems to enirely focus on bringing myself up to hit/exp caps - a drastic change that will be some what mitigated in extremity once I am so lucky to even see a exp/hit weapon drop.

With how bloody hard Ulduar bosses end up hitting I've found the 2.7k HP to be damned near non-existant loss. It does make me wince to lose any HP; but because of how hard they *do* hit; I've never found myself in a situation where I would of survived if I had the 2.7k more HP.

I really like the extra boost to threat just because of how hard some of the DPS classes can push their threat when they unload, and gives them more time to nuke before they have to worry about threat issues. So I'm somewhat at an impasse; what are you guys opinions?
#1657SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3CerastesUK
Ok so I was berated yesterday for asking for BoM instead of kings last night being told that I was wrong in saying that BoM provided a better increase in dps compared to BoK. As doing some napkin maths BoM seems to provide me with more ap than BoK.

Have done a few searches and can't seem to find the answer. So which is better and why for a Unholy 2h DK?

Thanks!
#1658SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
BoK will yield overall less AP in the general case, you are right about that. However, it will also give you more crit through increased Agility and more health (1-2k more) through increasing your stamina. Furthermore, your ghoul will benefit from the increased strength, but he would not benefit from BoM. Really, though, your group should either have two paladins so you can get both, or a warrior who can battle shout.
#1659SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Keldin
Frost ST tanking.

Looking at the Frost ST tanking rotation I can see only Frost Fever being kept up and I can't see Blood Plague in there. Just to confirm, do frost tanks leave Blood Plague out on single target tanking? Either I'm missing something or I'm just stupid.

Originally Posted by Suno
Single Target Rotation - IT-BS-OB-(Blood Tap if no Death Rune)OB RPDUMP = RS/FS
Alt-Single Target Rotation - HB-BS-BS-OB OB-OB-OB RPDUMP = RS/FS (assumes HB Glyph)
#1660SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Vlakith
1) You got it right frost is the best dps spec for Hodir people went as high as 12k dps on 25 man.
2) Well try a standard frost spec like 17/51/3. Check the new frost thread it's great.
You have alot of armor penetration gear so blood would be the best choice.
3) No FS doesnt benefit from ArP since its frost dmg only physical attacks benefit from ArP

Looking at the Frost ST tanking rotation I can see only Frost Fever being kept up and I can't see Blood Plague in there. Just to confirm, do frost tanks leave Blood Plague out on single target tanking? Either I'm missing something or I'm just stupid.
You get most of threat out of your rune strikes and frost strike.That being said your priority is to keep frost fever up and land as many frost strikes and Obliterates as possible.
Its better to land an OB than PS+ BS, and its important to take as much aggro as posible at start so instead of bufing your obliterate for another 10% extra dmg you better off landing a another solid blow.

#1663SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by Spoonyou
Talent Calculator - World of Warcraft
I noticed on the DW unholy dps thread that Obliterate scales better than SS with higher levels of Armor Pen. Taking this into account, why does no one use a obliterate-based unholy 2H dps spec?
Because it would have to be a frost spec in order to get the talents that boost Obliterate properly for it to out scale SS. The viability of DW depends on deep Unholy at this time.
#1664SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nimic
Originally Posted by Keldin
Frost ST tanking.

Looking at the Frost ST tanking rotation I can see only Frost Fever being kept up and I can't see Blood Plague in there. Just to confirm, do frost tanks leave Blood Plague out on single target tanking? Either I'm missing something or I'm just stupid.
That particular rotation is used to generate maximum RP. IT is used to get +10 RP from the Glyph of Icy Touch. If you've got T7.5, the double obliterates will net you an additional 5 RP each. Then you start FS. The sooner you can start frost striking, the more aggro you're going to generate. Remember FS cannot be dodged, nor parried. It's also not boosted by either FF or BF. So it's pretty ideal for tanking, when RS isn't up.
#1665SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Manveru
Does 3% hit from Nerves of Cold Steel affect Hit Rating? Will it work on Strikes, reducing the need for +hit gear by 3%, or does it only work on white damage?
#1666SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Originally Posted by Manveru
Does 3% hit from Nerves of Cold Steel affect Hit Rating? Will it work on Strikes, reducing the need for +hit gear by 3%, or does it only work on white damage?
It works on everything that requires a one-handed weapon. So yes, also strikes when you are dual wielding, but spells are consequently not affected even if dual wielding.

but when adding the buff to the "classtimer" addon I have seen that when I activate it it is only up for 20 sec. does anyone have any information about this?

#1672SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Flippers
When would 0/10/61 outperform 12/0/59? Most people give vague answers such as "high end gears" or "at least ulduar gears".

I'm looking for a more concrete answer. Are there certain stats/dps I should reach before making the switch?
#1673SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Gromdal
Originally Posted by Gorgangio
Scent of Blood.

Since most fights you take some form of damage would this be of any use as a DPS'er as opposed to a tank. I know it may sound like a stupid question but for instance, Hodir the constant frost damage, Auri the defender, razorscale lava balls, kologarns sweep.

Would any of this damage cause Scent of Blood to kick in?
The tooltip states direct damage, thus implying a targeted ability in use against you. Damaging auras, boss-centred magic explosions, whole of room damage from arm sweeps should not proc this ability, although the razorscale fireballs may well do as they target you.


Originally Posted by Flippers
When would 0/10/61 outperform 12/0/59? Most people give vague answers such as "high end gears" or "at least ulduar gears".

I'm looking for a more concrete answer. Are there certain stats/dps I should reach before making the switch?
In the simulations in Rawr for my gear, 0/10/61 beats 12/0/59 by a whopping 36dps raid buffed. In my eyes, this isn't enough of a reason to lose the threat reduction given how often I see Thorim arena gibs/immortal guardian overaggros, and also bearing in mind that it is a theoretical maximum assuming you do everything right. There isn't a set point at which you should change, and you can model it through any number of sims as to which would be better for the current gear you have.

#1676SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Paratrooper1508
With the upcoming nerf to JC, is there another profession that is theorycrafted to eclipse it? Since WOTLK I've always been taught BS/JC, but for DK dps, is there a new 'best two'?
#1677SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3AmeroGER
Originally Posted by Paratrooper1508
With the upcoming nerf to JC, is there another profession that is theorycrafted to eclipse it? Since WOTLK I've always been taught BS/JC, but for DK dps, is there a new 'best two'?
JC still provides 3 27-Strength gems. Thats 33 more strength than 3 16-Strength gems could provide. BS only provides 32 now and in the future. Therefor no change in hierarchy.
#1678SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Paratrooper1508
Originally Posted by AmeroGER
JC still provides 3 27-Strength gems. Thats 33 more strength than 3 16-Strength gems could provide. BS only provides 32 now and in the future. Therefor no change in hierarchy.
Right but I'm talking about the fact that this is scheduled to be released at the same time as epic gems, which I understand to be on par or just shy of Dragons Eyes. In light of that shrunken stat gap (as opposed to the current somewhat large stat difference between 16 and 27), will JC's value in a purely theorycraft way be diminished? And if so, what will be its successor?

There is a rumor that JC epic trinkets will come out too, but until we see actual stats hard to say if the trinkets will beat the current BiS. From what I remember in BC JC trinkets weren't terrible but nothing to get worked up over, since an end-game raider would have far better than even the epic ones.

#1682SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3gia
I'm fairly new to blood specs (and death knights in general) so this may be just a learn to play issue, but I was wondering how should I deal with situations when my rotation gets interrupted at BBDDDD because I have to run out or a boss phase changes etc. When I resume fighting I have to reapply diseases and both my unholy runes get used up by PS/IT and I'm left with BBDDUU and my FU pairs get completely messed up. What's the best sequence to get my rotation back on track? I've been doing PS IT and then DS to make sure the pairs stay synced (because if I do HS x4 I end up with 2 unholy runes and no frost runes to use DS). I was wondering if there was a better way.
#1683SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Originally Posted by gia
I'm fairly new to blood specs (and death knights in general) so this may be just a learn to play issue, but I was wondering how should I deal with situations when my rotation gets interrupted at BBDDDD because I have to run out or a boss phase changes etc. When I resume fighting I have to reapply diseases and both my unholy runes get used up by PS/IT and I'm left with BBDDUU and my FU pairs get completely messed up. What's the best sequence to get my rotation back on track? I've been doing PS IT and then DS to make sure the pairs stay synced (because if I do HS x4 I end up with 2 unholy runes and no frost runes to use DS). I was wondering if there was a better way.
The way you do it should be the most efficient one. The only alternative would be to HSx2 before you reapply your diseases, but the lost damage multiplier from diseases is probably significantly larger than using a DD for Death Strike (technically you have a 50% chance to not lose any damage that way, since those two death runes will be death runes again in the next round instead of FU).

Would any of this damage cause Scent of Blood to kick in?
I only see Scent proc on direct damage (not AoE damage).

#1688SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Travex
Does an Unholy DK provide more raid utility than a Frost DK? Raid leader approached me about possibly switching to Unholy for its raid utility. This is more or less directly due to the recent loss of the other DK (he was Unholy, I am Frost). I know Frost has Improved Icy Talons. What does Unholy bring to the table? From what I understand Desecration is lol because movement + the lack of need to use PS (due to SS refreshing diseases). Ebon Plaguebringer is another talent that helps the raid but from what I understand it doesn't stack with a Warlock's Curse of Elements (we have a Warlock, can I assume she uses it or do I have to ask?). Are there other talents that help the raid which I am overlooking?
#1689SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3neanor
Well, having Ebon Plaguebringer means that your warlock no longer has to use Curse of Elements, which will be a dps boost to her. And Desecration is no longer lol because it also procs off Scourge Strike now, so even with movement, as long as you're scourge striking, you should benefit from the buff. I don't know whether an unholy DK provides more or less utility compared to frost. It's completely dependent on your raid make-up.
#1690SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Paratrooper1508
Originally Posted by Travex
Does an Unholy DK provide more raid utility than a Frost DK? Raid leader approached me about possibly switching to Unholy for its raid utility. This is more or less directly due to the recent loss of the other DK (he was Unholy, I am Frost). I know Frost has Improved Icy Talons. What does Unholy bring to the table? From what I understand Desecration is lol because movement + the lack of need to use PS (due to SS refreshing diseases). Ebon Plaguebringer is another talent that helps the raid but from what I understand it doesn't stack with a Warlock's Curse of Elements (we have a Warlock, can I assume she uses it or do I have to ask?). Are there other talents that help the raid which I am overlooking?
Read the Unholy thread. Ebon Plaguebringer is our way of spreading the coe/oomkin debuff over a large amount of targets, very quickly. if you have a very reliablye raiding oomkin then Unholy's value is somewhat diminished, but not on big add fights (Freya and Thorim come to mind). Remember that Icy talons is basically a Windfury totem away from being redundant. So just ask "are we usually short an oomkin or a shaman" and you'll have your answer. At this time we don't have any really unique buffs.

I'm fairly new to blood specs (and death knights in general) so this may be just a learn to play issue, but I was wondering how should I deal with situations when my rotation gets interrupted at BBDDDD because I have to run out or a boss phase changes etc. When I resume fighting I have to reapply diseases and both my unholy runes get used up by PS/IT and I'm left with BBDDUU and my FU pairs get completely messed up. I have noticed this at some points. if u are BBDDDD and apply dots and then cast a DS, one of the U runes will trade places with one of the new D runes that u have activated of the F runes. at least it does for me.

try that if u are BBDDDD go,
PS,IT,DS,HS,HS and see that u after cd's u get BBDFDU


now on to a question of my own

I have during the last week noticed something with my dancing runweapon.
it's uptime is not correct with the tooltip given.

DRW tooltip says a weapon that fights on it's own for 10sec plus 1 sec per 10 runic power.

10+6(if Rp is 100 cost for spell is 40 RP) = 16 sec + 5 second from the glyph =21 sec

that is close to the time of my buff atm. my buff when activating DRW starts at 20sec.

however

I have runic power mastery witch means 30 more runic power equaling to 3 more seconds

10sec (spell activation)+9sec (runic power 130 - 40 for spellcost) + 5 (glyph)
10+9+5=24

unless there is something I have missed me/we are getting robbed out of 4 seconds on our dancing rune weapon

is there something I have missed that makes the DRW to never be active for more then 20 sec?

#1695SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3gier

Which rune besides Scourge Strike and Ghoul is the most effective for max dmg with T7,5 and T8,5/Ulduar-Gear?
- Blood Strike (20% more damage with Blood Strike to snared targets)
- Unholy Blight (10 Sek more Unholy Blight, saves 1 GCD per Minute)
- Dark Death (15% more Deathcoil DMG)
- Death and Decay (20% more D&D-DMG)
#1696SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3crazy dodo
Originally Posted by gier
As a Unholy-DK, specced 5/5 Desecration (a snare effect):

Which rune besides Scourge Strike and Ghoul is the most effective for max dmg with T7,5 and T8,5/Ulduar-Gear?
- Blood Strike (20% more damage with Blood Strike to snared targets)
- Unholy Blight (10 Sek more Unholy Blight, saves 1 GCD per Minute)
- Dark Death (15% more Deathcoil DMG)
- Death and Decay (20% more D&D-DMG)
my choice is Dark Death hands down
reasons being, BS is not utilized enough do deserve a buff, you dont really need more GCDs in Unholy as you're already idling in 1 or 2 per rotation anyway so UB is out of the way as well. Death and Decay.. well unless you think AOE is more important that single target dps, it has no part in your rotation and 20% more damage just means more threat so definitely a no.

#1699SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Bosch
Assuming cookie cutter 51 blood spec, will I ever need to use Blood Tap? I don't quite understand what it does
#1700SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Esfernum
You hit Blood Strike once, Bloodrune on CD. Then you Blood tap, which make this blood rune to reset to Death rune and switch the other blood rune to death rune as well. It will leave you with 2 death rune ready to use.
#1701SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3AmeroGER
Originally Posted by Esfernum
You hit Blood Strike once, Bloodrune on CD. Then you Blood tap, which make this blood rune to reset to Death rune and switch the other blood rune to death rune as well. It will leave you with 2 death rune ready to use.
However if you do that to cast a SS, one of the two Blood Runes will refresh as a Death Rune because of BT. You can't cast another SS from 1 BR, 1 DR, so you'll be stuck on casting two BS's. But by the time those two refresh again BT will have elapsed and the DR from before will go back to being a BR, leaving you with 1 DR, 1 BR again. The only ways out of this are to either accept casting 2 BS's for 2 rotations or to wait before casting the first set of BS's or to cancel BT manually.
#1702SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3crazy dodo
i should probably know this ...
Spellpower is calculated based on AP not Strenght correct?
what's the SP gain for 1 AP (before any talent bonuses are applied)?
#1703SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by crazy dodo
i should probably know this ...
Spellpower is calculated based on AP not Strenght correct?
what's the SP gain for 1 AP (before any talent bonuses are applied)?
Spellpower is not calculated from anything, all DK abilities use Attack Power to determine their final damage value. Various coefficients for different abilities can be found in the Theorycrafting Think Tank.
#1704SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Growler
Picture a non ideal 25 man makeup with only 1 DK (DPS most of the instance 10 & 25 Uld), no shammies, majority of the time no feral and very meele heavy (wars & pallies mainly). What spec would benefit the raid more?

We went from 4 DK, 2 unholy, 1 blood, 1 frost, now to just myslef being frost, no longer are all the bases covered.

#1706SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
I believe they fixed all the issues with RP/Rage/Energy reductions last night with server restarts (I'm not sure if this happened with EU servers).

Originally Posted by Growler
Picture a non ideal 25 man makeup with only 1 DK (DPS most of the instance 10 & 25 Uld), no shammies, majority of the time no feral and very meele heavy (wars & pallies mainly). What spec would benefit the raid more?

We went from 4 DK, 2 unholy, 1 blood, 1 frost, now to just myslef being frost, no longer are all the bases covered.
If you have noone covering the +13% magic damage debuff, go Unholy.
If you have no hunter proving +10% AP, go Blood.
If both of those are covered, go Frost.

#1708SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Esfernum
Originally Posted by AmeroGER
However if you do that to cast a SS, one of the two Blood Runes will refresh as a Death Rune because of BT. You can't cast another SS from 1 BR, 1 DR, so you'll be stuck on casting two BS's. But by the time those two refresh again BT will have elapsed and the DR from before will go back to being a BR, leaving you with 1 DR, 1 BR again. The only ways out of this are to either accept casting 2 BS's for 2 rotations or to wait before casting the first set of BS's or to cancel BT manually.
No, you usually use this trick after that the frost and unholy runes are on cooldown, after double SS or DS or OB. Both of your Blood runes will be reset to Death runes ready to use. It is then time to use your RP dump and your next couple of runes are ready to use (should be bbFFUU). Try it and love it.
Just to be noticed, you can use it as well with an Unholy rune for the Ghoul Frenzy.
#1709SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3AmeroGER
Originally Posted by Esfernum
No, you usually use this trick after that the frost and unholy runes are on cooldown, after double SS or DS or OB. Both of your Blood runes will be reset to Death runes ready to use. It is then time to use your RP dump and your next couple of runes are ready to use (should be bbFFUU). Try it and love it.
Just to be noticed, you can use it as well with an Unholy rune for the Ghoul Frenzy.
I did try it and the next upcoming runes weren't BBFFUU but rather BDFFUU. Fieh in the Unholy Thread however posted a simple solution to this. Create the macro

#showtooltip
/cast Blood Tap
/cancelaura Blood Tap
replace Blood Tap in your bar with this macro and then you can simply repress Blood Tap to cancel the effect. (Although it looks that way BT won't be cast and cancelled if you only press the macro once.)

#1712SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3coca

For one thing you don't have wandering plague. Look up the appropriate spec on the Unholy tree. Although that shouldn't account for that much dps difference. I'm assuming they're only getting 6k ish on bosses correct? If you're account for overall and you're doing naxx just drop DnD and just aoe like crazy. Also I myself found that the other spec was better when you're not in ulduar gear yet and and the 10/61 spec is only good or gets to be better when you get ulduar gear. Try out the blood/unholy spec and see how it goes. If you're doing raids make sure you're flasked and food buffed with the appropriate buffs (i.e might, kings, motw, windfury, warrior crit, etc) to maximize ur dps. Also make use of those speed pots before you throw out that gargoyle. Keep track of your diseases to keep them up at all times (frost fever, plague strike one, unholy blight). Best of luck to you!

#1722SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3murdin123
I'm having problems with gemming. I'm using info from BiS list, using stat weight, and gemming advice. But ask myself why isn't a [Enchanted Tear] used instead of [Sovereign Twilight Opal] ?

[Enchanted Tear]: (6*2.89) + (6*1.37) = 25.56
[Sovereign Twilight Opal]: 8*2.89 = 23.13

Also isn't [Relentless Earthsiege Diamond] better than [Chaotic Skyflare Diamond]? (Keeping the socket requirements in mind) So as we will already have a red gem the comparison is 2 blue gems vs 1 blue and 1 yellow.

[Inscribed Monarch Topaz] + [Enchanted Tear]
35.6 + 25.56 = 61.6

[Enchanted Tear] + [Sovereign Twilight Opal]
25.56 + 23.13 = 48.69


Plus on the amount of each Meta [Relentless Earthsiege Diamond] = 28.77 and [Chaotic Skyflare Diamond] = 32.76

Ending in : [Relentless Earthsiege Diamond] = 90.37 and [Chaotic Skyflare Diamond] = 81.45

Sorry if i explained myself badly, never have been good at doing so. But my question is, Is this true? or doesn't Chaotic Skyflare win over Relentless?
#1723SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Originally Posted by murdin123
Gems
This is something that has come up when the jewelcrafting changes wer announced (since most BiS lists generally assume Jewelcrafting prismatic gems). For Blood and perhaps Frost at least a Relentless/Tear combination might pull ahead, due to how much is damge is affected by phsyical crit and how beneficial crit is. For Unholy it depends largely on the potential socket bonus you would get from socketing the second Sovereign Twilight Opal, since for that spec 2 strength is superior to 6 agility. But even for Frost and Blood socket bonuses must be taken into account to get a conclusive decision.

#1727SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Killashandra
So - I borrowed the following macro from Erekose (posted in the frost dps thread of all places) for macroing rune strike into my attacks when tanking.
#showtooltip Obliterate
/script UIErrorsFrame:UnregisterEvent("UI_ERROR_MESSAGE")
/cast Rune Strike
/script UIErrorsFrame:RegisterEvent("UI_ERROR_MESSAGE")
/cast Obliterate
/startattack

I also read somewhere in these forums that it's possible to toggle rune strike off if you hit the macro again before it casts. Does anyone know if that's true? Is there a way around that? (Something about adding ! to your macro statement...) The comments i read were up in the air on that one.

Thanks for any help!
#1728SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3AmeroGER
Originally Posted by Killashandra
So - I borrowed the following macro from Erekose (posted in the frost dps thread of all places) for macroing rune strike into my attacks when tanking.
#showtooltip Obliterate
/script UIErrorsFrame:UnregisterEvent("UI_ERROR_MESSAGE")
/cast Rune Strike
/script UIErrorsFrame:RegisterEvent("UI_ERROR_MESSAGE")
/cast Obliterate
/startattack

I also read somewhere in these forums that it's possible to toggle rune strike off if you hit the macro again before it casts. Does anyone know if that's true? Is there a way around that? (Something about adding ! to your macro statement...) The comments i read were up in the air on that one.

Thanks for any help!
You almost had it. Just put a "!" before Rune strike like "/cast !Rune Strike".

#1735SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3coca
Does anyone know if HoW reset the swing timer? Is it a dps boost to use it whenever it is up?
#1736SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3♦ Darkside
I do not think that it resets the swing timer. Furthermore, you should only be using it if all your runes are on cooldown and if you have no RP available for any other abilities or if the buff is about fall off.
#1737SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3coca
With the craptastic RP gain from our T8 I find that the HoW 10 RP is what is needed to just squeeze in 1 more DC. Not sure if it is a DPS increase or not though =/ The reason why I say it might not be is because it does cause a GCD which realistically slows down a fresh new UF rune that you can SS. Might slow down by about .5 GCD cause the rune isn't up when you use HoW but it would be up after about half your GCD is done. I don't know maybe I'm overthinking it but I'd rather like to see if it is a definitive DPS increase or should I just keep pressing SS as much as possible instead and only use it whenever my shamans are too lazy to redrop their freaking totems!
#1738SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Miracleknight
When you have a spare GCD there is no reason not to use HoW. And if one of your runes is cooling down or has cooled down and another is about to use it, remember that using a GCD when a rune coolsdown already counts towards the 10 seconds, making the rune only take 8.5 seconds to be restored.

This drops me to about 68 hit rating which is abysmal. If I swap [Helm of the Faceless] our for my T8 helm I gain some hit back, but still not enough to make up the difference.

The more upgrades I get from 25-man Ulduar the more hit I keep losing.
#1740SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3kniteblade
IBF glyph
I read in Suno's tanking thread that IBF glyph is ot listed, but "Feel free to substitute it in as you see fit."
As you know, the glyph provides at least 30% damage reduction regardless of you defense rating. I could not find the numbers I'm looking for in the thread, and I'm not good with theorycrafting math. My question is, how much defense rating do you need in order for IBF to reduce 30% of your damage if you do not have the glyph?
#1741SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Originally Posted by Szarach
Picked up [Aesir's Edge] tonight off XT-hard mode. I'm curious if the extra weapon dps is enough to make up for the almost 100 hit rating I had on [Stormedge]. This drops me to about 68 hit rating which is abysmal. If I swap [Helm of the Faceless] our for my T8 helm I gain some hit back, but still not enough to make up the difference.

The more upgrades I get from 25-man Ulduar the more hit I keep losing.
Aesir's Edge is a significant TPS boost through weapon dps alone, as well as the additional expertise from the human racial (depending on how much you already have you can only use the -parry, but still). It has more base stamina and two sockets and decreases probabilty of parry haste, so it's a no-brainer when it comes to survivabilty. Overall it's clearly an upgrade despite the hit-loss, but sooner or later you should probably look into that, although it's not necessarily a top-priority.

Originally Posted by kniteblade
My question is, how much defense rating do you need in order for IBF to reduce 30% of your damage if you do not have the glyph?
Less than the rating you need to become crit-immune (what you should be anyway). The last numbers I've read were 0.15% reduction per each defense skill above 400. When the changes were announce GC posted something on the lines of 35% at 540 defense (soft cap).
#1742SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3richard
Originally Posted by kniteblade
I read in Suno's tanking thread that IBF glyph is ot listed, but "Feel free to substitute it in as you see fit."
As you know, the glyph provides at least 30% damage reduction regardless of you defense rating. I could not find the numbers I'm looking for in the thread, and I'm not good with theorycrafting math. My question is, how much defense rating do you need in order for IBF to reduce 30% of your damage if you do not have the glyph?
You get 0.15% damage reduction from 1 defense skill, up to 600 defense.

#1744SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3♦ Darkside

#1745SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3crazy dodo
While on the topic of macros, I'm curious if anyone's tried using the following macro when tanking

/use Sigil of Unfaltering Knight
/cast Icy Touch
/use Sigil of Awareness (or Vengeful Heart if available)

I've noticed that swapping Sigils does not trigger a GCD, but seems to have a very short internal cooldown before allowing you to swap sigils again thus making it necessary to double tap the macro hotkey.
Also if i recall correctly (I dont have access to WoW atm) when I added "#showtooltip" to the macro it treated the hotkey as if it's the trinket not Icy Touch (creates a glow around the button, does not display IT's cooldown, etc.)
I also tried adding Rune Strike to the equation and it just got a little crazy so i ended up abandoning the whole macro but I'm wondering if anyone would know a way to get it to work properly

Another option would be to macro the UK sigil to IT and Awareness to Obliterate

Any suggestions?
#1746SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Myrx
Originally Posted by crazy dodo
While on the topic of macros, I'm curious if anyone's tried using the following macro when tanking

/use Sigil of Unfaltering Knight
/cast Icy Touch
/use Sigil of Awareness (or Vengeful Heart if available)

I've noticed that swapping Sigils does not trigger a GCD, but seems to have a very short internal cooldown before allowing you to swap sigils again thus making it necessary to double tap the macro hotkey.
Also if i recall correctly (I dont have access to WoW atm) when I added "#showtooltip" to the macro it treated the hotkey as if it's the trinket not Icy Touch (creates a glow around the button, does not display IT's cooldown, etc.)
I also tried adding Rune Strike to the equation and it just got a little crazy so i ended up abandoning the whole macro but I'm wondering if anyone would know a way to get it to work properly

Another option would be to macro the UK sigil to IT and Awareness to Obliterate

Any suggestions?
I would suggest straying away from using a sigil swap while tanking especially if you are relying on the defense from Sigil of the Unfaltering Knight to stay capped. It's clunky, and will probably cause you more problems than it's worth. Swapping in Sigil of Awareness for tanking would be to generate more threat so I'd urge you to pursue other avenues to increase your threat first.

It looks like you could gain threat by swapping your Frost tanking glyphs. Glyph of Obliterate and Glyph of Frost strike would both be net TPS gains over Glyph of Unbreakable Armor and Glyph of Howling Blast. There's a bunch of ways you can increase your threat output without resorting to a Sigil swapping macro. Swapping will only cause you headaches.

It's clunky, and will probably cause you more problems than it's worth. Glyph of Obliterate and Glyph of Frost strike would both be net TPS gains over Glyph of Unbreakable Armor and Glyph of Howling Blast. There's a bunch of ways you can increase your threat output without resorting to a Sigil swapping macro. Swapping will only cause you headaches.

It's rather about taking advantage of the little extra avoidance you can get out of UK (it's there, why not use it) if it can be done without sacrificing anything else, like rotation. But you're absolutely right, as it is right now the macro is way too messy.

Awareness for Scourge Strikes, Vengeful Heart for Death Coils. (or any primary/runedump ability depending on spec)
#1748SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Myrx
Originally Posted by crazy dodo

But you're absolutely right, as it is right now the macro is way too messy.

However I'm curious about your comment on the Sigils. Sounds like you disprove of both choices. What would you recommend as a pre-ulduar25 BiS for tanking Sigil?

Also it just occured to me this macro (if made to work properly) could be useful for DPS as well
Awareness for Scourge Strikes, Vengeful Heart for Death Coils. (or any primary/runedump ability depending on spec)
I assumed the opposite: that you used the defense sigil normally. For pre-ulduar25 I'd still go with Awareness. I use Deflection myself now. As for your DPS comments I think that a sigil swap macro would slow your rotations down so that anything you might have gained would be lost by the slower rotations. You also open yourself up to mistakes like Death Coiling with Awareness on, and Scourge Striking with Vengeful Heart on. All of the high TPS and DPS parses I've seen were from people that don't use such macros.

#1753SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Bosch
Noob question here.

When comparing item qualities for prioritization of DPS, the blood post has the following table:

Stat APE
Attack Power 1
Weapon DPS 9.89
Strength 2.89
Armor Penetration 2.75
Hit Rating (to cap) 2.51
Expertise Rating 2.47
Crit Rating 1.56
Haste Rating 1.5
Agility 1.37
Hit Rating (to spell hit cap) .52
Armor .03

So does that mean I use the above multiplier on the stats?

For instance, if I'm wearing an item that is 50 Attack power and I have the chance to upgrade that slot to an item with 10 AP and 30 armor pen, the math is as follows:

Item 1
AP = 1 * 50 = rating 50

Item 2
Armor Pen = 2.75 * 30 = 82.5

Ya?
#1754SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Yup, that's the gist of it. You can also plug the weighting directly into wowhead and it will spit out a giant list of gear in order of most valuable to least.
#1755SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3AmeroGER
Originally Posted by Darkside
I do not think that it resets the swing timer. Furthermore, you should only be using it if all your runes are on cooldown and if you have no RP available for any other abilities or if the buff is about fall off.
Taking a step back here. While in general this is solid advice there are some situations where I'd prioritize HoW over other abilities. For example if you have 50 RP and you know you have 4 sec before the next runes come up, you can easily go HoW->DC. No difference in Dps yet but you will have HoW on CD earlier and thereby be able to cast more HoW's. Same can be done with the rune cushioning. If runes and HoW come off CD simultaneously you can prioritize HoW without wasting Dps.
However you need to be certain, that you won't be delaying the rotation itself.
#1756SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3shopshopshop
Originally Posted by AmeroGER
Taking a step back here. While in general this is solid advice there are some situations where I'd prioritize HoW over other abilities. For example if you have 50 RP and you know you have 4 sec before the next runes come up, you can easily go HoW->DC. No difference in Dps yet but you will have HoW on CD earlier and thereby be able to cast more HoW's. Same can be done with the rune cushioning. If runes and HoW come off CD simultaneously you can prioritize HoW without wasting Dps.
However you need to be certain, that you won't be delaying the rotation itself.
Similarly I think it's sometimes worth delaying an Icy Touch for Frost DPS specs to cast HoW if you have a KM proc up if you can't cast Obliterate/Blood Strike to get RP.

#1758SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Arcdragon
Dark Command glyph question
Is Dark Command classed as a spell? If not and I am melee hit capped using a two handed weapon, am I essentially hit capped for Dark Command as well?

I ask this as I have seen what happens with other tanks who claim to be hit capped and even gem for hit, but have still had the odd dark command miss.
#1759SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Originally Posted by Arcdragon
Is Dark Command classed as a spell? If not and I am melee hit capped using a two handed weapon, am I essentially hit capped for Dark Command as well?

I ask this as I have seen what happens with other tanks who claim to be hit capped and even gem for hit, but have still had the odd dark command miss.
Dark Command (and Death Grip, as well as all taunts except for the paladins') is considered a physical ability and requires 8% melee hit to be capped.
#1760SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Foundry
Dark Command can be resisted, it's on the spell hit table. Being only melee hit capped is not enough if you want to eliminate a potential resist.

A "spell" attack in Blizzard parlance is something that either hits or misses (resist). A "melee" attack can hit, miss, dodge, parry or block.

Death Grip is the ideal if you want to eliminate a failed taunt, it cannot miss and so does not fail as a taunt. The move part can fail if the mob is immobilised but the taunt effect will always land.
#1761SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Nobb
I have an opinion question for experienced DKs.

I played mut rogue for some time and I found that, stat weights be damned, I love expertise. The difference between gemming optimally (AP/agi) and gemming for expertise was worth little dps loss in theory. I found that expertise was undervalued though, at least for me, because nothing hurt my cycle more than two consecutive dodges on an envenom, as it would completely destroy my cycle and I would basically have to restart everything from scratch.

I am leveling a DK now and I was wondering, is there some similar effect for DKs? Having a disease applications like PS dodged seems less drastic, but is it still largely detrimental to both tanking and DPS cycles in a raid setting? Aside from lost damage (and threat for tanks), is there any other effects that you have found dodges to have on your cycle?

Thanks in advance.
#1762SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Bsiddiq
The value of expertise varies for each spec, but in general, it is the most important for blood. The main reason being that it's a GCD heavy rotation, so consecutive dodges can really push your rotation back. It's not as important for frost because your #1 source of damage is frost strike which doesn't gain benefit from expertise. Also, howling blast/icy touch do not gain benefit from expertise. Unholy usually has spare GCDs and so it's not as big of a deal for unholy either.
#1763SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Sylari
Seeing a couple odd things in raids, figured I'd ask a few questions about here..

1) Just picked up a [Relentless Edge], while currently using [Death's Bite]. RAWR shows it as a slight downgrade for 51/0/20 , but actual tests in raids and with dummies show a fairly significant ( 300-400 ) dps increase with the polearm, any reason I might be seeing this?

2) I don't have Vengeful Heart yet (our last one was given to an unholy dk=/), and given the numbers here, that means frost should be lagging behind.. but I've been unable to deal nearly as much damage as unholy in any situation as I can with blood or frost, with the exception of unholy being better for me on razorscale. Again, is there any reason in my gear why I might be seeing this?
#1764SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Miagorme
Switched from Paladin MT to Death Knight MT for Ulduar and am gearing my DK up now. Some quick questions which I haven't found the answers to via searching:

In which fights will Blood Tank be superior to Frost Tank? (assuming same skill/gear levels)
Do Blood Tanks use the same gear-build as Frost Tanks?
Why is Frost so much more popular?
Would DW Blood with Grim Toll be a decent idea for insane threat fights?
Would Spell Deflection work on Frozen Blows?

Thanks.
#1765SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tima
Blood speced tanks are not superior or inferior in any fights, although the self-healing is useful on hard-mode Vezax (so I hear - we haven't gotten to that point yet). Blood tanks use the same gear, more or less, although since most of the damage you do is physical, you'll arguably get more benefit from expertise than other (frost/unholy) tanks, and your threat will benefit from a sunder effect (from your pocket warrior, of course). I've tanked Ulduar content in all three trees, and found benefits and deficiencies in all of them.

Frost is probably popular because it has both good single-target and multi-target threat capability, and reasonably good cooldowns - although who really knows.

DW tanking is generally a bad idea right now. You can get enough threat from any standard tanking build in any tree without having to resort to silly tactics.

I also did a quick search on Frozen Blows - pg. 116 of Suno's Fireside Chat has your answer.
#1766SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Miagorme
Thank you! I added the last question as I added the second to last one; should have searched for that before bothering, though.

#1768SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Myrx
Originally Posted by Thrones
Hello, I've been playing my DK quite frequently and am currently gearing up through heroics and 10 man naxx as dps.

I've been interested in Tanking and have duel spec for it as well, but I'm having issues finding a solid spec on here thats not directly related to ulduar and that level of gear.

For tanking heroics and 10mans, I presume at the low level of gear I will have/attain, that I should take a frost spec. I've read the unholy requires more avoidance to make Bone Shield last longer, and that without the correct gear I may have threat issues, so I would appreciate it if someone could help me out with a build for starting out tanking at 80.

Thank you
Honestly for heroics and ten man Naxx it really doesn't matter what tanking spec you use. This works out in your favor as you can try all three and you basically get to pick the play style that you prefer. Unholy has the best AOE so you may find that for heroics you prefer it. Frost has good AOE and good single target. You might find it to be a nice mix. Blood is extremely good single target, and weak AOE, but certainly fun to play.

All specs have their ups and downs, and at that level of content you should choose the one that's the most fun to play. As for talent builds there are other threads with that info.
#1769SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Yubble
Originally Posted by Sylari
Seeing a couple odd things in raids, figured I'd ask a few questions about here..

1) Just picked up a [Relentless Edge], while currently using [Death's Bite]. RAWR shows it as a slight downgrade for 51/0/20 , but actual tests in raids and with dummies show a fairly significant ( 300-400 ) dps increase with the polearm, any reason I might be seeing this?

2) I don't have Vengeful Heart yet (our last one was given to an unholy dk=/), and given the numbers here, that means frost should be lagging behind.. but I've been unable to deal nearly as much damage as unholy in any situation as I can with blood or frost, with the exception of unholy being better for me on razorscale. Again, is there any reason in my gear why I might be seeing this?
1) Reason you're seeing this: You're hitting for NEARLY the same damage, and faster, because the polearm is faster and has more unbuffed AP, haste, and crit. If you had a slower wpn, such as Ironfoe or Cryptfiend's Bite, you'd probably be seeing more damage because they have higher top end dmg than Relentless Edge.

2) Your unholy dk probably doesn't play as well as he should (rotations, spec, gear, etc). Player performance is the biggest factor in dps. You may just be better than him.

#1772SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Frijid
Quick question, although I feel dumb for asking but I can't figure it out.

In the talent trees, for improved _______ presence. What does it mean when they say "you retain 2%" from whatever presence?

I did a search for "you retain"; 0 results.
#1773SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Myrx
Originally Posted by Frijid
Quick question, although I feel dumb for asking but I can't figure it out.

In the talent trees, for improved _______ presence. What does it mean when they say "you retain 2%" from whatever presence?

I did a search for "you retain"; 0 results.
It does exactly what it says:

Improved Frost Presence Rank 2
While in Blood Presence or Unholy Presence, you retain 10% health from Frost Presence, and damage done to you is decreased by an additional 2% in Frost Presence.

Frost Presence
1 Frost
Instant 1 sec cooldown
The death knight takes on the presence of frost, increasing total health by 10%, armor contribution from cloth, leather, mail and plate items by 60%, and reducing damage taken by 5%. Increases threat generated. Only one Presence may be active at a time.

Frost presence increases your health by 10%, and Improved Frost Presence lets you keep that 10% in any presence. The other talents for Blood and Unholy presence work similarly by letting you keep one aspect of the presence even when you aren't in it.
#1774SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by Frijid
Quick question, although I feel dumb for asking but I can't figure it out.

In the talent trees, for improved _______ presence. What does it mean when they say "you retain 2%" from whatever presence?

I did a search for "you retain"; 0 results.
For example imp Blood presence keeps the 2/4% healing from damage dealt when in Unholy or Frost.

Imp Frost Presence retains the 10% health buff in Unholy/Blood Presence.

Imp Unholy Presence retains the 15% run speed in Blood/Frost Presence.
#1775SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Frijid
Originally Posted by Myrx
Frost presence increases your health by 10%, and Improved Frost Presence lets you keep that 10% in any presence. The other talents for Blood and Unholy presence work similarly by letting you keep one aspect of the presence even when you aren't in it.
Ah, ok.

Thanks, guys.

#1787SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Georgie2x4
Question: With the upcoming changes to Frost Presence, "10% bonus health reduced to 6% bonus stamina", will there ever be a point where the 6% Stamina becomes on par or better than a 10% health bonus?

I'm not very good at number crunching to figure it out.
#1788SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Consider
10% health is always, always, always going to be better than 6% stam.

Anything and everything that is affected by a stamina modifier is also affected by a health modifier. The thing is, a health modifier also modifies such things as base health, health from the chest enchant, and health from buffs such as Commanding Shout/Flask/Etc.

As such, going from 10% health to 10% stamina would be a nerf in and of itself. Then add in the lower percent modifier, and yeah. Never will a stamina modifier outscale an equivalent health modifier, and if the first is lower to begin with, the gap just widens.
#1789SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3jukeboxhero37
Originally Posted by the_haunted
Lucky Drops, got the t8,5 legs yesterday. Str is 10 more (with sockets) than clockwork legs. Still have to choose clockworks over them?
Long time reader first time poster, but I think I can help.

Based on the APE Chart taken from the Blood Simple thread the tier 8.5 legs come to 821 APE vs Clockwork's 871.02. (Including gems for socket bonuses, excluding leg armors)

However, if you're hit capped without Clockwork Leggings (which according to your Armory you are) then they're only worth 715.40 APE. Making the tier 8.5 legs the better choice.

Hope that helps.

Edit: Apparently he got himself banned. I guess it doesn't help.

#1800SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by bals
I notice occasional misses when using Mind Freeze on bosses while having more than 263 hit rating. Is this due to it getting resisted or does it use the spell hit cap?
Mind freeze uses the spell hit cap, that is correct. Thus, you will need a total of 17% spell hit in order to prevent missed interrupts. You can get 3% from Virulence and 3% from raid debuffs, meaning you will only require 11% total spell hit, or somewhere in the range of 300 hit rating (check your paperdoll for exact numbers).
#1801SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3shopshopshop
Originally Posted by ferbragga
I cant understand how 6xIT works! And Why use it! And why i didn't use PS!

I need a 6xIT for dummies! someone can help me?

Thankyou

Kings is already taken into account for those stat weights.

#1814SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3♦ Darkside
Originally Posted by debeucci

Is there a good reason?

#1817SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Griefknight
Originally Posted by Morfina
In short: Should I stay away from trying to tank as Blood with ~171 hit and 12 expertise?
I tank as Blood with somewhere around 50 hit and 20 expertise in my stam set. I think the issue is your weapon, because almost all of Bloods damage is physical you want a weapon that does more damage. I had terrible Blood threat with 8% hit and 26 expertise back in Naxxramas until I upgraded to a 203 DPS weapon.
#1818SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Orcbert
Are there any standard builds for death knights, specifically leveling builds?
#1819SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by Orcbert
Are there any standard builds for death knights, specifically leveling builds?
I feel Unholy is best, due to 20% mount speed and 15% run speed (in Blood Aura), also the perma-pet is nice dps once you get the glyph, in addition the AoE is top-notch (at least pre-3.2).

Blood is also a solid leveling spec, if you like self-healing abilities.

Originally Posted by Arekuzandaa
Probably a silly question, but i am wondering.

I am still not hit capped (7,87%) But i read on this forum that even if i'm not hit capped, i should still gem my gear with STR or APR. If i do that, i will end up at 6.50%ish hit, is it worth it? (I'm already Expertise capped)
Try Rawr or a simulation for best. I prefer to get as close to hit/expertise, so that it doesn't mess up with rotations, really the difference isn't huge. Note you likely shouldn't gem with Armor Penetration until you have a high level of gear.

#1821SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3concept84
Originally Posted by debeucci
I have a question regarding arp. Everywhere I read, everyoen says after 6200ap raid buffed, it's better to stack arp gems over strength.

However, I'm looking at EVERY end game raider and no one is doing it...including the guys i commonly read on this forum...kroot, orcchaoss....etc....

They all say it's better to stack arp gems after that 6200 but they don't seem to be doing it themselves. I'm just curious why.

Currently, i'm 4600ap unbuffed, and nearing 7500-8k ap buffed with about 360 arp. I have more than enough room to start cutting some arp gems over strength, but i'm hesitant because all the end game guilds from Ensidia on down don't seem to do it.

Is there a good reason?

Thanks!
I was one of the many who concluded that gemming ArP over Str after raid buffed 6200 is in fact a DPS increase for Blood, however in a real raid situation it showed that the difference was too small to confirm beyond a shadow of a doubt. I believe the Docs sim also shows ArP to overcome Str before 420 ArP + Trinket Proc (Grim Toll or Runestone).

Str also affects all damage, so in AOE situations where you might be using more spells than physical damage the additional ArP won't help.

Due to the amount of spec switching I do currently for hard modes I'm gemmed completely for Str, however I'm sitting at 500+ ArP from gear alone and over 7000 AP raid buffed as it is.
#1822SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Taidaisher
I know the hit cap is %8. And though I have been searching for the information, I can't find the caps for crit, exp, haste, etc. Can someone point me to that information please?
#1823SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Originally Posted by Taidaisher
I know the hit cap is %8. And though I have been searching for the information, I can't find the caps for crit, exp, haste, etc. Can someone point me to that information please?
Melee hit cap is 8% (7% for Draeni), spell hit cap is 17% (14% with Moonkin/spriest, this is important for Death Coil and Howling Blast to hit).

Crit and Haste have a cap, but no competent dps will reach it anytime soon. Exp cap is 26 (6.5% dodge removed) for dps, much higher (more than double) for a tank.
#1824SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Xequecal
Can the blood-caked blade talent proc off of rune strike? I know Necrosis does but I'm not sure about this one.
#1825SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Consider
Yes, BCB can proc off rune strike, much as any 'auto attack' reliant talent (necrosis, killing machine, etcetera) can. BCB can be parried, however, and as such most tanks do not take it.
#1826SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Raatar
Help with hit rating and staying capped
First off, does anyone know what percent 39 hit rating is equal to?
Second; I'm planning on getting Might of the Leviathan as a new neck piece soon, and that's +34hit over my current neck. I'd like to know how much 34 hit rating is as a percent of Hit Chance. And since I'm already capped with my heroic Presence getting me to 8.20% (7.20% on character page) I'm over cap and I have room to switch out some hit rating gear when I get the opportunity.
#1827SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Consider
32.79 hit rating reduces your change to hit by 1%, soooo:

39 hit rating is approximately 1.19% hit.
34 hit rating is approximately 1.04% hit.
#1828SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3StickManPD
Originally Posted by shopshopshop
Watch this video: Arioch ITx6 Machine Gun Rotation By Erekose - World of Warcraft Movies
That video link is no longer valid, does anyone have another, or a forum link which explains this?
#1829SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		shopshopshop
Originally Posted by StickManPD
That video link is no longer valid, does anyone have another, or a forum link which explains this?
If you scroll down on that page, near the bottom there's a section called "Other Mirrors" and a Filefront link. That download appears to still work.

edit: In case the Filefront link breaks or something, the starter rotation goes like this:

IT – BS – OB – FS – BT – IT – FS – OB – FS

And follow a priority system like this: (for single target damage)

1) FF
2) FS (KM up)(or to avoid capping RP)
3) Howling Blast (rime proc, use before casting Obliterate to avoid overwriting proc)
4) Obliterate (U/F runes up)
5) IT (Death Runes up)
6) FS (no runes up)

As best you can, try to keep your U/F runes refreshing in pairs, which means attempting to never have 4 death runes up at once or IT will use up two unholy runes first and mess with your rotation. Use all death runes for IT to generate RP and try not to waste KM on IT procs, though it will happen every now and then.
Last edited by shopshopshop : 07/07/09 at 1:29 PM.
#1830SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		coldbear
Wondering whether or not to pick an argument with a Blood DK in our raids about who should or should not get Hysteria on progression fights - and not entirely sure I trust the folks over on the druid forums to give totally unbiased opinions (nor here, I suppose). Tried searching this forum but didn't find too much. On second thought I'll keep searching each thread.

Wow Web Stats Wow Web Stats (best I could find, been weird raiding around 4th of July holidays
http://www.quickarmory.com/?n=cambrio&r=Ravenholdt (might well be in pvp gear)

FYI our guild is still working on getting our 2nd Yogg kill.

Source of my confusion:

http://elitistjerks.com/f73/t63774-c...guide_dummies/

Topic: Hysteria

Cats are the best target for Hysteria:

Arms Warrior - Does not stack with Wrecking Crew. Besides, they don't have strong Cooldowns to blow while Hysteria is up.
Death Knights - A significant portion of their damage is elemental and not physical. Dancing Rune Weapon scales only half with Hysteria, summon Gargoyle doesn't at all
Enhancer Shamans - A good portion of their damage is elemental. Feral spirit, their Cooldown, is not affected by Hysteria
Fury Warrior - Although all of their damage is physical, they cannot blow their big Cooldown Death Wish with Hysteria, because it doesn't stack.
Hunter - A good portion of their damage is elemental and their pet wouldn't benefit from Hysteria.
Retribution Paladins - A very big portion of their damage is elemental.
Rogues - A good portion of their damage is elemental.

Cats benefit by far the most from Hysteria. As long as you are quite close to the top DPS in your raid, try to convince your Blood-DK or your raidleader, that you should get Hysteria!
Last edited by coldbear : 07/07/09 at 10:58 PM.
#1831SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
Regarding your linked Blood DK comment, I looked up a log a full Ulduar geared Blood on GV Hard (a fight you mostly just hit in one spot). I agree that Cats are the best target, but Blood DKs are pretty good targets as well (unholy and frost dks are poor targets).
#1832SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Durendale
I'm still in the process of trying to maximize the dps on my alt death knight, using the unholy dps discussion thread. One thing that confuses me is that the unholy rotation requires a scourge strike glyph, which means you will not cast an awful lot of icy touch and plague strike. The 0/10/61 spec has its first frost points in improved icy touch, a spell not really overly used. Is this spec really competitive compared to the 12/0/59 spec? (bearing in mind that my DK is not that geared yet)
#1833SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Asphyxialol
Originally Posted by Durendale
I'm still in the process of trying to maximize the dps on my alt death knight, using the unholy dps discussion thread. One thing that confuses me is that the unholy rotation requires a scourge strike glyph, which means you will not cast an awful lot of icy touch and plague strike. The 0/10/61 spec has its first frost points in improved icy touch, a spell not really overly used. Is this spec really competitive compared to the 12/0/59 spec? (bearing in mind that my DK is not that geared yet)
You will see a larger gain in dps with 12/0/59 in your current gear. 0/10/61 is a build that scales via percentages, thus it is reliant on having an amount of gear to make it beat out the static scaling that 12/0/59 provides. You should start seeing a difference between the two around late tier 7 (next to BiS) and of course into tier 8 gear. The reason Improved Icy Touch is taken is because it *is* a dps upgrade over 3/5 Toughness because you no longer receive benefit from armor to AP as you would with Bladed Armor.
#1834SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kaejin
Has anyone been experiencing odd rune refresh glitches lately? Not sure when exactly it started, but it never happened to me before 3.1.

What happens is that if I use a rune precisely as it comes off cooldown, the rune will jam, and won't show cooldown progress even though the rune was used and is on cooldown. When they rune refresh is done, I can use the rune again and it will show the cooldown progress again provided I don't manage to jam it once more.

It usually only happens to me with blood runes. I thought it was a bug with my rune display addon at first, but it happens with Blizzard's default rune display as well. It's rather distracting when I think I have a blood rune off cooldown and try to use it only to get an insufficient resource error. Guessing when my blood runes are off cooldown isn't much fun either.

Apologies if this has been discussed before. I did searched back a handful of pages for mention of runes and this didn't come up.
