#2457SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Keldin
Frost tanks

I've been away from WoW for a couple of months and now I see that DW tanking builds have come viable. My question is how Frost DW tanking is compared to Frost 2H tanking? Any major differences in threat, stat bonuses or do they both perform equally well?
#2458SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Asphyxialol
Originally Posted by Keldin
Frost tanks

I've been away from WoW for a couple of months and now I see that DW tanking builds have come viable. My question is how Frost DW tanking is compared to Frost 2H tanking? Any major differences in threat, stat bonuses or do they both perform equally well?
In 5 mans and sometimes in 10 mans DW frost will mostly generate more threat (on the basis that blood generally requires both buffs and debuffs to adequately perform threat, not that it doesn't generate plenty as is, just that it's sub par in 5m and some 10m). It provides more armor (agility), and I believe more avoidance (but that was only true of the old 1.5s speed weapons, I haven't figured what the difference is now between two Hellscream Slicers and Mor'Kosh, as an example). Frost cooldowns are nicer in 5s, especially the longer duration of IBF, in comparison to bloods cooldowns which are much more targeted towards large health pools to buffer incoming heals.

It's something I'll be testing quite a bit further into the week, but for now if you have the DW weapons and not the 2h then by all means it's fine.

#2463SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3MikeMo
I have been attempting to search for this information but apparently I am having no luck. A friend of mine obtained a Deathbringer's Will on his DK which he typically plays as Blood. I read in the Frost DW thread that the procs for a DK are Haste, Crit and Str. However, my friend (Ahi of Laughing Skull) states that as Blood he was getting two different Iron Dwarves, one with a crit proc and the other with an Arp proc and then he'd get a Tauren with a Str proc.

We were curious so he respec'd to Unholy and Frost. The following are the results from all three specs.

Unholy - Crit, Str, Haste
Blood - Crit, Str, Arp
Frost - Crit, Str, Arp

My question is has anybody else discovered this yet and could anybody else help verify it?

#2469SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fugazor
Originally Posted by Laina
Will the Bone Arbiter 2h axe be superior to Shadows edge for a Blood or Unholy DK?
Did you get chosen for legendary?
- Yes -> go for SE from quest line and don't care about anything else unless its ilvl277 BA and nobody wants it.
- No -> Do you have ilvl258 DB?
* Yes -> Pass ilvl264 BA for any good Rets in your raid, then get it; then get ilvl277 BA.
* No -> Get ilvl264 BA then ilvl277 BA.

As for DW tanking I do not see it working in serious content without two slow 1h tanking weapons which do not and will not exist. DW tanking feels to me like 2h Enhancement Shaman. Just go 2h Blood if you want to tank stuff.
#2470SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Qaenyin
So for the sake of my own guild's progression, I've been tossing around the idea, once I get my computer hardware updated(my processor is going out thus my PC at present cannot handle raiding), of attempting to main tank our icecrown runs.

Problem is I'm unsure of what numbers I should shoot for. My original aim was to hit 38k hp and 65-70% avoidance unbuffed as unholy(following which I'm still debating unholy vs blood depending on if I have difficulty with threat gen vs our dps or not, personally I prefer unholy's flexibility over Blood's pure single target threat, as our other DK tank, whom is blood, cannot seem to hold aggro on trash pulls and multiple target situations). I do not want to spec frost as I like having the availability of the superior death strike self healing that both unholy and blood have present(although unholy has to sacrifice some threat if they want the self healing).

That said, after running some numbers I'm having difficulty coming up with a suitable tanking setup without relying on raid drops. My current gear is in my armory profile, but I'm hesitant on shelling out 10-20k gold on materials and such for things like full crafted ToC25 items, the Frost Emblem tanking trinket(not shelling out gold for this obviously), and maxing both jewelcrafting and blacksmithing for the sake of hitting my projected numbers without relying on ToC drops(which are unreliable considering I'm attempting to be available for tanking sooner rather than later).

What unbuffed/buffed tanking stats are recommended? A paladin tank I know is packing 2-3k block value, 45k unbuffed hp and some 70% unbuffed avoidance(sans block), but DK tanks gear differently and he also overgears the first wing most likely.
#2471SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3m0053hunter
Sim results inquiry
I have been using various simulators and looking at posted results in these forums and have noticed that DW frost builds tend to sim 10-20% higher than Unholy which is 1-2% higher than Blood. I have been using the standardized builds and glyph setups and as close to the same set of gear (trying to get comparable 2h and DW weps) for each simulation. In short, I try to keep things as simple and constant as possible.

The question is: Why does DW Frost simulate so much higher than the other two trees but not actually produce those results in practice?

The only thing I can think of is that the nature of the more demanding proc based priority of Frost makes it much harder to use effectively and efficiently in a boss encounter and the simulators can simply take perfect advantage of every proc. Or, there is a bug that permeates all the simulators (I find this unlikely).

------------

In response to MikeMo, I have found that I receive the STR, HASTE and CRIT procs from DBW as Unholy but have not tried any other specs yet.
#2472SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
Originally Posted by m0053hunter
The question is: Why does DW Frost simulate so much higher than the other two trees but not actually produce those results in practice?

The only thing I can think of is that the nature of the more demanding proc based priority of Frost makes it much harder to use effectively and efficiently in a boss encounter and the simulators can simply take perfect advantage of every proc. Or, there is a bug that permeates all the simulators (I find this unlikely).
I doubt it, when comparing my crit rates on various abilities to the crit rates that the sims generate, I find that they are almost identical. I know that I miss one or two KM procs over the course of the fight, but as a general rule, my play on fights like Saurfang is nearly perfect, but I am still several hundred DPS short of the values given by many of the sims.

I'm much more willing to accept the sims having various errors in them, not a lot of time has been devoted (to the best of my knowledge) to modelling Frost, as it's much less played than Unholy.
#2473SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tianshaan
Originally Posted by Qaenyin
My original aim was to hit 38k hp and 65-70% avoidance unbuffed
Hello Qaenyin

Do some reading up on tanking in ICC (you did mention that was where you wanted to tank). The current end game tanking priority is EH, or effective health - not avoidance. ICC has a permanent (while you are in the instance) -20% to Dodge. This completely nerfs the stacking of avoidance in end game raiding (notice I did NOT say completely negates avoidance), which was Blizzard's intent as they gear up for Cataclysm. A quick quote from GhostCrawler:
"What I would like to see in Cataclysm is higher health pools but also lower heals (and tank avoidance) overall. "

Therefore, we would now want to stack effective health (health, armor) to maximize survivability in the Citadel. In the very first boss encounter for example, you are going to be consistently taking around 18 to 22K damage every 2 seconds (others can check my figures as I am tired ;P) and that is as off-tank . MT will also be taking melee hits. You must have over 40K on this encounter or it basically puts your healers in a no win situation. This is how it is meant to be...a gear check.

We have done this with a tank with 44K but it took multiple tries, however I am sure some guilds are able to push through. To one shot that particular encounter I usually tank with a little over 50K, and the druid tank with about 55.7K.

Originally Posted by Qaenyin
I do not want to spec frost as I like having the availability of the superior death strike self healing that both unholy and blood have present(although unholy has to sacrifice some threat if they want the self healing).
I don't understand the, what I consider to be a misconception, idea of "needing" Death Strike healing while in a raid. Your healers are there for a purpose, and you are there for a different purpose. Healing yourself while in a 5 man is indeed neat, but in no way needed in a raid scenario. Ask your healers if they can tell the difference between your Blood tanking (using the proper rotation/priority) and some other tank. Your survival on something like the previous fight (Marrowgar) will not be affected at all by a DS heal.

Originally Posted by Qaenyin
What unbuffed/buffed tanking stats are recommended? A paladin tank I know is packing 2-3k block value, 45k unbuffed hp and some 70% unbuffed avoidance(sans block), but DK tanks gear differently and he also overgears the first wing most likely.
Your pally friend is mostly likely counting his block in with dodge and parry, just like most pallies do. It took 30 minutes the other day for my party to explain to our pug tank that his avoidance wasn't 75%. Shoot a armory link this way and we can tell, I guess.

Take care
#2474SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3

Originally Posted by Tianshaan

MT will also be taking melee hits. You must have over 40K on this encounter or it basically puts your healers in a no win situation. This is how it is meant to be...a gear check.

We have done this with a tank with 44K but it took multiple tries, however I am sure some guilds are able to push through. To one shot that particular encounter I usually tank with a little over 50K, and the druid tank with about 55.7K.


I don't understand the, what I consider to be a misconception, idea of "needing" Death Strike healing while in a raid. Your healers are there for a purpose, and you are there for a different purpose. Healing yourself while in a 5 man is indeed neat, but in no way needed in a raid scenario. Ask your healers if they can tell the difference between your Blood tanking (using the proper rotation/priority) and some other tank. Your survival on something like the previous fight (Marrowgar) will not be affected at all by a DS heal.


Your pally friend is mostly likely counting his block in with dodge and parry, just like most pallies do. It took 30 minutes the other day for my party to explain to our pug tank that his avoidance wasn't 75%. Shoot a armory link this way and we can tell, I guess.

Take care


Covering each point seperately.

First point, yes I realize EH is more important than avoidance, which is why I'm aiming for the pretty low level of 65-70% avoidance(considering my present avoidance is almost 60% and my equipment is 15-30 ilvs below even ToC25 gear, that puts it as pretty mediocre for unbuffed. 65% avoidance, discounting spec specific talents like FDP, would be along the lines of 12% miss, 32% dodge and 21% parry, which is only 8% higher than what I presently have. I'm not taking Chill of the Throne into account in my numbers, mind, for the sake of simplicity). If I were stacking avoidance I'd want closer to 75%+. That said, I need a certain level of avoidance to maintain rune strike uptime. The avoidance level I want has little to do with survivability.

38k hp is pretty low, yes, which is why I'm trying to get a reasonable number to aim for. I only have about 33.5k right now unbuffed, but I cannot seem to come up with a decent gearset I can obtain for ICC that will bring me up to the 40-45k unbuffed that I'd prefer to have. Even throwing in the ICC trinket and every piece of ToC25 crafted gear and every piece of badge gear sans frost badges only seems to put me at 38-39k with full +30 stamina gems.

Reason I like having death strike available is more for padding to support my healers than for the sake of a primary source of healing. Being able to grab a quick 12k heal via death strike is a pretty significant benefit if it won't noticably impact threat generation at the time, and while not something I want to rely on, is something I find frequently convenient enough to be a nice thing to have if I can work it in in a pinch during a high damage intake situation(I ended up using it a lot in uld10 back in 3.1 as blood as it made a pretty sizeable difference on hodir, giving my healers more freedom to top off dps taking incidental aoe damage, and I have on several occasions had it allow me to survive long enough to serve as a buffer between heals in certain situations).

And lastly, the paladin in question in the gearset I was describing has 44k unbuffed hp, roughly 3k block value, and 70%+ avoidance(this is his anub add tanking set and thus he makes it a point to be avoidance capped with holy shield, which would be at least 68% avoidance minimum, and he has more than that I know for sure).

That's partly why I'm still using my T8.5 chest. I'm undecided on whether it will be necessary for me to get Breastplate of the White Knight and Saronite Swordbreakers made or if my current bracers and the T9 chest will be sufficient, so I haven't spent my triumph badges yet in case I need them for the orbs.
Last edited by Qaenyin : 12/28/09 at 6:41 AM.
#2475SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tianshaan
Originally Posted by Qaenyin
If I were stacking avoidance I'd want closer to 75%+. That said, I need a certain level of avoidance to maintain rune strike uptime.
No, you really don't. Most tanks are at a comfortable level of avoidance to maintain Runestrike, and if not, then they shouldn't be endgame. I can't think of a single ICC fight where your DPS would overtake you on threat, except on something like an aggro wipe, which they should know how to handle anyway.
Runestrike just got a buff in 3.3 to offset the -20% dodge.

The most return you will see for Runstrike uptime if you have a good level of avoidance is capping Hit. You are very near cap, which is great...I am only at 6% I believe and i have no problems at all.

Your expertise is probably the next thing to improve to minimize your other TPS abilities from getting avoided. You will see threat jump a significant amount the closer to cap you get.

There is no reason not to have an avoidance set, since there are some fights which demand it at first (until its on farm) such as Saurfang. This will NOT be the norm, bceause of Blizz's direction for tanking.
However every other fight you will need your EH set, and an EH set doesn't gem for avoidance.
If you look at my armory now, thats my avoidance set. All i did was swap out trinkets. Thats it. And it was way overboard for Saurfang. Next time i won't even switch from my EH set on that fight.

I am not trying to make you uncomfortable while playing...obviously you need to be happy with your toon. But these forums are all about maximizing, and doing things because a better option doesn't exist.
#2476SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Blackteddy
Is the Blade of Culling an upgrade over the Normal Justicebringer? Even if it puts you over the exp soft cap.
#2477SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3jvoodoochild
Unholy DPS/Farm build questions
Seeking some advice on my Unholy DPS build. Its my off spec and I went unholy because the perm-a-ghoul and pale horse were dominate for farming which I use to do a lot of. I don’t raid other than the weekly quest and with the new pug system I found it easier to go DPS and not take on the responsibility of tanking an instance where people don’t know me and I don’t know them.

I did my own Black Ice build in 3.2 but with the changes to SS in 3.3 I decided to come out to EJ to see which way the wind was blowing. No surprise I was doing it all wrong to begin with.

I wish to shift two points into OaPH from the accepted max AoE DPS (reaping-less) build but don’t know where to take them from.

Well I know where one point is coming from, I’m dropping UB for sure as I spam DC too often to get anywhere close to a full 10 secs. I kept recount up for a 4 instance pug group and UB accounted for a half % of my overall DPS.

For the other point I’m leaning towards 1 of 2 Epidemic. If the build had Reaping I could understand the need for longer diseases with GoP in use along with the 20 sec Desolation buff, but as with most theory crafting I just don’t see it.

The recommended deduction would be from Necrosis (which I don’t currently have in my build). I do have Blood-Caked Blade and while it is lack luster on my recount while I’m using Edge of Ruin, DPS is DPS. Still I’m curious if I would get the same mileage out of 5/5 Necrosis 0/3 BCB as both are off of white damage and I believe Necrosis would double dip with Blood Presence (which previously I had not been using).

TY in advance.
#2478SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3jvoodoochild
Starting to see the light
OK, I’m seeing the advantage of longer diseases even without reaping, so 2/2 Epidemic is kept. My two options I see now are 2/5 Necrosis + 0/1 Unholy Blight + 2/3 Morbidity or 0/5 Necrosis + 1/1 Unholy Blight + 3/3 Morbidity. Which is better for a lowish geared casual player?

Keep in mind most of you SS's are going to do less damage if you out 1 whole disease. But some of the builds are based partly on T9 set bonuses and T10. Reaping helps when get the t10 2 set with the bonus and extra SS w/ reaping.

I would remove if you insist on OaPH 2 from Necrosis and maybe 1 out of BCB. But the worst thing is to have diseases fall off so loosing one in Epidemic makes your rotation even tighter. With Epidemic lets me get a SS-BS-DC or 2 in on the next target without re-applying everything.

Even in 5mans as gear score goes up you get into better dps groups where you will be lucky to get off 4 attacks before most everything is dead.

If you are looking for just mount speed ok, but if you are looking for increased run speed there is a boot enchant that helps out.

#2481SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rhinoe
Originally Posted by Blackteddy
Is the Blade of Culling an upgrade over the Normal Justicebringer? Even if it puts you over the exp soft cap.
I would say Yes. You get a extra gem slot. Higher top and bottom end damage you would loose the 1.96% crit but over all get 21 more str/weapon damage. Over cap will just give you a bit of flexibility in another area.
#2482SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Shadowguard
In regards to Runic Power and Unholy DPS, should I always be using Death Coil in the middle of my rotation if the next strike will bring me over the RP cap? For instance, I go into combat with 60/100 RP, do PS-IT-BS- which would put me at 95/100 RP, would using Death Coil then and continuing with BS-SS-DUMP be the best idea? I usually try my best to not RP cap myself.
#2483SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Derivel
Originally Posted by jvoodoochild
The recommended deduction would be from Necrosis (which I don’t currently have in my build). I do have Blood-Caked Blade and while it is lack luster on my recount while I’m using Edge of Ruin, DPS is DPS. Still I’m curious if I would get the same mileage out of 5/5 Necrosis 0/3 BCB as both are off of white damage and I believe Necrosis would double dip with Blood Presence (which previously I had not been using).

TY in advance.
Unless something has changed, Necrosis doesn't take modifiers from anything else anymore. Purely based on your white damage.

BCB is more damage, but only if it procs with your diseases up, of course. If you're going to be AOE farming I'd say it's not huge either way. Those are both single target talents and I doubt you'd see a significant difference in kill time with one over the other, though BCB will probably still be more damage.
#2484SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rhinoe
Originally Posted by Shadowguard
In regards to Runic Power and Unholy DPS, should I always be using Death Coil in the middle of my rotation if the next strike will bring me over the RP cap? For instance, I go into combat with 60/100 RP, do PS-IT-BS- which would put me at 95/100 RP, would using Death Coil then and continuing with BS-SS-DUMP be the best idea? I usually try my best to not RP cap myself.
(Boss) PS-IT-BS- next hit SS (should be 100/100 RP) hope it proc's trinket/pop trinkets and use Gargoyle(60 RP), BS should give little extra RP to hit your DC(40 RP) should have enough RP to continue with your normal rotation. If fight lasts longer then 3min then you will have a chance for a 2nd Gargoyle attack.

(Trash) same as above but would judge using Gargoyle on how close you are to the boss encounter, DC Dump is a good option as well.

Arpen is the 2nd best uncappable dps stat, next to strength. Provided you're hit softcapped and expertise softcapped, NES is considerably better.

#2496SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Asphyxialol
Originally Posted by Pyrhus
Urass,

My problem seems to be that I don't have enough time to get my diseases up and then spread them. I find when I'm in a 5 man PUG my DPS tends to be much higher than when I'm doing a 5 man with my guild (mobs die MUCH quicker when in a guild group).

Current gear: The World of Warcraft Armory

I know I'm doing something way wrong, I just can't seem to figure out what. I keep bone shied up, horn of winter, ghoul is up...
5 man dps is largely irrelevent. If things are dying, and you aren't afk, then you are doing your job. As a DK I hold top 5 spots as unholy and frost in all current 10m fights and top 25 spots in all current 25m fights (minus Anub I believe), I put out 10k+ dps on Saurfang, but on some fights in heroics with my guild I only put out 2-2.5k (now if it's 3gcd or longer, that changes, but honestly a lot of mobs, even bosses, die before I can complete the second half of my rotation).

DK dps has a ramp up time that other classes don't, in order to anything remotely decent you need diseases up, and the only way to speed that process is to dps in unholy presence (and if things are dying in 3s, it's most likely going to be giving you more dps anyways) or spec frost for more instant burst at the start of a fight (and higher melee damage which doesn't require 2-3 seconds of disease application / spreading time - as well as HB for instant burst on AoE packs).
#2497SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3takeitsqueezy
I've been catching some flak from my guild for popping army pre-pull on saurfang. I wait until the NPCs are lifted into the air and then I pop army. Every single time I've done this they are all dead before the first blood beasts spawn.

I need to come back to my guild with some concrete info though so I can get that aotd ignorance out of their heads. How long does aotd last after it's fully cast? Does anyone know the exact timing on when the first set of blood beasts spawn on 10/25? I just want to get an idea of how much leeway I have in casting army and making sure the ghouls are all dead before the beasts pop.
#2498SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Each ghoul lasts for 40 seconds, so it's 44 seconds from starting the cast to the last ghoul dying. The first beasts spawn at around 35 seconds into the fight. It is perfectly save to summon the AotD when Saurfang sr. starts to charge, but not later than when he is lifted into the air.

#2500SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Esh-324
If you want the extra dps from Army, yes. Right when DBS says "Charge" is a good time to start you channel, as your runes will be off of CD before he actually activates. I would not recommend popping Army once the fight has started unless you are the tank during the last 1% of the enrage and have run out of CDs.

#2508SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3MikeMo
Originally Posted by MikeMo
I have been attempting to search for this information but apparently I am having no luck. A friend of mine obtained a Deathbringer's Will on his DK which he typically plays as Blood. I read in the Frost DW thread that the procs for a DK are Haste, Crit and Str. However, my friend (Ahi of Laughing Skull) states that as Blood he was getting two different Iron Dwarves, one with a crit proc and the other with an Arp proc and then he'd get a Tauren with a Str proc.

We were curious so he respec'd to Unholy and Frost. The following are the results from all three specs.

Unholy - Crit, Str, Haste
Blood - Crit, Str, Arp
Frost - Crit, Str, Arp

My question is has anybody else discovered this yet and could anybody else help verify it?
Quoting myself since it's been a few pages.

I have an update on this. Mysteriously, a change was made between last night and today that now has Blood DK's proc'ing the Haste Valk instead of ArP.

Blizzard developers did mention in a forum post that they were going to change the proc on the Deathbringer's Will to be optimized for every spec that could use the trinket. However, I do believe they are in error with this particular change.

I just figured I'd update this since it may effect more people now.
#2509SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Asphyxialol

#2510SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Draslin
Problems with cooldowns and open runes
Hi Guys -

On my DK I constantly run into problems where I'd like to pop a cooldown, but don't have any runes. My previous attempts to macro blood tap with the cooldown have been unsuccessful (I play with a relatively high latency for a tank (~200ms).

Is there anything I can do within my macros to add a very brief delay into the macro itself to compensate for latency? I often find myself either hitting my hotkey for blood tap -> unbreakable armor, but that it does not fire, and i have been gibbed (I'm looking at YOU, saber lash!).

I've tried a bunch of stuff, but nothing seems to work. Any advice is greatly appreciated!

Draslin/Drazlin
Pally/DK Tank
House Darkforge - US - Garrosh - Horde
#2511SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3faight
Originally Posted by Draslin
Hi Guys -

On my DK I constantly run into problems where I'd like to pop a cooldown, but don't have any runes. My previous attempts to macro blood tap with the cooldown have been unsuccessful (I play with a relatively high latency for a tank (~200ms).

Is there anything I can do within my macros to add a very brief delay into the macro itself to compensate for latency? I often find myself either hitting my hotkey for blood tap -> unbreakable armor, but that it does not fire, and i have been gibbed (I'm looking at YOU, saber lash!).

I've tried a bunch of stuff, but nothing seems to work. Any advice is greatly appreciated!

Draslin/Drazlin
Pally/DK Tank
House Darkforge - US - Garrosh - Horde
I would suggest a castsequence macro if you're not using one.

#showtooltip
/castsequence reset=30 Blood Tap, Unbreakable Armor

They're nice because spell #2 won't fire if spell #1 doesn't successfully cast, so you can mash the crap out of the macro button and you'll get Blood Tap then UA without having to hit multiple buttons.

The bad thing is you won't get UA if your Blood Tap is on cooldown. I suggest using this macro in your normal spot for Blood Tap, since with the reset you can use it as a normal blood tap button by just pressing it once, and keep UA bound seperately for situations where tap is on cooldown and you have the capability of casting it without tapping. This is just a "oh crap I need UA and have no runes mash mash mash" type of macro.

Do bloodworms still eat AoE healing from healers? IE circle of healing and wild growth and others? I know it used to but I am wondering if they have changed that in a patch recently.

Thanks.
Bloodworms are last in the chain of getting heals. They won't take heals from players or pets for that matter.

#2517SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
By debuff, do you mean there is not a Rune Weapon beside you, or a debuff like what the Garg does.

DRW does not get your talents and Blood Presence that adds to your attacks. Also if you cast a disease after DRW the strikes will be bigger. If they are messing with Blood's damage, it will not be down (Blood is at the bottom, but someone has to be there). Blood is not doing well in PvP either (Unholy is top there too).
#2518SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3dalavita
Originally Posted by frmorrison
By debuff, do you mean there is not a Rune Weapon beside you, or a debuff like what the Garg does.

DRW does not get your talents and Blood Presence that adds to your attacks. Also if you cast a disease after DRW the strikes will be bigger. If they are messing with Blood's damage, it will not be down (Blood is at the bottom, but someone has to be there). Blood is not doing well in PvP either (Unholy is top there too).
The debuff mechanic is a bit odd. I'm not sure what gargoyle does as I don't play unholy, but here goes.

You now need to target someone to cast DRW (99% sure about this), and they get a DRW debuff, and you simultaneously get a DRW buff. It'll still be next to you, but it'll attack them straight away.

If the target dies before DRW fades, it'll continue acting like it used to, return to your side, do what you do, but the difference is that it'll stick to its old target until the target is dead or it fades.

This have ups and downs I guess. One up is that it won't randomly aggro some healer casting stuff and stay on the target you want, a downside is that the debuff will really stick out and announce incoming burst, and switches won't work as well. (PVP ups and downs). As far as PVE goes, it probably doesn't make that much of a difference.

As far as the damage goes.

I can't imagine what talents are the ones that make DRW only do 25% damage of your strikes, and still do 50% melee damage compared to your melee swings, but after checking out combat logs, it seems to have been like this since before. For how long, I'm not sure.

For instance:

WoW Meters Online - Combatlog Replay
Combat Date 2009-12-16

HS Average: 6,198
DRW HS Average: 2,079 (Probably popped every cooldown to make it to 1/3 of his Average, rather than 1/4, what most other logs show)

Melee Average: 6,425
DRW Melee Average: 3,392

DS Average: 10,317
DRW DS Average: 1,758

I can understand that raid buffs and procs could make a difference between your damage and DRWs, but like I said, hitting the dummy naked still gives the same results.
#2519SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Gunner
Anyone having problems casting DRW with a macro should remove the [target=player] segment from your /cast Dancing Rune Weapon line.
The change now makes the weapon attack from behind regardless of where you are standing.
#2520SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Piisuke
I tried searching the forum for a concrete answer, but with the Unholy DK having over 2000 replies alone, searching through that topic would be insane, wasting time and possible giving me a headache, so instead I'll resort it this way.

I need to know what Unholy DK's need to do during the first phase whilst fighting Lady Deathwhisper. I googled, but surprisingly I could not find a concrete answer.

The reason I am asking is because Unholy DK deal damage in 2 ways, physical and magical, as I am sure you guys are aware. Now, when people talk about the tactics, you always hear people say "melee attack x" and "range attack y", or "physical attack x" and "magical attack y".
However, the problem, to which I have not found a solution yet, be it simple or not, is that I don't see where Unholy DKs fit into this, as Scourge Strike and Icy Touch are spells for example and Blood Strike and Plague Strike are physical and those are the abilities we use most.
So what is the best solution for Unholy DKs in P1 in 10 and 25 man? Do we just soak it and have half of our attacks absorbed 99%? Do we attack Deathwhisper instead? I am not sure in either way. To me, it would make sense to attack Lady Deathwhisper, as we could deal more damage that way than on mobs that have half of our attacks deal 1% of its normal power.

Thanks in advance.
#2521SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3RoflCow
Diseases up on all the targets on whichever side you are DPSing and then just switch targets based on what you can hurt. Never bother with mobs that are empowered or resurrected, just DPS normal mobs then the boss. It isn't Rocket Surgery.
#2522SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Tianshaan
I have been hesitant to post this because of its non-confirmed, only observed status.

I started noticing DnD doing alot less threat about a week or more ago. Generally, before this, I could AoE pull in heroics and both 10 and 25s with DnD>IT>PS>Pest and go into a lazy tabbing-thru-targets rotation until I had to use DnD again if needed.
This was plenty of threat by a long-shot.
Suddenly, I started having mobs walking THROUGH my DnD to get to people, and this would even happen on the pull. Once people started asking where my threat went (I have never had threat problems) I began to watch Omen.

Sure enough, on a standard run in and drop DnD AoE pull in all dungeons (Hs,10s & 25s), I did some testing with a healer. Getting to 100K threat in a heroic using only a DnD>IT>PS>Pest rotation used to be about 20 seconds.
However, when I tested I never made it. Or rather, I gave up and started tabbing targets. It was common for a mob to run out to the healer. I have ThreatNamePlates so I could watch them and the threat I had on that mob. It was very common for the mob to have only 2K threat on it. As a matter of fact, using only DnD WITH THE GLYPH never changed this. Still only about 2K threat on the untargeted mobs. I am still using the Glyph right now mostly because I am just hoping it works, even though I see no improvement.

TPS in raids was the same. I had mobs walk out of DnD with hardly any threat of them (still using Glyph). Several people including my wife (the healer) now have witnessed the phenomenon and simply chalk it up to the 'DKs are all nerfed now' mentality. I don't believe that, and have seen nobody else experiencing this, nor any mention of a stealth nerf to DK AoE threat.

This is very frustrating, and I assure you it is not something that has been there all along and that I am just now seeing, I have been tanking this toon a long while now.
#2523SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Silarn
As far as I know this hasn't been mentioned elsewhere, and seeing as how it applies more or less to all DPS specs,

As of last week it would seem that pestilenced diseases on Faction Champions are now being mitigated as they are on the Blood Beasts.
#2524SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		• Asphyxialol
That is most certainly not true: World of Logs - Real Time Raid Analysis

As you can see in that report my diseases had nearly the same amount of ticks (58 vs 54), and my tick on my primary target (Fjora Lightbane) did an average of 2877 damage, where my average tick on the other Val'kyr (Eydis Darkbane) averaged 922 damage per tick.

The buff, Dark Essence in my case, reduces your damage done to the other color Val'kyr by 50% (and it's always worked that way), and judging from my Patchwerk parse (World of Logs - Real Time Raid Analysis) my average tick was just under 1800, so that fits. The bonus damage against your primary target is 50%, which also fits within slight variation with the above (ie 2877 vs 2700, small sample size, etc.).

It is still working now as it was a few weeks ago.

Edit: Those numbers are accurate, I did not change colors on vortex and I did not gain Empowered Darkness as a dps buff, that is strictly me vs valks.
Last edited by Asphyxialol : 01/12/10 at 8:42 PM.

#2528SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Asphyxialol
Originally Posted by Silarn
Well then it's too bad I said Faction Champions and not Twin Val'kyr.

Obviously diseases will do full damage on a normal fight. They are mitigated against Blood Beasts and, as of last week, on Faction Champions.

I remember checking recount and seeing a minimum tick of ~175 on diseases. For some reason this is not showing up on the WoL parse, but both DKs in the group did drastically less damage than previous kills.
I'm not sure what I was thinking when I read your post then, sorry about that (may have been chatting in IRC about valks and it just popped into my head for the reply).

This week (not this reset, last reset) my average FF tick was 1572.1, where 2 weeks ago my average FF tick was 1631.63, so it doesn't appear there has been any major nerfs, and RNG can easily decide that small of a difference, or enemies stacking, group debuffs, etc.

If you look at the damage breakdown the diseases weren't up on as many targets as the previous week, which is a cause for a major dps loss. Also, if you look at his buffs cast (speaking about Karashoté atm) he applied diseases a total of 249 times on the first parse and only 80 times on the second parse (Ebon Plague was 376 vs 114 as well, to show the drastic change). The other DK seems to have a fairly similar parse between both weeks, with just standard deviation from the norm, so I wouldn't worry much about it.

#2530SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Afabar
Just by looking at the report, Haste has nothing to do with your poor performance. Your glyphs choice(D&d, God) is not good for this fight. You have GoD but you use PS/IT 7 time in the fight, you must be doing something wrong. Due to your mistakes in your cycle you are making less SS than expected resulting a dps loss.

#2536SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3halfpint
Ideally right after diseases have expired, there's one more tick of damage at 0. If you are clipping your diseases, then make sure there's less than 3 seconds on them.

#2548SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3jimavet
TAB
Thankfully likely very easy questions have a forum..... ;-P
In the ideal Blood tanking rotations for Multi-Tanking Rotation it says:
"Multi Target Rotation - DnD-IT-PS-Pest then TAB-HS/DS/Pest/BloodBoil RPDUMP = RS/Deathcoil"
Question - what does the "TAB-HS" stand for? I presume the HS is Heart Strike but can't figure out the "TAB" portion.

Same thing for Frost Multi Target Rotation - it lists TAB-HB. The HB is presumably Howling Blast but what is the "TAB" spell/ability?
Thanks.
#2549SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Tab is the tabulator key on your keyboard. It simply says, switch to the next target (so that the next Pestilence reapplies diseases on your original target).
#2550SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Otaki
Execute Range in Simulators
Can anyone recommend an accurate simulator for DW Frost DPS that will allow you to specify for what portion of the fight the boss is at <35% health? I've tried Team Robot, Rawr and Kahorie's, but haven't been able to find a way to alter how much of the time the boss is in execute range.
#2551SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Mindaika
Originally Posted by Otaki
Can anyone recommend an accurate simulator for DW Frost DPS that will allow you to specify for what portion of the fight the boss is at <35% health? I've tried Team Robot, Rawr and Kahorie's, but haven't been able to find a way to alter how much of the time the boss is in execute range.
I think you can safely assume the boss is in execute range for about 35% of the fight.
#2552SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Esh-324
Probably less as everyone has execute range abilities. I'd say 25% would be a good estimate
#2553SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Otaki
All the same, I'd like to be able to model under other assumptions. I'm thinking of fights like Lady Deathwhisper, where the boss spends an abnormal amount of time above 35% because of a mana shield effect, or of any fight where I need to do something else during the execute phase--for example, DPSing Kel'thuzad until 45%, then tanking one of the adds for the remainder of the fight.

What I'm ultimately trying to determine is under what conditions, if any, it would be a net DPS gain to drop 2/2 Merciless Combat and pick up both Deathchill and 3/3 Blood-Caked Blade. I need to be able to isolate and modify the duration of the execute phase in a simulator to get an answer.

#2556SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kinoshi
I'm curious how viable Unholy or Frost tanking are compared to Blood. Recently I've been tanking as Blood, but I've grown bored of it, however I don't want to severely gimp myself by respecing to Frost or Unholy.
#2557SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Exemplar
Originally Posted by Esh-324
Probably less as everyone has execute range abilities. I'd say 25% would be a good estimate
Redcape and I (both support Ret Paladin tools) have done some extensive research and found that on average 19% of the fight takes place under the 20% mark. Execute increases aren't as large a change as most people expect.

If your execute begins at 35%, I'd expect 33% of the fight occurs under that level. Saying 25% of the fight is under 35% total health means raid damage climbs to 140% at that stage - it just doesn't happen. Execute effects are about a 5% increase.
#2558SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amiro
Originally Posted by Kinoshi
I'm curious how viable Unholy or Frost tanking are compared to Blood. Recently I've been tanking as Blood, but I've grown bored of it, however I don't want to severely gimp myself by respecing to Frost or Unholy.
Depends what you are tanking. I respeced frost for ICC and found it both better with aggro and mana-friendly for healers. However tried it only once in ToGC and it was complete disaster.

High damage spikes of ToGC are much better handled by blood spec, but for faster hitting bosses of ICC frost is better in my opinion.

#2563SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Lupiscanis
Been looking around for a while, and wondered if anyone would be able to help me with something. Before I played WoW, I played Everquest, and a tank on there too, although a Warrior. In EQ, we used to weight gear choices through a system of X HP = X AC, and then factor in mod2's in the choices (avoidance, spell sheild etc).

In WoW however, I'm having a much harder time figuring out where the balance lies between avoidance and health (which seem to be the two swing points as far as I can see). I've been tending to gear for +defense +dodge where I can, but I see a lot of threads where people state that gearing for +stamina is what you should do as a tank.

Given that AC over HP used to be the most viable tanking ideal in Everquest, I guess I'm just curious if it's also viable here. Can you gear, gem and enchant for avoidance, and still be a decent tank? Or does it require at least some deference to hitpoints?

For reference, I'm tanking Heroics up to and including Saron, but haven't tried my hand at raids yet, since I don't really know much about how they work, and I'm Unholy specced.
#2564SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• frmorrison
The big reason why tanks usually go for stamina over avoidance/armor is stamina helps with all damage, and the latter only helps with melee damage. There is quite a bit of magic damage in raids.

For heroics, avoidance/armor is likely better because you never know if the healer is asleep or bad.

#2572SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Muggins
I was planning on making a post in Suno's thread about Acclimation yesterday stating where it was useful and what spells would activate the buff, unfortunately my /combatlog for wednesday night was scuppered by an untimely disconnect halfway through Lana'Thel tries missing out most of the Plagueworks. So i'll have to put up a log as evidence after next reset, however in the meantime i'll try to list what I've eyeballed causing the proc and actually how useful it is for the fights that matter.

Festergut - Can proc off of both of the blights spread into the room as well the shadow damage from the innoculation, however uptime can be unpredictable so its not something you can rely on being up for when the Pungent Blight hits home.

Rotface - Seems to proc off of both of the ooze auras and the slime spray, uncertain as to whether the slime pools can cause it to proc. All damage taken is Shadowstorm, which lists as shadow damage in the combat log and will give you shadow buff stacks which do seem to decrease the damage taken so whether its just a cosmetic school name change or something else is supposed to be going on I'm not sure. Uptime if you're the ooze kiter is high and very useful, if you're usually tanking Rotface himself however I can't see it being much use at all.

Putricide - Unfortunately I've been the Abom tank each time on this fight so the only phase I can comment on is P3, the debuff that stacks on the tank and deals raidwide damage will proc the shadow stacks with high uptime, however its not usually the damage the tanks are taking from the debuff that's the worry in this part of the fight.

Blood Council - Procs from both of Keleseth and Taldaram's spells. If you're running the 2 tank strategy and you happen to be picking up Keleseth the buff will be up at full 3 stacks pretty much constantly as the shadow dot from the Nuclei will also prop up the buff, its very nice here. Taldaram's spells tend to be a bit further spaced apart so you stand a chance of losing your stacks, however it will proc off of both the spheres and the sparks.

Lana'Thel - This one is the daddy, your stack will be up almost constantly from her aura. Her bloodbolts, aura, and flames(if you happen to have bad melee dps) will all proc your shadow stacks. The bad news is that the shadow damage from Blood Mirror does not seem to be resistable(however you can absorb it with AMS). Still you'll get a good chunk of damage reduction for most of the fight.

The Rest - Coldflame from Marrowgar, Stinkey's Nature Pulse, Mortar Explosions from Gunship, Saurfang's debuffs(proc shadow resistance for some wierd reason) and pretty much all of the spells from Deathwhisper will give you Acclimation stacks, not that you'll care though.
Last edited by Muggins : 01/22/10 at 2:02 PM.
#2573SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3cyp
I've a question concerning rotations (as Unholy). Sometimes I find myself in a situation where there is some time left on diseases (usually just one tick) and my frost/unholy runes have refreshed. Is it beneficial to apply new diseases so I can put in more SS's or to wait until they run out?

2nd question: should I break the 4t9 bonus (232 ilvl) when I get upgrades from ICC10/25? I know I should when I acquire 2 t10, but I was wondering if I should just buy the items and wait until I get more 251+ loot.
#2574SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Ravenbrand
Originally Posted by cyp
I've a question concerning rotations (as Unholy). Sometimes I find myself in a situation where there is some time left on diseases (usually just one tick) and my frost/unholy runes have refreshed. Is it beneficial to apply new diseases so I can put in more SS's or to wait until they run out?

2nd question: should I break the 4t9 bonus (232 ilvl) when I get upgrades from ICC10/25? I know I should when I acquire 2 t10, but I was wondering if I should just buy the items and wait until I get more 251+ loot.
Stick to your rotation, if you are finding that you have a couple of seconds before your diseases fall off, that is less than 2 seconds or so, and your other runes have 5 or more seconds to become active it would be beneficial to reapply the diseases if you are following the rotation for the build. If that is not the case an extra SS then a quick reapplication of your diseases will help you overall. However, remember that if your locks aren't CoEing for that fight and the raid's magic damage is solely relying on your Ebon Plague then you should reapply unless raid dps is not a problem.

As to your second question, unless you get your 2pT10, don't break your 4pT9 bonus, even then when you get 2pT10 you would keep the other two pieces of T9 to get the 180 str proc. So, in short, get the 2pT10 because you will eventually go to 4pT10 maybe even 5. So do what is best for you.

This is just my two cents if others answer better than I do go with them.
#2575SourcePosted onundefinedNarshe311
Question about Frost tanking.

Shadai states in his DK guide that Frost use this rotation to aoe tank: HB>BB>BB (or D&D instead of last BB). His single target rotation is: HB>OB>BS and so on. This rotation ignores applying Blood Plague.

Suno's DK guide shows aoe as follows: DnD-IT-PS-Pest then TAB-HB/Pest/BloodBoil. Single target: IT-PS-OB-BS-BS IT-PS-OB-OB

I follow Shadai's method (and have HB glyph), and do fine for threat, but a guildy has been arguing that Suno's rotation is correct and im wrong. Im just wondering if one rotation is wrong and the other is right, or if both can be used effectively. Im also wondering how much better Frost threat could even be applying both diseases instead of just Frost Fever.

I know it really depends on what aspect of the game you prefer but from a theoretical point of view what is the best race choice?

I have found this priority but cant understand all the motives in it. Why are Dranei more suitabable for 2H PvE dps and Humans for DW PvE dps?

What should the correct list look like?

Horde:

PvE DPS & Tank: Orc
PvP: Undead

Alliance:

PvE DW DPS: Human
PvE 2H DPS: Draenei
PvE Tank: Night Elf
PvP: Human
#2577SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kaejin
For 2h it's because of the general value of hit for both Blood and Unholy.

For DW, it's because of the general value of expertise.



As for a PvP race on Horde, you can make a arguments for any of the races. Undead get WotF, Trolls get reduced snare duration, Orcs reduced stun duration, BE get a silence and RP boost, and Tauren get a stun.
#2578SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3MegaVolt
I think even for 2h the expertise would be superior since you can get the hit bonus with any other Draenei in your group without being one yourself. The main reason why I'd consider the human and dwarven racial useless for 2h PvE is that all the strong 2h weapons are axes so the human/dwarven expertise racial is completely wasted. With the practical expertise gain as human being 0 as soon as you get your hands on good weapons you might as well go Draenei and make sure you always have the hit increase. The orcish one on the other hand fits the current BiS items perfectly.
It's different for DW since as far as I know the BiS weapons there are swords which means the human racial works.

I also got a question:
When channeling AotD a DK will take reduced damage equal to his dodge and parry chance. Generally when casting a spell one loses the ability to dodge and parry. Does this mean that the loss of dodge/parry due to casting is just compensated, resulting in the same overall damage taken (though less spiky) during the channel or is the AotD cast special (which is a fair assumption since there is also no pushback and DK spells generally don't work like caster spells) and dodge/parry while channeling it are still possible, making it a "real" defensive cooldown?

I'm also frost and use HB glyph. For trash I open with D&D-HB-BB or HB-BB-BB if D&D is on CD. If it's not ICC trash, then it's probably dead at that point or close to it. If not, then I try to PS-Pest but anyway I prefer HB-BB to IT-PS-Pest. For me it works way better when dpsers choose different targets.

On harder bosses however I always keep both diseases.
#2580SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3gremello
army of the dead
several questions being new to deathknight

1 does any one know when use of the army of the dead can and should be used in ICC?

2 does the army of the dead produce more dps for the character?

3 does army of the dead should be popped with a speed poition like the goul?
#2581SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3halfpint
Originally Posted by gremello
several questions being new to deathknight

1 does any one know when use of the army of the dead can and should be used in ICC?

2 does the army of the dead produce more dps for the character?

3 does army of the dead should be popped with a speed poition like the goul?
Army is a tricky thing to use, it burns 3 runes and has a long cast time.

1) I usually cast army on the pull, you have the time to cast and minimize the risk of a dps loss (if the army dies early). On fights such as saurfang, you won't run the risk of adds being taunted by army. If you're going to cast it mid-fight, I would recommend using ERW to minimize impact on your rotation.

2) Army is a dps gain in most cases. Bear in mind, the army needs to live the full duration.

3) If you're casting pre-pull, no potions need to be taken. However, if you're pre-potting (such as the armor pot), then pop the potion first. If you're casting mid-fight, then yes just like the ghoul, gargolye, DRW, the armies stats are based on yours at cast time definitely pot before the cast.
#2582SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Rankochan
"Halfpint"

2) Army is a dps gain in most cases. Bear in mind, the army needs to live the full duration.

Something to add to this, It gains significantly more DPS by using it after a Heroism or Bloodlust is cast in the raid, and by using a haste potion and any on use trinkets should be used prior to casting it as well. This applies to Summon Gargoyle as well for Unholy DK's I am not sure about DRW for blood but I can guess that it does, though i may be way off on that, I don't play Blood nor will I ever do so, so I have no idea.
#2583SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pintofbrew
Originally Posted by Narshe311
Question about Frost tanking.

Shadai states in his DK guide that Frost use this rotation to aoe tank: HB>BB>BB (or D&D instead of last BB). His single target rotation is: HB>OB>BS and so on. This rotation ignores applying Blood Plague.

Suno's DK guide shows aoe as follows: DnD-IT-PS-Pest then TAB-HB/Pest/BloodBoil. Single target: IT-PS-OB-BS-BS IT-PS-OB-OB

I follow Shadai's method (and have HB glyph), and do fine for threat, but a guildy has been arguing that Suno's rotation is correct and im wrong. Im just wondering if one rotation is wrong and the other is right, or if both can be used effectively. Im also wondering how much better Frost threat could even be applying both diseases instead of just Frost Fever.
The other poster is correct, discussing which is "correct" is academic. There is no absolute in tanking terms, merely enough. I find it much more critical to decide whether you need immediate and high AoE TPS or you can deal with slightly lower, higher overall TPS.

DnD is great for threat, but generally not worth much in front-load. If your AoE is over-eager it may result in a few stray mobs; For this reason I suggest HB-BB-BB-BT-DnD personally. Adding BP and spreading with Pestilence is two GCDs worth of time, which will start adding 350 or so damage to your threat on every mob about 5sec into the pull. Hardly worth bothering. FF isn't so much a threat tool as it is an attack-speed debuff and a method to increase the size of BB (remember BB only needs 1 disease to do it's max dmg).
#2584SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Khrala
Spreading Ebon Plague on Saurfang Adds
I've noticed in the Unholy thread some folks mentioning they are spreading ebon plague on the blood beasts that Saurfang spawns. Obviously that would help the caster dps. We have always said (maybe incorrectly) "Don't use any AE of any kind," which keeps the beasts from attacking melee (and giving Saurfang extra blood points). How do you all do that fight? Do you spread diseases on the beasts or not?
#2585SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3gia
If you can get your rotation to line up properly, then yes it's a good idea to pest when the adds spawn. It will increase raid dps and your own dps as well. Just taking a quick look at my last Saurfang parse shows 50k damage on the beasts over 5 waves, which is about 10k dmg for each pestilence and I didn't even do that well since I was doing it 3-4 seconds late. Still, it's more damage than a single blood strike.

As for threat concerns, this may depend on what your raid is doing when they spawn, but so far I've never had them turn on me.
#2586SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Afabar
Saurfang adds have a buff reducing AOE and Disease damages. The added damage to your damage meter is not really whats count but adding the 13% magical damage bonus (if Unholy spec) when they pop is. If your distant dps switch fast when they pop, there is no risk that they come back to you.

When Blizzard changed what proc'ed Bryntroll, it also affecting what could proc FC. The nerf was a week or two after 3.3 release.
#2591SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3awain
Quick question for you all regarding runes for tanking (DW). I'm def capped without using Nerubian Carapace so would I best best using 2xSwordbreaking for extra parry, or some different combo? Until now I've been using NC on MH and SB on OH.

Thank you.
#2592SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amiro
NC vs SB can be simplified to 1% health vs 0.5% avoidance. Ask yourself what you want more and rune for it
#2593SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pintofbrew
Quite correct. Also note that while defence lowers in value the further past the cap you go, it still is usable avoidance, and until the Miss Cap it's pretty solid usable avoidance. Both runewords are immune to dininishing returns, however, so if you're def-capped by not much, you'll still have excellent return on your defence with NC.

SB will increase your RS uptime, as all 4% are parry, while only 2% of the avoidance granted by NC can proc RS.

 12345678910111213
Time between tick03.07803.95303.01603.20303.00004.53102.90704.15603.04705.20302.90704.62502.719
Time between Pestilence and tick01.17202.79701.89103.00000.92203.12501.07803.07800.46803.07800.68803.06201.797

Why even number seems to delay Disease tick?
First possible reason: Uneven number are when the adds pop. That would means that diseases are not delayed when they are spread to another targets. But when I have made the first pestilence, there was no add but disease ticks without any delay.
Second possible reason: There is a strange behavior on GoD code on Blizzard server that delay disease half the time.

If someone has other GoD logs he could share so I could take a look to found out what is really going on.
#2595SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Larisroth
Interesting observation there.
Does the timing recover properly? or does it delay the whole cycle? I'd be curious to see the frost fever ticks as well?
Looking at your worldoflogs, the delays are pretty random. The first 4 refreshes don't delay frost fever, but the 5th does, while it leaves blood plague alone. It's hard to tell, but it appears that if you cast pest within a short period of the tick, then the next tick is delayed. Maybe it sets the next tick to occur 3 seconds after the pest effect.

That matches up pretty well with your pattern.

The pattern actually looks a lot like the one I saw when I was flipping diseases, where I was amazed that with my latency I pretty much always got the correct number of ticks.

#2598SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3
Edited onundefined		Powerslave
Asking as a raid leader,is a frost dk spec'd into Improved Icy Talons a valid replacement for the enhancement shaman?

Can an unholy dk pick up two onehands and spec into frost dualwield or does it need special gearing?(I read you should still gem strength,but do you generally pick up different kind of items?)

Last edited by Powerslave : 02/02/10 at 11:29 AM.
#2599SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pintofbrew
I assume you're using a non-English client, as there is no Improved Stolen Heat. What I suspect you mean is Improved Icy Touch, which grants 20% melee haste to the raid.

The haste given by IIT does not stack with (improved) Windfurry Totem. However, a Frost DK doesn't offer any other buffs. the 10% AP from (shaman) Unleashed Rage can only be given by a Blood DK or a Marksman Hunter. It is not possible to give both IIT (20% melee haste) and Abomination's Rage (10% AP) as a DK with the same spec. Is a Frost DK a replacement for an Enh Shaman? No, he's a replacement for a Windfurry Totem.

There is currently no such thing as Unholy DW spec. No UH specs that are viable in any way with two 1h weapons since 3.3.0.

There is currently no reason to ever have a Frost DK in a raid unless you don't have that 20% melee haste. Frost is so far behind Unholy it's only a benefit if it provides the raid buff.
#2600SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Esh-324
Originally Posted by Powerslave
Asking as a raid leader,is a frost dk spec'd into Improved Icy Talons a valid replacement for the enhancement shaman?

Can an unholy dk pick up two onehands and spec into frost dualwield or does it need special gearing?(I read you should still gem strength,but do you generally pick up different kind of items?)

I noticed that all the suggested specs in the frost dps thread include Improved Stolen Heat so I assume you don't lose that much for it,just asking to be on the safe side before going for my limited Lana'thel attempts for the week.

edit: Thanks to the poster below,fixed the name.It was called Stolen heat/improved stolen heat back in the beta when I played a dk.
A frost DK is a valid replacement for the Windfury totem, though as previously mentioned, they do not provide the 10% AP that some other classes can. For the most part, the gear for Frost and Unholy will be similar enough that if you are lacking that melee haste buff, the raid dps increase will be more then the DK's personal DPS loss. The reason that every Frost Spec has Improved Icy Talons is because Frost DPS < Unholy DPS in almost every situation, so there is no reason to spec Frost if you aren't providing 20% melee haste.

@Pint, I think he is asking about any significant gearing changes going Unholy > Frost, not if DW Unholy is viable.

@Chizzle, Expertise cap isn't that important for Unholy because of how loose the rotation is on GCDs.

Now even though the DnD deals slightly less dmg than hs+ds and doesnt produce death runes last I heard DnD had a threat multiplier of dmg x 1.5 giving it 7123.5total threat. Is my math messed up or would it seem like dropping DnD on just 1 target is still better for threat

I used GoDD and 3/3 Morbidity for the test
#2602SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amiro
Blood tank is very sensitive to armor reduction on target. DnD ignores armor, DS and HS don't. Ask a rogue friend to expose armor on dummy and you will see difference.

#2605SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3darthsyk

Blood tank is very sensitive to armor reduction on target. DnD ignores armor, DS and HS don't. Ask a rogue friend to expose armor on dummy and you will see difference.

#2606SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amiro
Originally Posted by darthsyk
while i understand blood tanking, and HS/DS, is sensitive to ArP, DnD gets significant boost from raid buffs as well. And seeing how according to my impromptu (not necessarily accurate) math DnD gets significantly better aggro it just seems that DnD still nets more aggro than HS/DS.

On a similar note does anyone know an accurate aggro per ability list?
All your skills get boosted from raid buffs. The easiest way to check how much is to choose some steady fight in 25 raid, drop DnD few times during the encounter and look at combat logs how hard it hits compared to HS and DS.

#2608SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Elyasviel
When is the optimal time to use Empowered Rune Weapon?
#2609SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Snob
Originally Posted by Elyasviel
When is the optimal time to use Empowered Rune Weapon?
As a DPS, you won't find it very useful at all. The only times I'll use it during a fight is if I mess up my rotation and go way off, or if I, for some reason, pop AotD in combat instead of before the fight start. Using AotD messes up all your runes and wastes a lot of them. Using ERW right after the channeling time is over, you'll not miss out on too much (4 seconds of DPSing), and most likely benefit a lot more from it than if you didn't.

If you're a tank, you'll probably find it useful in situations where you NEED runes but don't have any.
#2610SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Originally Posted by Elyasviel
When is the optimal time to use Empowered Rune Weapon?
For Unholy DPS it's usually best to use it right after the first cycle and Summon Gargoyle, your first rotation becomes IT-PS-BS-BT/SS-SS-Gargoyle-ERW-SS-SS-BS-BS. The reason to use it as DPS at all is that for Unholy your damage per Global CD is higher for rune abilities than for runic power abilities (with the exception of Summon Gargoyle), so if you use ERW right at the start you'll be able to use it again at the 5:15 minute mark (assuming the fight lasts that long). That way you shift your damage composition a bit from runic power abilities to higher-dps rune abilities.
#2611SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pintofbrew
As a tank, I find it most useful when you're low on threat, mostly at a pull. It's also fairly useful if you're coming up to a phase where you'll be needing RP and know you won't have enough (perhaps you need enough to make sure you can both AMS and counter, like tanking Lady). Though it's more useful as Frost tank, as you use up runes two-by-two.

As a Blood tank it's only use so far that I've seen is if you're low on health and you could use two Death Strikes within the next 3sec. That, or if you pull with DnD-IT-PS-HS and want to frontload a lot of threat.

Looking a little deeper on wowhead, it appears to increase melee/ranged haste rating by 480 for 6 seconds, has a 100% proc (couldn't quite figure out if this is 100% on white melee, or if heart strike etc. will proc, spells apparently do not.) with either a 45 or 60 second ICD.

I realize it's only 13 dps, but there doesn't seem to be any major reason not to use it (I realize haste isn't a great stat, and that the +3% crit damage is nice, but rawr usually seems to be correct), and in fact it is actually a little cheaper than Relentless Earthsiege Diamond on my server.

#2627SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Arcel
Understanding Glyph of Disease
Hello everyone,
I've read through a couple of threads and come to the conclusion about Glyph of Disease (GoD) below.
  1. Against 1 target, GoD does not refresh Improved Icy Talons (IIT), Tundra Stalker (TS), and Rage of Rivendare (RoR) effects.
  2. Against 1+ targets, GoD refreshes IIT, TS, and RoR effects.
  3. Because GoD refreshes disease durations, Ebon Plaguebringer (EP) is refreshed in either situation.

Is the above summary correct?

Many thanks in advance

(Edited to use list in Rich Text editor.)
#2628SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3• Darkside
I think the TS/RoR effects are refresed by GoD, but everything else looks like it's correct.

#2630SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Originally Posted by Arcel
I read in the Unholy DPS thread that RoR was not refreshed. I assumed that TS would use a similar mechanic. Can anyone clarify? Maybe I read something that was a bit dated.
As far as I remember the initial BP doesn't have the RoR-multiplier (because you apply BP and BP applies RoR). So you need to refresh it once such that it gets the multiplier. After that there shouldn't be an issue.
#2631SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Arcel
Originally Posted by Amroo
As far as I remember the initial BP doesn't have the RoR-multiplier (because you apply BP and BP applies RoR). So you need to refresh it once such that it gets the multiplier. After that there shouldn't be an issue.
Do you mean refresh with PS or will a GoD Pestilence work too? I'd investigate myself but my computer is giving me some trouble.

As far as I understand, [Glyph of Disease] only refreshes the duration a stated in its tooltip. If it actually reapplied the diseases, then RoR would be applied on the primary target. I'm leaning to the side that thinks that this is not actually the case.

If I also understand correctly, since FF and BP tick every 3 seconds, using GoD to refresh the durations would mean a guaranteed clipping of the last tick - with or without Epidemic. Again, correct me if I'm wrong here but this appears to be a DPS loss meaning that this glyph is more so towards tanks than it already appears.

Thanks for clearing this up.
#2632SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amroo
Perhaps I didn't phrase it correctly, RoR is never really "applied". It's better to understand it as a passive ability of your character that checks every time you cast anything / deal damage if the target has BP on it (doesn't have to be your BP).
Now, when you cast your first PS the target doesn't have BP on it. So, PS doesn't get the 10% damage bonus. At the same time PS applies BP to your target, but at the time of applying BP wasn't on your target, yet (because you're applying it right now). So your first BP doesn't get the benefit from RoR. Because GoD rolls any percentage modifiers on your diseases (like Tricks of the Trade and, in this case, RoR) you would miss out on these 10% for the entire duration of the fight. That's why you will have to recast PS when BP is up so that you get those 10%.

As for your second question, GoD refreshes durations of your diseases, it does not reapply them and therefore does not (or should not) affect when they tick. So you should not lose any ticks. However, I remember some reports of BP ticks behaving strangely with regards to GoD, but I don't recall what it was exactly.
#2633SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3lancelol

but! on this screenshot http://img39.imageshack.us/i/23016129.jpg/ The scourge strike hits are obv merged. Now the guy who posted this dont even know how it happend. Can anyone tell me how to get MSBT or any battletext to merge the two SS hits?

#2636SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Skye McCloud
Searched through the thread, found nothing to answer this:

I normally run as Blood tank, though I'll use Frost for trash and for heroics for the AOE threat generation.

However, I'm starting to find it difficult to maintain threat in AOE situations, as the spec I'm using doesn't talent for D&D.

I'm wondering if I can get more out of Unholy spec, in terms of AOE threat, yet maintain or get even higher mitigation than I have now, and just how well Unholy tanking can perform at single-target tanking with the changes on Scourge Strike. In both situations, would the rotations remain the same?

#2637SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pintofbrew
Unholy tanking has inferior mitigation tools to both Blood and Frost tanking specs. Some tanks are experimenting with it in the Suno thread, but it's quite hard to compete with (a) the higher health and effective health of Blood, (b) the 2% damage reduction, +50% duration on IBF and 3% extra avoidance of Frost and (c) the TPS generation of either. There is no way, as you put it, to stay Unholy and take less beating / be less likely to die than either a Frost or a Blood tank.

The proc-nerf which made Necrosis not affect RS hit Unholy TPS pretty hard, sadly.

If you want more AoE threat than Frost currently offers, and this is particularly relevant to 5mans and trash, may I suggest an GoHB frost spec, specced into DnD, with Glyph of DnD (and perhaps 2*T10 set bonus). Pull with GoHB-HB, then park a monster-sized DnD under the pull. You can practically AFK for the rest of the fight.
#2638SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Amiro
Recently I noticed, that Rime's HB generate no RP. Does Chill of the Grave make it generate 5 RP?
#2639SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3kurokaze
Originally Posted by lancelol
So I have done some extensiv searching for this, everyone seems to say its not possible.
but! on this screenshot Imageshack - 23016129.jpg - Uploaded by deza5t3r The scourge strike hits are obv merged. Now the guy who posted this dont even know how it happend. Can anyone tell me how to get MSBT or any battletext to merge the two SS hits?
With Parrot (and I assume most/all other SCT-type mods), Scourge Strike physical and shadow components are merged in the same manner as multiple hits from any other ability such as Whirlwind or Death and Decay. Specifically, combat log events are not shown immediately by default - they are shown 0.1 sec (or similar) after they occur, and any additional combat log event that occurs in that 0.1 sec window that the mod thinks is from the same ability will get merged as in the screenshot.

The reason this does not typically result in Scourge Strike merging is because the shadow component does not occur simultaneous to the physical component but slightly afterward. In my experience, maybe 1/10 of scourge strikes appear 'merged' and the rest are separate, using Parrot's default merge threshold (0.1 sec). You can raise this threshold to make the merging more consistent; the tradeoff is that your damage will display that much later. There may also be an option to disable merging on specific abilities.
#2640SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pintofbrew
Originally Posted by Amiro
Recently I noticed, that Rime's HB generate no RP. Does Chill of the Grave make it generate 5 RP?
Think of it this way: Anything that -costs- one Rune generates 10. Anything that costs more than one rune, generates 15. CotG specifies that "when you use OB/IT/HB", which is a different clause. You will also note, CotG RP is not generated at the same time as the nominal 15RP. Stand at a target dummy, cast only one OB and you'll see first 15RP immediately as the OB hits, then a further 5 about a quarter of a second later.

Rime-HB doesn't generate the nominal 15 but does generate the CotG 5.

#2653SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Pintofbrew
All yellow physical abilities, for all classes in the game, versus a 83 lvl mob, require 8% hit. As frost you gain 3 of those from talents, meaning you must gain a further 5 from gear, or 4+dranei. All spells versus a 83lvl mob require 17% to cap. You gain 0/2/3 depending on spec variant from Virulence. You also gain a further 3% from raid buffs. The rest you gain from gear. You absolutely do not need to cap Hit for spells as a Frost DK.

You gain Spell Hit % differently from Physical Hit %. Refer to different tabs on your char sheet: 8.0x% Phys is about 11.2x% Spell.

Let me repeat this: You do not need to be Hitcapped for spells, nor is it a DPS gain to reach the hitcap, for spells (with respect to gearing for more Str/crit). A very small percentage of your damage is from spells.
#2654SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Janisko

#2659SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3vukae
Originally Posted by Skye McCloud
Does the range increase from the talent Icy Reach have any effect on the area the damage is dealt, or does it only affect the casting range? (In other words, can targets be further away from what I hit with Howling Blast if I have the Icy Reach talent?) I currently assume no, but I want to make sure.

#2661SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3darthsyk
with the new changes to Icy Touch's threat (Icy Touch: This ability now causes a very high amount of threat while the death knight is in Frost Presence.) for pure threat generation are DKs (im bood but any spec really) just spam IT with very frost/death rune available? seems like an incredibly dumb mechanic, but one that may be necessary on aggro intense fights. and if so, does that mean speccing out of imp DS and GoDS?? I personaly really like imp DS for the heal component, especialy on fights like sindragosa and LK after the big hits (breath, soul reaper) but GoDS??
#2662SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Kaejin
If you love to gimp your DPS in favor of excessive threat, then you will be spamming IT.

The change to IT threat is for snap aggro, not sustained threat. DK's have no sustained threat issues, so spamming IT is a complete waste. The additional threat is so a DK tank can open up on a Boss (since IT is nearly always used as an opener because it's ranged, applies a disease, and applied the 20% melee haste debuff) and the DPS can start to full-on DPS right away without the tank having a heart attack.

Extra threat past what you need to hold aggro from the DPS is wasted threat. The DPS you lose by spamming IT is actually useful, and you hurt your group by neglecting it.
#2663SourcePosted onundefinedTwinkielock
I was wondering in standard PVP builds Improved Icy Touch isn't taken? Wouldn't it make sense to slow the attack speed of your target? Also I was wondering if anyone could point me in the direction of a good BG build? Everything I find on here and other sites are all for arena.

#2677SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3dexx
In patch 3.3.3 - for a tank in mainly ilvl232 gear (eg T9 set) what would be the expected threat difference between 2H frost and DW?
#2678SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Fyrestryke
Originally Posted by takeitsqueezy
My question is this: Is there a point where crit diminishes in importance? I know the conventional wisdom is to put an inscribed in a yellow slot that yields the bonus' listed in the Unholy thread, but am I wasting stats by using 10str/10crit over 20str at some point? Or is it always 14str/10crit > 20 str
There is no simple answer to a question like this. You basically have to sim your stats + & - the changes and see what works best. Those #'s are VERY genralized based on typical stats at those gear levels. Having a couple different pieces than the set it was simmed with, or gear spread out over multiple gear levels will completely throw off the numbers.
#2679SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3RoflCat

#2680SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Krenom
1 question:

Is Expertise worth gemming for? Or is it a whenever-it's-on-gear stat?

Considers Unholy DPS guide on this very forum claims that Strength is favoured by a 3.03 stat weight, while Expertise has 1.72 stat weight for my gear level. Is this interpretation true? or am I wrong?

Thanks in advance
#2681SourcePosted onPatch 2.4.3Etio
Originally Posted by Krenom
1 question:

Is Expertise worth gemming for? Or is it a whenever-it's-on-gear stat?

Considers Unholy DPS guide on this very forum claims that Strength is favoured by a 3.03 stat weight, while Expertise has 1.72 stat weight for my gear level. Is this interpretation true? or am I wrong?

Thanks in advance
You should run a EP simulation of your own gear to be sure, but generally, yes expertise is a weaker stat for unholy. This is because Unholy actually has a free GCD or two during the rotation and because of this dodged attacks won't set you back much. If you are at the point where diseases are falling off before you can finish every rotation because you keep getting dodged attacks, then you should invest in "some" expertise. However for Blood and Frost it is increasingly valuable because these rotations are much tighter and rely more on their physical attacks landing.

[note: I'm the only person who can actually slow Valkyries during p2 so Desecration is must-to-take]
I'm not sure if 10% damage from both diseases (Black Ice) actuually wins over 2 extra points in Bladed Armor (more AP scaling with disease damage) and extra 5% crit for Blood Plague (assuming use of 4p t9). Cold logic says it is, but I cant get calculator to confirm or deny it for some reason :|. Any opiniony or advices?

We run setup with only 3 ranged, and just 2 of them (spriest and fire mage) being strong at AoE, so my diseases support is very usefull. It's gonna be RLY rng-based for us as any ranged being ported to Frostmourne means mostly like explidong spirits.

I'm allso not quite sure whare should I post this. Thanks.

I'm currently going to try both meta-achievements on Lich King 10m encounter (last for our drakes), and I'm considering changing build for max AoE during last phase (non-exploding Vile Spirits). Ofcourse the only way of damaging them (and applying ebon plaguebringer) for DK is using Pestilence while they spawn. Now, assuming I meanage to reach and DoT all of them
You won't be able too

Originally Posted by Tushee
I'm trying to get my build and gear as good as possible for AoE (DoT damage). I'm considering use of 4pc t9 and AP trinket (245 Death's Choice) instead of ArP trinket (277 Deathbringer's Will) and 4pc t10 (and ofc crit meta instead of agi one). Now, I also consider changing my build a bit to boots DoT damage (as single-target DPS requirements are joke in 10m anyways).
While I won't say you should not do it, I did the achivement with my regular trinkets DBW 264 and 258 deaths choice with agility meta gem (changing meta is marginal and should not be a concern) I used my 4 x tier 10, I mean considering the massiv strength boost and the 3% damage from the 4 set. I am pretty sure this will rival your crit from 4 x tier 9. Also consider that someone has to do single target dps or the encounter will never end here just keeping your regular gear and spec will be beneficial aswell

First of all it's 10 man, there is no need what so ever to spec into Desercration, you can just chains of ice it.
secondly thats not true you said yourself you got a shadowpriest & a fire mage both of which has very nice slows (mind flay will be the best option here) fair better then you specing some semi retarded spec when he can just use his "main nuke" not knowing the rest of your setup I would guess there is other slow options (frost shock forexample) and multiple of stuns. it's one add .. one! trust me it's handable without you respecing.

Originally Posted by Tushee
I'm not sure if 10% damage from both diseases (Black Ice) actuually wins over 2 extra points in Bladed Armor (more AP scaling with disease damage) and extra 5% crit for Blood Plague (assuming use of 4p t9). Cold logic says it is, but I cant get calculator to confirm or deny it for some reason :|. Any opiniony or advices?
sub blood is better then sub frost, if you read the TOC unholy thread that was made obvious in there.

Originally Posted by Tushee
We run setup with only 3 ranged, and just 2 of them (spriest and fire mage) being strong at AoE, so my diseases support is very usefull. It's gonna be RLY rng-based for us as any ranged being ported to Frostmourne means mostly like explidong spirits.
We did this with two more ranged (a warlock & a resto shaman going elemental) and I would strongly sugest you sit a melee for a warlock as SoC is ace here.
on our first port it was our spriest (our best aoe) and we still got all the sprits down so it is doable with 3 but if you get a ranged ported you are screwed. Do yourself a favor bring an extra ranged! Also you will/should use chains of ice alot on these it is amazingly usefull and buys your ranged much time as they start to come down chains them. Alittle sidenote elemental shamans can knock them back.

I wish you good luck, but I strongly sugest bringing more ranged dps, and use only 2 healers.
the drakes are worth it my friend.
